original: nyes pa gzhan yang brgal ba'i don du gzhan la 'dri ba ni yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brgal ba'i don du gzhan la 'dri ba ni yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another fault: “For the sake of argument, one asks another, ‘What is that?’”

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i don dam 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i don dam 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: “For that purpose” means for the purpose of grasping the true ultimate.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang 'dzin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang 'dzin pa yang ngo //
translated: “That also” means both the pleasure and the grasping.

original: de las ni rtogs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de las ni rtogs pa nyid las so //
translated: “From that” means from the realization itself.

original: rtogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Another realization” has the character of engagement.

original: 'on te rgyu med par 'byung ba na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med par 'byung ba na /
translated: But if it arises without a cause,

original: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then it would arise everywhere and at all times.

original: ji ltar mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: “As it is seen” is stated.

original: sngar ni thob par bya ba tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / phyis zhugs pa'i rjes thogs su yang thob par bya ba tha dad pa tshad ma med pa'i phyir ji ltar tha dad par rtogs /
analyzed: sngar ni thob par bya ba tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / phyis zhugs pa'i rjes thogs su yang thob par bya ba tha dad pa tshad ma med pa'i phyir ji ltar tha dad par rtogs /
translated: Previously, one does not realize the difference in what is to be attained, and later, immediately after engagement, there is no valid cognition of the difference in what is to be attained. How is the difference realized?

original: 'dis ni zhas bya ba nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhas bya ba nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the commentary on “that itself” and “previously.”

original: don bya ba tha dad pa tshad mas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba tha dad pa tshad mas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logically possible for different objects to be established by valid cognition.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid don byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid don byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that the nature of the object is the nature of appearance, which is the performance of a function.

original: snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo don bya ba de ni rmi lam la yang yod pa des na /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo don bya ba de ni rmi lam la yang yod pa des na /
translated: The nature of the object that appears is the performance of a function, and that exists even in a dream.

original: rmi lam dang gzhan dag mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam dang gzhan dag mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, a dream is similar to something else.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: “Suchness” refers to the nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa yang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to the conceptualization.

original: rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “Not so” refers to the grasped and the grasper.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni don nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni don nyid do //
translated: “That itself” refers to the object itself.

original: ji ltar pha rol yin par brjod ces bya ba ni shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rig par bya ba ma yin pa yang shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid kyis rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol yin par brjod ces bya ba ni shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rig par bya ba ma yin pa yang shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid kyis rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “How can it be said to be other?”—because it is not tenable that awareness is included within awareness, and because it is not tenable that what is not an object of awareness is external to awareness.

original: 'on te rig pa ma yin pa'i dus nyid na sngon po gzhan gyis rtogs pa des phyi rol yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa ma yin pa'i dus nyid na sngon po gzhan gyis rtogs pa des phyi rol yin no zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that blue is external because it is perceived by another awareness that is not itself aware of blue,

original: gzhan gyis myong ba min na des zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba min na des zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that “if it is not experienced by another, then it is not that.”

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis sngon po myong na ji ltar phyi rol du gyur pa nyid kyis rtogs par yang gal te sngon po myong na de zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis sngon po myong na ji ltar phyi rol du gyur pa nyid kyis rtogs par yang gal te sngon po myong na de zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If blue is experienced by another person, how can it be external? It is not tenable that it is perceived because of being external.

original: 'on te der yang skyes bu gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang skyes bu gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is awareness by another person,

original: de la brjod pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brjod pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said that “it is not that.”

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression “another refutation” refers to the following.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis myong ba gang yin pa bdag gis ci ltar nges pa yin /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis myong ba gang yin pa bdag gis ci ltar nges pa yin /
translated: How can I be certain that what another person experiences is the same as what I experience?

original: de 'bras zhes bya ba @271a * //
analyzed: de 'bras zhes bya ba @271a * //
translated: The response to that is, “The effect of that . . .”

original: sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i 'bras bu dga' ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de las nges pa yin no zhe na de min te zhes 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i 'bras bu dga' ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de las nges pa yin no zhe na de min te zhes 'gog par byed do //
translated: If you say that the effect of seeing blue and so on is the experience of pleasure and so on, and that is what you are certain of, then the response to that is, “That is not so.”

original: ji lar 'bras bu rab tu ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ji lar 'bras bu rab tu ma grub ce na /
translated: How is it that the effect is not established?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blang snas kyang sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blang snas kyang sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression “another refutation” refers to the following.

original: rjes su dpag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is, “Inference . . .”

original: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i yul can gyi yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i yul can gyi yin gyi /
translated: Inference has a universal as its object,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not have a particular as its object.

original: des na dga' ba la sogs pa mthong ba la gang yin pa de rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du song ba can yin no zhes grub mod /
analyzed: des na dga' ba la sogs pa mthong ba la gang yin pa de rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du song ba can yin no zhes grub mod /
translated: Therefore, it is established that the experience of pleasure and so on is preceded by the experience of a thing that has that form.

original: bdag gi mthong ba'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi mthong ba'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the object seen by me is preceded by seeing.

original: de gcig nyid bya ba ni ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa de gzig nyid yin pa de bzhin du spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba de nyid las rang gi bde ba dang gzhan gyi bde ba dag kyang gcig nyid du
analyzed: de gcig nyid bya ba ni ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa de gzig nyid yin pa de bzhin du spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba de nyid las rang gi bde ba dang gzhan gyi bde ba dag kyang gcig nyid du
translated: The effect of the single thing, just as that blue, etc., appears, is just that, and from that very effect of the bristling of the hairs, etc., one’s own pleasure and another’s pleasure are established as being the same.

original: grub par thal lo //
analyzed: grub par thal lo //
translated: It follows that they are the same.

original: gal te gzhan de'i bde bar gzhan kho na yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan de'i bde bar gzhan kho na yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that another’s pleasure is just another,

original: de'i tshe gzhan de'i gzung ba sngon po la sogs pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan de'i gzung ba sngon po la sogs pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the object apprehended by that other, the blue, etc., will also be another.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yul tha dad pas gcig nyid du bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yul tha dad pas gcig nyid du bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Since pleasure, etc., are different objects, it is not possible to establish them as the same.

original: zhe na / de nyid du na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhe na / de nyid du na zhes gsungs so //
translated: In that case, it is said.

original: yul tha dad pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the difference of objects is not established.

original: bde ba de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyid la gzhan dag ces bya ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod mod gal te bdag dang gzhan gyi lus la gnas🔽pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs pa gcig ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyid la gzhan dag ces bya ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod mod gal te bdag dang gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs pa gcig ma yin la /
translated: If you say that the pleasure and so on that exist in one’s own body and the pleasure and so on that exist in the body of another are not the same,

original: de tsam gyis ni bde ba la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni bde ba la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du grub po zhe na /
translated: and that pleasure and so on are established as being different merely by virtue of existing in one’s own body and the body of another,

original: brjod pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: we reply: “Other” means that🔽the pleasure and so on that exist in one’s own body and the pleasure and so on that exist in the body of another are different.

original: spu ldang ba la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa yang sngon po la sogs pa gzung bar bya ba yang gzhan yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: spu ldang ba la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa yang sngon po la sogs pa gzung bar bya ba yang gzhan yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the apprehended blue and so on are also different?

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: We also state another refutation:

original: gal te spu ldang ba la sogs pa yang bdag cag gi rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te spu ldang ba la sogs pa yang bdag cag gi rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin te /
translated: If you say that the pleasure and so on that exist in one’s own body and the pleasure and so on that exist in the body of another are not different,

original: de lta ma yin na de dag kyang snang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin pa /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag kyang snang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin pa /
translated: then it is not tenable that they appear as different.

original: de'i tshe bdag cag gi rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa de dag las skyes bu gzhan gyis tshim pa la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa der rtogs par ji ltar gsal te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag cag gi rig pa'i nang du 'dus pa de dag las skyes bu gzhan gyis tshim pa la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa der rtogs par ji ltar gsal te /
translated: At that time, how could it be clear that the satisfaction, etc. of another person appears in the awareness that is included in our awareness?

original: ji ltar @271b des bdag gi rig par 'dus pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dpag par mi 'os so //
analyzed: ji ltar @271b des bdag gi rig par 'dus pa'i spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dpag par mi 'os so //
translated: How could the bristling of the hairs, etc. that are included in our awareness be a measure of the satisfaction, etc. of another?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan te /
translated: “ That” refers to another.

original: rgyu des na rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba gnyis gcig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu des na rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba gnyis gcig nyid ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, the two kinds of happiness, one’s own and another’s, are not the same.

original: gzhan gyi bde ba yod pa'i phyir dang / kho bo cag ni bde ba can ni med pa'i phyir ro zhe na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba yod pa'i phyir dang / kho bo cag ni bde ba can ni med pa'i phyir ro zhe na //
translated: Because the happiness of another exists, and because we do not have the happiness of the blissful ones.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni kho bo'i gzung bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni kho bo'i gzung bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is “If I grasp . . . ”

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de'i gzung ba dang bdag cag gi gzung ba tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de'i gzung ba dang bdag cag gi gzung ba tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the object of that and the object of us are not different,

original: spu ldang ba la sogs par gyur pa de bzhin du bde ba yang tha dad pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: spu ldang ba la sogs par gyur pa de bzhin du bde ba yang tha dad pa med pa yin na /
translated: then just as there is the bristling of the hairs, etc., so too there is no difference in happiness.

original: spu ldang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khyed kyi khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: spu ldang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khyed kyi khas blangs dgos so //
translated: You must accept that the body hairs stand on end and so forth.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If,🔽in that case,

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la'o //
translated: in that case,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni bde ba ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni bde ba ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med pa'o //
translated: the statement here is that pleasure is not essentially different.

original: gzung bar bya ba de la yang tha dad pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba de la yang tha dad pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that which is to be apprehended, there would be no difference.

original: de lta na yang bzung ba 'di lkog tu gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang bzung ba 'di lkog tu gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, this apprehension would not be hidden.

original: gzhan gyi lan ni tshad ma gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni tshad ma gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response of the other is, “By another valid cognition.”

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement here is, “If,

original: thun mong nyid du snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum las so //
analyzed: thun mong nyid du snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum las so //
translated: from direct perception, which has the character of a common appearance,🔽and that,

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshig kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshig kyang ngo //
translated: which is the word,🔽is what,

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi thun mong ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi thun mong ba nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the commonality,

original: phan tshun lhan cig pa nyid kyi tshig gis mngon sum dag tshad ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig pa nyid kyi tshig gis mngon sum dag tshad ma yin no snyam na /
translated: the words of mutual simultaneity, direct perceptions are valid cognitions.”

original: rab rib can gnyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Two with eye disease” is said.

original: de nyid yin zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid yin zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
translated: “That itself” is the capacity.

original: med pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa nyid do //
translated: It is non-existent.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: “The nature of cognition” is the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin gyi rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin gyi rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the nature of mere representation, not the nature of the cognizer.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because of the non-existence of external objects.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni blo nyid la'o //🔽sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa can gang yin pa de la ste /
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni blo nyid la'o // sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa can gang yin pa de la ste /
translated: “In that itself” means in the cognition itself.🔽That which has the nature of apprehending blue, etc. by its own essence,

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: in that which has the nature of manifestation.

original: dpe 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no example at all. This is the meaning.

original: bzlog pa med pa la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa med pa la'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa med pa la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa med pa la'o //
translated: “In the absence of reversal” means in the absence of difference from manifestation.

original: dpe de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dpe de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that example?

original: ri bong gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The rabbit’s horns,” etc.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po gsal ba la ltos nas gsal ba dang dngos po dag tha mi dad par dmigs pa ni mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po gsal ba la ltos nas gsal ba dang dngos po dag tha mi dad par dmigs pa ni mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Directly perceived” means that the object and the clarity that is the cognizer are not different, and that is the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: rang gi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po'i gzhung @272a * //
analyzed: rang gi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po'i gzhung @272a * //
translated: “Its own part” and so on are the opponent’s argument.

original: ngo ; /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ngo ; /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas pa la dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa na rang gi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa na rang gi ngo bo'am /
translated: When proving that Buddhists have no objects of observation, the proof that they have no objects of observation by way of their own nature or

original: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin gyis dmigs pa med pa sgrub pa de la rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin gyis dmigs pa med pa sgrub pa de la rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med pa ni /
translated: external objects is that they have no objects of observation by way of their own nature.

original: bdag cag kyang 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: We also assert that.

original: des na dag pa nyid ces bya ba khyad par dang bral ba phyogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dag pa nyid ces bya ba khyad par dang bral ba phyogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, “purity” would be a position free from distinctions.

original: de yang mngon sum gyis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis gsal ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is directly perceived.

original: gal te skyon can gyi shes pas gzung ba'i don ni dag par rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te skyon can gyi shes pas gzung ba'i don ni dag par rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is suitable for an object apprehended by a faulty consciousness to be pure,

original: gang gi tshe skyon can gyi shes pa gzung ba nyid 'ga' yang mi srid pa de'i ci zhig dgag par bya zhes ston pa ni skyon can shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyon can gyi shes pa gzung ba nyid 'ga' yang mi srid pa de'i ci zhig dgag par bya zhes ston pa ni skyon can shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the line “What is it that is to be refuted by a defective cognition?”

original: 'di la lan gzung med ces bya ba'o //🔽ma bzung ba'i pha rol gyi don la gzung bar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan gzung med ces bya ba'o // ma bzung ba'i pha rol gyi don la gzung bar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The line “There is no way to respond to this” means🔽that the apprehension of an object that is not apprehended is the apprehension of an object that is not apprehended.

original: gzung bar mngon par rlom pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa la mi 'thad pa ci yod de /
analyzed: gzung bar mngon par rlom pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa la mi 'thad pa ci yod de /
translated: What is unreasonable about refuting the conception that there is an object that is apprehended?

original: des na skyon can gyi shes pas gzung ba la gdon mi za bar ltos pa ci yod /
analyzed: des na skyon can gyi shes pas gzung ba la gdon mi za bar ltos pa ci yod /
translated: Therefore, what is the necessity of the apprehension of an object by a defective cognition?

original: gal te gzung ba nyid gnod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba nyid gnod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the apprehension itself is defective,

original: ma bzung ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: ma bzung ba ni ma yin na /
translated: then the object is not apprehended.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa'i rang gi phyogs gang yin pa de mi 'grub pa ste /🔽gzung ba gnod pa dang mi ldan pas gzung ba nyid gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa'i rang gi phyogs gang yin pa de mi 'grub pa ste / gzung ba gnod pa dang mi ldan pas gzung ba nyid gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: In that case, the Buddhist’s own position is not established.🔽If the apprehension itself is defective because the object is defective,

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the object is not apprehended because the apprehension is defective.

original: ma bzung ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes khyed cag yod pa nyid du ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: ma bzung ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes khyed cag yod pa nyid du ji ltar brjod /
translated: But if it is not apprehended, it is said to be an object with a basis.🔽

original: ma bzung ba ni 'gag pa nyid bshad kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bzung ba ni 'gag pa nyid bshad kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: How can you say that what is not apprehended exists, since it is said that what is not apprehended is just ceased, not that it exists?

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang 'god pa ni khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang 'god pa ni khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “distinction” is used to indicate another fault that is stated by the opponent.

original: shes pa ni khyad par can no //
analyzed: shes pa ni khyad par can no //
translated: Consciousness is the distinguished.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: The absence of an objective referent is the distinction.

original: ri dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: ri dang me bzhin no //
translated: It is like a mountain and fire.

original: de la khyad par dang khyad par can dag tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga rab tu ma grub par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la khyad par dang khyad par can dag tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga rab tu ma grub par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the distinction and the distinguished are not apprehended as different, both should be said to be unestablished.

original: yang na gang yang rung ba sangs rgyas pa khyad par dang khyad par cag dag rab tu ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang yang rung ba sangs rgyas pa khyad par dang khyad par cag dag rab tu ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, if one of the two, the Buddhist, does not maintain that the distinction and the distinguished are unestablished,

original: tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di la brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di la brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: then the statement “because they are not established as different” is meaningless.

original: /'bras med par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'bras med par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “fruitless” means

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of the agent and the activity of the object of action are established.

original: bram zes rang gi tshig gis gnod pa'i nyes pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: bram zes rang gi tshig gis gnod pa'i nyes pa yang brjod do //
translated: The brahmin himself states the fault of contradiction by his own words.

original: 'di ltar gang gis gzhan dag dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe rgol ba'i tshig de las phyir @272b rgol ba las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes khas blangs nas rgol ba'i tshig brjod pa yin
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis gzhan dag dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe rgol ba'i tshig de las phyir @272b rgol ba las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes khas blangs nas rgol ba'i tshig brjod pa yin
translated: Thus, when one makes the opponent understand the absence of an object, at that time, having accepted that the cognition born from the opponent’s words has an object, one states the opponent’s words.

original: la / rgol ba rang nyid las dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis yul can gyi shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: la / rgol ba rang nyid las dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis yul can gyi shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
translated: And the cognition born from the objectless cognition of the opponent himself also has an object.

original: de lta ma yin gyi gzhan rtogs par byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi gzhan rtogs par byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be untenable to make the other understand.

original: nyes pa 'di yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di yang brjod pa ni /
translated: This fault is also stated.

original: 'chad pa po bstan pa po'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa po bstan pa po'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The one who explains, the teacher,

original: sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa dag gi'o //
translated: of Buddhists and non-Buddhists.

original: shes pa de dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: shes pa de dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: That cognition is not an object, so there is no contradiction with our own words.

original: gal te dmigs pa dang bcas par khas blangs nas dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa dang bcas par khas blangs nas dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub na /
translated: If one accepts that it has an object and then proves that it is not an object,

original: de'i tshe dag rang gi tshig gis gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dag rang gi tshig gis gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time, one’s own words would be undermined.

original: 'on kyang de ltar na mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar na mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But that is not how it is. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa las sngar bzlog pa'i dbye bas brtags pa khyad par can dag gi rab tu dbye ba yod pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa las sngar bzlog pa'i dbye bas brtags pa khyad par can dag gi rab tu dbye ba yod pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na /
translated: Therefore, because of the existence of the classification of special conceptualized distinctions that are reversed in the analysis,

original: sad pa'i shes pa dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don ni brtags na mdzes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don ni brtags na mdzes pa kho na'o //
translated: the meaning of the thesis “The cognition of the waking state is not an object” is only beautiful when analyzed.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dbye ba sred na nges par brtags pa 'di 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dbye ba sred na nges par brtags pa 'di 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one desires the distinction between the distinguished and the distinguisher, then this conceptualization is tenable.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol pos brjod pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang yod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol pos brjod pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang yod par byed do //
translated: Moreover, etc. indicates that there is another fault expressed by the opponent.

original: rgyu des na dmigs pa med pa nyid 'di la bzlog pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i sgras dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid dor ro //
analyzed: rgyu des na dmigs pa med pa nyid 'di la bzlog pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i sgras dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid dor ro //
translated: For that reason, this non-apprehension is called a negation, and the words “non-existent nature” etc. reject the very nature of an existent thing.

original: 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin ni 'on te dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin ni 'on te dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: The question is: “Is non-apprehension the nature of an existent thing or the nature of a non-existent thing?” etc. is not tenable.

original: sun 'byin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of that very refutation is:

original: gal te dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po med pa yin na /🔽de'i tshe ji ltar khyed cag la dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po med pa yin na / de'i tshe ji ltar khyed cag la dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'am /
translated: If non-apprehension is a non-existent thing,🔽then how could you be aware of non-apprehension?

original: rang gi blos kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: rang gi blos kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar rtogs te /
translated: Or how could your own mind be aware of non-apprehension?

original: med pa ni rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma rtogs pa'i don kyang gzhan la bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po ma yin pa de lta na yang brtags nas sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar sangs rgyas pa dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni dmigs pa med pa @273a * //
analyzed: med pa ni rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma rtogs pa'i don kyang gzhan la bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // 'on te dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po ma yin pa de lta na yang brtags nas sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar sangs rgyas pa dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni dmigs pa med pa @273a * //
translated: because it is not tenable that a non-existent is realized, and also because the meaning of non-realization cannot be taught to others.🔽But if the non-existence of the objective support is not a thing, then even though it is imagined, it is established.

original: nyid med la /
analyzed: nyid med la /
translated: The non-existence of the objective support itself does not exist.

original: rtogs pa ci 'dra zhig ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa ci 'dra zhig ste /
translated: What kind of realization is there?

original: cung zad kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi srid do //
translated: Nothing is possible at all.

original: 'on te dmigs pa nyid rtogs na de'i tshe dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa nyid rtogs na de'i tshe dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the objective support itself is realized, then it follows that it is a thing.

original: de lta na yang dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the objective support, which has the characteristic of non-existence, is imagined to be a thing, and is imagined to be the object of inference.

original: gal te dngos po med pa rnam par brtag par bya ba mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa rnam par brtag par bya ba mi nus na /
translated: If a non-existent cannot be imagined,

original: de'i tshe zhig nas med pa la sogs pa la ji ltar rnam par rtog pas 'dod ces sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhig nas med pa la sogs pa la ji ltar rnam par rtog pas 'dod ces sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
translated: Having anticipated this qualm of the Buddhist, he says:

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ngo //
translated: non-existence also.

original: ji ltar na 'di thams cad 'thad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di thams cad 'thad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is this not tenable?

original: 'di ni bshad zin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad zin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: This has been explained.

original: so so ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni chos can shes pa las tha dad pa lta bur te dper na shing ma yin pa las ldog pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: so so ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni chos can shes pa las tha dad pa lta bur te dper na shing ma yin pa las ldog pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: Like a distinction, that is, like the cognition of a subject, for example, like the exclusion from what is not a tree.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi /
translated: Such, that is, the non-existence of an object, is posited in order to make known its own nature.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po tha dad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid dngos po tha dad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the non-existence of an object does not exist as a separate entity.

original: dngos po med pa la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: With regard to non-existence, that is, with regard to the non-existence of an object.

original: lan ni de nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: for that very reason.

original: dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid yin na'o //
translated: Because it is a non-entity.🔽If it were not so,🔽if it were a non-entity,

original: de lta zhes bya ba rtogs pa nyid yin na /🔽dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta zhes bya ba rtogs pa nyid yin na / dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that it is a non-entity.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni med pa la rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni med pa la rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The establishment of the text is that conceptualization would engage a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa de ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That non-entity does not exist as an entity.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa ni dngos po med pa kho na la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa ni dngos po med pa kho na la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization engages only a non-entity.

original: de lta yin dang dmigs pa med pa nyid tha dad par ni dngos po ma yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dmigs pa med pa nyid tha dad par ni dngos po ma yin par grub bo //
translated: If that were so, then the non-existence of an object would be established as a separate entity.🔽What if?

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: This is a doubt.

original: las kyi phyogs la ni shes par bya bas na shes pa yin la /
analyzed: las kyi phyogs la ni shes par bya bas na shes pa yin la /
translated: In the context of action, it is knowledge because it is to be known.

original: de ni dmigs pa med pa nyid dang kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa med pa nyid dang kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: That is precisely what we assert.

original: gang gis de dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par bya ba bum pa la sogs pas ni gzhan rtogs pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gis de dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par bya ba bum pa la sogs pas ni gzhan rtogs pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But there is no other cognition of anything, such as a pot, that is to be established as non-existent.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni las ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni las ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The same is stated in the words “the object” and so on.

original: rtogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes blta bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes blta bar bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood that there is no cognition of anything at all.

original: las su bshad par bya ba ni phyogs 'di ni bshad pa tsam gyis don du rnam par brtag par byas par zad kyi sun 'byin pa ni brjod pa zin to //
analyzed: las su bshad par bya ba ni phyogs 'di ni bshad pa tsam gyis don du rnam par brtag par byas par zad kyi sun 'byin pa ni brjod pa zin to //
translated: The object is explained as follows: This position is merely imagined to be the meaning of the explanation, but the refutation has already been stated.

original: de bzhin du byed pa po la sogs pa yang ngo @273b zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ni las med pa rmi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa po la sogs pa yang ngo @273b zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ni las med pa rmi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the agent and so on are also imagined to be without an object.

original: de med pa ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of that is the non-existence of external objects.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of this is stated in the words “that is not so” and so on.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa'i phyogs dag la yang nyes pa spong ba ni bdag nyid rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa'i phyogs dag la yang nyes pa spong ba ni bdag nyid rtogs par byed do //
translated: The agent and the position of the agent are also refuted by the same faults.

original: 'dis bdag nyid rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod de /
analyzed: 'dis bdag nyid rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod de /
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that this consciousness is aware of itself?

original: phyi'i don 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not project external objects.

original: gal te 'di zhes bya ba sngon po la sogs pa'o //🔽sngon po la sogs pa de rang gi ngo bos te /
analyzed: gal te 'di zhes bya ba sngon po la sogs pa'o // sngon po la sogs pa de rang gi ngo bos te /
translated: If you say, “This” refers to blue, etc.🔽And that blue, etc. is perceived by virtue of its own nature,

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: by virtue of its own clarity.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is, “Now, if blue, etc.”

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa yin na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If blue, etc. is perceived by virtue of its own nature, then this is a proof for the Buddhist.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni khyab pa dang rtag pa'i bdag gis dmigs par bya ba nyid du ma rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni khyab pa dang rtag pa'i bdag gis dmigs par bya ba nyid du ma rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it the case that blue, etc. is not perceived by a permanent, pervasive self?

original: rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni ngas sngon po rtogs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni ngas sngon po rtogs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “I perceive blue” is a conceptual imputation.

original: 'di sun 'byin pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di sun 'byin pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The refutation of that is, “That is not so.”

original: / nga'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni lus dbang po dag gi rang bzhin rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: / nga'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni lus dbang po dag gi rang bzhin rig pa yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness that has the form of “I” is aware of the nature of the body and the faculties.

original: bdag tha dad pa ni rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tha dad pa ni rig pa ma yin no //
translated: But the separate self is not aware.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pas lus la sogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pas lus la sogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes ci ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the consciousness that has the form of “I” is aware of the body, etc.?

original: ngar 'dzin par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: [The root text] says, “Because of the statement, ‘I am emaciated,’ etc.”

original: skul bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan tha dad pa ni rig pa ste rtogs pa med do /
analyzed: skul bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan tha dad pa ni rig pa ste rtogs pa med do /
translated: There is no awareness of a separate self that is the instigator.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag rang gi rgyu las rang gi rang bzhin skye ba la skul bar byed pa gzhan ni dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag rang gi rgyu las rang gi rang bzhin skye ba la skul bar byed pa gzhan ni dmigs pa med do //
translated: Because there is no perception of anything else that instigates the arising of the nature of these faculties, etc., from their own causes.

original: des na bdag tha dad par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bdag tha dad par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: So how could a separate self be established?

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa dag go //
translated: “Their” refers to the faculties, etc.

original: gal te bde ba dang dbang po'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i thang nas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i blo gzhan skye /
analyzed: gal te bde ba dang dbang po'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i thang nas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i blo gzhan skye /
translated: If a cognition that has the aspect of pleasure and the aspect of a sense faculty arises from a cognition that has the aspect of blue, etc.,

original: de'i tshe las dang byed pa po gang las yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe las dang byed pa po gang las yin /
translated: then what is the action and what is the agent?

original: las su bshad pa'i phyogs las ni rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: las su bshad pa'i phyogs las ni rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The statement “There is no cognition from the side that is explained as the action” is clarified by

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “form, etc.”

original: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni ye nas ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni ye nas ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of that is “That is not so.”🔽We do not assert that there is no object of apprehension; however, we assert that the cognition of form, etc.,

original: dmigs pa med par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: has an object of apprehension.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir @274a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir @274a * //
translated: Because

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pas na rang gi cha la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pas na rang gi cha la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: blue, etc., are the objects of apprehension of their own parts, since they are the opposite of the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: 'o na rnam pa gang gis dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa gang gis dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub snyam na /
translated: If you think, “In what way do you establish that they have no object of apprehension?”

original: tha dad pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is “different from the cognition.”

original: dmigs pa tha dad pas dmigs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pas dmigs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The words “without an object” mean that the object is not the same as the consciousness.

original: rang gi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: But the words “with an object” mean that the object is not different from the consciousness.🔽The words “without an object” mean that the words do not express a probandum.

original: med pa'i sgras bsgrub bya mi ston pa'i sgra dag ces bya ba ni sbyor bas zin pa bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed rjod par byed pa med pa'i sgra dang / shes pa'i sgra dag byed pa po nyid dam /🔽byed pa nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: med pa'i sgras bsgrub bya mi ston pa'i sgra dag ces bya ba ni sbyor bas zin pa bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed rjod par byed pa med pa'i sgra dang / shes pa'i sgra dag byed pa po nyid dam / byed pa nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the words “consciousness” and “without an object” were the agent, then there would be some probandum.

original: sgra de dag dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: sgra de dag dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: But if the words have no object,

original: phyogs med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be without a basis.🔽If you say that the words “consciousness” and “without an object” have an object, and that the words “without an object” do not express a probandum,

original: dmigs pa'i phyir dang shes pa'i sgras kyang sgrub byed mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir dang shes pa'i sgras kyang sgrub byed mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: we reply that this is not so, because the words “consciousness” and “without an object” are not the agent.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' aa brjod pa ni de yang shin tu legs par zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' aa brjod pa ni de yang shin tu legs par zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The root text says, “That is also very good.”

original: / sgra bla lhag ma tsam zhes bya ba ni 'di ni don med pa'i sgra tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi sun 'byin pa ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽don ni sgra'i dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ldog pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: / sgra bla lhag ma tsam zhes bya ba ni 'di ni don med pa'i sgra tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi sun 'byin pa ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // don ni sgra'i dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang ldog pa tsam yin no //
translated: The remainder is mere sound. The meaning is that this is just mere sound that is meaningless, and it is not a refutation at all.🔽The meaning is not the object of the word, but rather the mere exclusion.

original: des phyogs nyid mi 'gal te sgras bstan par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni sgrub par byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des phyogs nyid mi 'gal te sgras bstan par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro // de ni sgrub par byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That does not contradict the thesis, because the object of the word exists.🔽That is the object of the proof.

original: sgra gang las yul sgrub par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'i ste /
analyzed: sgra gang las yul sgrub par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'i ste /
translated: That is called the object of the proof from which the proof is made.

original: sgra'i yul ni sgrub par byed pa yin gyi phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ni sgrub par byed pa yin gyi phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of the word is the proof, not the thesis.

original: yang phyogs de ni'o //
analyzed: yang phyogs de ni'o //
translated: And that thesis is

original: phyogs de ni sgrub par byed pa'i yul yin gyi sgra'i ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs de ni sgrub par byed pa'i yul yin gyi sgra'i ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That thesis is the object of the proof, not the object of the word.

original: de ltar na re zhig sgra yang rtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pas na brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig sgra yang rtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pas na brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first, because sound is accepted as the understanding itself, it is the expression.

original: da ni de nyid med do zhes ston pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni de nyid med do zhes ston pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the statement “it does not exist” is called “realization.”

original: de lta ma yin na sgra las zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad bshad pas don gzhan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgra las zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad bshad pas don gzhan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the statement “from sound” would be a mere explanation of all sounds, because it would be used for a different purpose.

original: gal te pra ta ya zhes bya ba spyi'i sgra yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te pra ta ya zhes bya ba spyi'i sgra yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the word pratyaya is a general term,

original: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par rtogs she na /
translated: how is the specific characteristic of cognition understood?

original: ci'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: What is the reason?

original: byed pa po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i phyi rol de'i rgyu can yin na'ang ngo //
analyzed: byed pa po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i phyi rol de'i rgyu can yin na'ang ngo //
translated: Even though the cognition of the agent, etc. is external, it is caused by that.

original: des na byed pa po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu can ma yin pas na /
analyzed: des na byed pa po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu can ma yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of the agent, etc. is not caused by an external object,

original: ji ltar rang gi tshig gis gnod //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi tshig gis gnod //
translated: how is it harmed by one’s own words?

original: 'on te rang gi rang bzhin la ni ji ltar las @274b la sogs pa yod /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi rang bzhin la ni ji ltar las @274b la sogs pa yod /
translated: But if it exists by its own nature, how can it have an action, etc.?

original: des na gdon mi za bar phyi rol khas blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar phyi rol khas blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one must accept external objects.

original: de bas na gnod pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na gnod pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Thus, it is said that it is harmed.

original: dper na bdag cag gi nyid las dang yin pa de bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag cag gi nyid las dang yin pa de bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Just as we have the expression “my own action,” so too there would be the expression “consciousness of that,” where there is no difference.

original: rtogs pa'i sgra'i don byed pa po dang byed pa gnyis ni phyi rol zhes bya ba phyi'i las kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgra'i don byed pa po dang byed pa gnyis ni phyi rol zhes bya ba phyi'i las kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words “realized” is this: the two, the agent and the action, are not external, that is, not the objective conditions.

original: nged ces bya ba bdag cag gi 'dzin par byed pa'i dngos po grub ste /
analyzed: nged ces bya ba bdag cag gi 'dzin par byed pa'i dngos po grub ste /
translated: The word “we” refers to the thing that is the object of the conception of “I.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po gzhan kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po gzhan kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is established as a thing, because the agent is a different thing.

original: de la yid dang phyi rol yang gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la yid dang phyi rol yang gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: In that case, the mind and external things would be the objects of apprehension.

original: rtogs pa la ltos par zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la ma ltos par ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa la ltos par zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la ma ltos par ro //
translated: “In dependence on realization” means in dependence on explanation.

original: 'o na ji ltar dngos po 'grub snyam na rnam par dpyod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dngos po 'grub snyam na rnam par dpyod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks that things are established in that way, then Nāgārjuna says, “In analysis.”

original: rig pa las 'jig rten gzhan du khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi de ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rig pa las 'jig rten gzhan du khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi de ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is only said that the world is accepted as something other than awareness, but it is not so.

original: rig pa las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “From awareness” is said.

original: rig pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'jig rten ma grub na /
analyzed: rig pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'jig rten ma grub na /
translated: If the world is not established apart from awareness,

original: de ji ltar ma grub pa'i 'jig rten des don grub /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma grub pa'i 'jig rten des don grub /
translated: how can that non-established world establish the meaning?

original: 'on te rig pa nyid 'jig rten yin pa des na don 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na rig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te rig pa nyid 'jig rten yin pa des na don 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na rig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that the meaning is established because the world itself is awareness, then “awareness” is said.

original: yang na 'jig rten rig pa las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten rig pa las gzhan yin no //
translated: Or the world is other than awareness.

original: de lta yang 'jig rten des kyang rig pa nyid kyi sgo nas don rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta yang 'jig rten des kyang rig pa nyid kyi sgo nas don rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na /
translated: Even so, if the meaning is to be established by the world through awareness itself,

original: rig pa yang dmigs pa med pa des na /
analyzed: rig pa yang dmigs pa med pa des na /
translated: since awareness is also without an object,

original: ji ltar don 'grub ces ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar don 'grub ces ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how can the meaning be established? “If” is said to show this.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: Also, what is said from “that” is

original: shes pa phyogs su byed pa na /
analyzed: shes pa phyogs su byed pa na /
translated: when consciousness is taken as the position,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am dmigs pa med pa zhig byed pa de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa de khas blangs nas gal te phyogs su byed na ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am dmigs pa med pa zhig byed pa de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa de khas blangs nas gal te phyogs su byed na ni /
translated: Whether one is with or without a referential object, if one takes a position in terms of having a referential object,🔽

original: de'i tshe dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: If you take the position that it is with an object, then you have contradicted your assertion that it is without an object.

original: chos can gyi khyad par ma grub par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par ma grub par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the subject would not be established.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni chos can gyi khyad par yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni chos can gyi khyad par yin la /
translated: Having an object is the distinguishing feature of the subject.

original: de yang khyed cag sangs rgyas pa la grub pa med do //🔽lha min pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa phyogs su byed pa ni khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid nges la rab tu ma grub po //
analyzed: de yang khyed cag sangs rgyas pa la grub pa med do // lha min pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa phyogs su byed pa ni khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid nges la rab tu ma grub po //
translated: And that is not established for you Buddhists.🔽If you take the position that it is without an object, then the distinguishing feature of being without an object is not established.

original: dngos po gzhan rtogs par byed pa dmigs par byed pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par can dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid @275a * //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtogs par byed pa dmigs par byed pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par can dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid @275a * //
translated: The cognition that realizes the other thing is the cognition that observes the object.

original: kyis khyad par du bya ba ni /
analyzed: kyis khyad par du bya ba ni /
translated: The distinguishing feature of that is having an object.

original: phyogs ni khyed la ma grub pa gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ji skad brjod pa las bzlog pa ni ded pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni khyed la ma grub pa gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ji skad brjod pa las bzlog pa ni ded pa'o //
translated: The “other” in the expression “the other, i.e., the nonestablished for you” is the opposite of the “you.”🔽“Likewise” indicates that the other refutation is taught.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan ston pa'i bdag gi chos su gyur pa'i shes pa phyogs su byed dam rang rgyud pa gal te bdag gi chos yin na de'i tshe ma grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan ston pa'i bdag gi chos su gyur pa'i shes pa phyogs su byed dam rang rgyud pa gal te bdag gi chos yin na de'i tshe ma grub ste /
translated: If the cognition that is my property is the subject, then it is not established for you,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba la bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba la bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the Buddhist view there is no self.

original: de ste rang rgyud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ste rang rgyud pa yin no //
translated: If it is autonomous,

original: de'i tshe bdag cag la ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag cag la ma grub ste /
translated: then it is not established for me.

original: shes pa rang rgyud pa ni nged kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rang rgyud pa ni nged kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I accept autonomous cognition.

original: 'on te khyad par rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rtogs pa tsam gtan tshigs su byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rtogs pa tsam gtan tshigs su byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you use mere cognition, without analyzing its particular nature, as the reason,

original: brjod pa ni rtogs pa tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni rtogs pa tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply: Mere cognition is not established for the essentialist.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis po 'di nyid rim pa ji lta ba bzhin 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis po 'di nyid rim pa ji lta ba bzhin 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two verses are explained in order as follows.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni de ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of this is “How could that be?”

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The basis of the dispute is the nonexistence of the object.

original: de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid nye bar 'god pas ci zhig sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid nye bar 'god pas ci zhig sgrub pa ste /
translated: At that time, since the proof itself is being presented, what is being proved?

original: don med pa'i phyir ci yang sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ci yang sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is meaningless, nothing is being proved.

original: de zhes bya ba dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa de ma grub pa'i sgo nas khyad par can rtogs pa ma grub pas gang yin pa de brjod pa'i don du khyed kyis brjod pa gang yin pa dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de nyid ni
analyzed: de zhes bya ba dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa de ma grub pa'i sgo nas khyad par can rtogs pa ma grub pas gang yin pa de brjod pa'i don du khyed kyis brjod pa gang yin pa dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de nyid ni
translated: “ That” refers to the nonexistence of a different object. Since that is not established, the realization of the distinction is not established. Therefore, the meaning of the statement that you made is that the very property that you have stated, which has the characteristic of the nonexistence of the object,

original: khyed dang lhan cig rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa bdag cag gi bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyed dang lhan cig rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa bdag cag gi bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: is the probandum of our proof, which is the basis of the dispute with you.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa des na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa med pa des na'o //
translated: “ By that” refers to the nonexistence of a different object.

original: dpe la don ni grub na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dpe la don ni grub na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: “ If the meaning is established in the example” means “if destruction is established.”

original: phyogs kyi sgra ni khyad par grub pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi sgra ni khyad par grub pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: The term “side” is not tenable as an established distinction.

original: sgra lam grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra lam grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the impermanence of sound is the probandum.

original: 'on te dper na 'jig pa ma grub na de'i tshe gtan tshigs skyon can du gyur gyi phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dper na 'jig pa ma grub na de'i tshe gtan tshigs skyon can du gyur gyi phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the example is not established, then the reason is faulty, not the position.

original: dam pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dpe la bsgrub bya med par khyab pa 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dam pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dpe la bsgrub bya med par khyab pa 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word “only” is used because it is not possible to grasp the pervasion that the probandum is absent in the example.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the uncommon inconclusive reason.

original: 'gal ba ni gang gi tshe dpe la med cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba la bzlog pas khyab par yang mthong ba de'i tshe 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gang gi tshe dpe la med cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba la bzlog pas khyab par yang mthong ba de'i tshe 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The contradictory reason is when the reason is seen to pervade the opposite of the probandum in the example and in the dissimilar class.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “For that very reason” means because the reason is not established in the position.

original: sgra don zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhan spyi smra ba rnam rig tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis chos can nyid du nges pa rtogs @275b pa de lta'ang ste /
analyzed: sgra don zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhan spyi smra ba rnam rig tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis chos can nyid du nges pa rtogs @275b pa de lta'ang ste /
translated: “The meaning of the word” means that just as the proponent of the universal is ascertained as the subject by mere awareness, so too is the proponent of the particular.

original: rnam pa des kyang khyed sangs rgyas pa la grub pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa des kyang khyed sangs rgyas pa la grub pa med do //
translated: In that way, too, you Buddhists have no establishment.

original: rgol ba sangs rgyas pa des ni phan rol gyi rgol bas chos can la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa yin na ni phyir bzlog par mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba sangs rgyas pa des ni phan rol gyi rgol bas chos can la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa yin na ni phyir bzlog par mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddhist opponent says: “If the subject and so on are conceptualized by the other party, then it is not possible to refute them.”

original: khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid rab tu ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid rab tu ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The particular is not observed, and so it is not established.

original: gang gi phyir dpe ma grub pa nyid yin pas so //🔽ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe ma grub pa nyid yin pas so // ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Because the example is not established.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”

original: pha rol po nyid brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po nyid brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the opponent’s response is, “If you say . . .”🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”

original: 'on te blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas de nyid kyi lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas de nyid kyi lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ste /🔽rang gi rnam pa la dmigs pas sangs rgyas pa la khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ste / rang gi rnam pa la dmigs pas sangs rgyas pa la khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.🔽If you say, “The mind is like a sense faculty,”🔽the response to that is as follows.

original: de med par ni zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa med par ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de med par ni zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa med par ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If you say,

original: gzung ba med par gzung ba'i rnam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba med par gzung ba'i rnam pa med pa'o //
translated: Without an object, there is no form of an object.

original: de ni khyed sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni khyed sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But you Buddhists do not accept that.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur dang ngo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur dang ngo //
translated: “ In that case” means “if it were like that.”

original: gzung bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ The form of the object” means

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the form of the object that is perceived.

original: des na gang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa de la dmigs pa bzlog par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa de la dmigs pa bzlog par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the perception of that consciousness that has that form is refuted.

original: de la sangs rgyas pa sun 'byin pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas pa sun 'byin pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the Buddhists is this: “Why?”

original: phyi'i dmigs pa med par sgrub na yang gal te phyi rol lo zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis 'dzin pa med na /
analyzed: phyi'i dmigs pa med par sgrub na yang gal te phyi rol lo zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis 'dzin pa med na /
translated: If you prove that there is no external object, and if there is no apprehension by the form “external object,”

original: de'i tshe ka ba la sogs pa la phyi rol lo snyam pa'i blo de med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ka ba la sogs pa la phyi rol lo snyam pa'i blo de med par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the idea “external object” with regard to a pillar, etc. would not exist.

original: phyi rol lo snyam pa'i thun mong ma yin pa yul du bya bar mi nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol lo snyam pa'i thun mong ma yin pa yul du bya bar mi nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the uncommon object that cannot be an object is not possible.

original: phyi rol lo snyam pa'i blor 'gyur ba yang yin te des na phyi rol yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol lo snyam pa'i blor 'gyur ba yang yin te des na phyi rol yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The idea “external object” would occur, and therefore the external object exists.

original: kho na gzhi mthun pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi bum pa zhes bya ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho na gzhi mthun pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi bum pa zhes bya ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the external object called a pot is not cognized by the cognition of the pot because of the common locus, then there is the response beginning with “In that case . . .”

original: yang dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Again, anticipating an objection, he says “But if . . .”

original: de'i tshe ka ba rig pa mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ka ba rig pa mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: At that time, because the cognition of the pillar is seen,

original: de dang zhes bya ba mthong ba dang 'gal bar thal lo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba mthong ba dang 'gal bar thal lo //
translated: it follows that the response “In that case . . .” is contradicted by what is seen.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang kha dog mthong ba mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang kha dog mthong ba mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, in the case of the two moons and so on, the color is seen in the same way.

original: des na ji ltar de lta bu'i dngos po gnyis mthong yang dngos po de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar de lta bu'i dngos po gnyis mthong yang dngos po de lta ma yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as in that case, although two things are seen, the thing is not like that, so it is in the case of the pillar and so on. This is the idea.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sun 'byin pa ni dbang po zhes bya ba'o //🔽der ni zla ba @276a * //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sun 'byin pa ni dbang po zhes bya ba'o // der ni zla ba @276a * //
translated: In this way, having anticipated the objection of the Buddhist, the response is “The sense . . .”

original: gnyis kyi shes pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi shes pa la'o //
translated: There, in the cognition of the two moons.

original: yang ji ltar na dbang po dang ma phrad pa'i don dbang po'i blos gzung ngo zhes bya bar shes snyam na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na dbang po dang ma phrad pa'i don dbang po'i blos gzung ngo zhes bya bar shes snyam na /
translated: Moreover, how is it known that the mind apprehends an object that is not in contact with the sense faculty?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the case.

original: zla ba gcig las bzlog pa zla ba gnyis las dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: zla ba gcig las bzlog pa zla ba gnyis las dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-apprehension of a second moon is the non-existence of a second moon.

original: pha rol po 'di nyid ston pa ni'o //
analyzed: pha rol po 'di nyid ston pa ni'o //
translated: This very opponent teaches

original: 'brel ba yod pas ni yod pa 'dzin par 'jog la 'brel pa med pas ni med pa 'dzin par 'jog ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel ba yod pas ni yod pa 'dzin par 'jog la 'brel pa med pas ni med pa 'dzin par 'jog ba yin gyi /
translated: that the apprehension of existence is established by the existence of a connection, and the apprehension of non-existence is established by the non-existence of a connection.

original: thams cad du yang don rig pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang don rig pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: But in all cases, the cognition of an object is indeed existent.

original: shes pa mi dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed la ni dbang po rnams med pas na 'dzin pa med pas dmigs pa'i rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa mi dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed la ni dbang po rnams med pas na 'dzin pa med pas dmigs pa'i rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
