translated: For you who speak of the non-apprehension of consciousness, since there are no sense faculties, there is no apprehension, and therefore there would be no cause for apprehension.

original: des na dmigs pa 'ga' yang ma mthong bas dgag pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa 'ga' yang ma mthong bas dgag pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, since you do not see any apprehension at all, negation itself is not tenable.

original: khyed kyis brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: This is the refutation expressed by you.

original: bdag cag la sun 'byin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag cag la sun 'byin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no refutation for us.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skabs la sogs pa khas mi len na'i sgra las zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i sgra las so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skabs la sogs pa khas mi len na'i sgra las zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i sgra las so //
translated: Otherwise means that if one does not accept the context, etc., from the word means from the word non-existent object.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi cha lugs dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi cha lugs dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don to //
translated: This meaning means the meaning characterized by the apprehension of one's own appearance.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i dpe brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i dpe brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The corresponding example is stated with If... and so on.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis skra shad kyi shes pa la yang snang bzhin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis skra shad kyi shes pa la yang snang bzhin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: There also, that refers to the appearance of floating hair, etc. in the cognition of one with eye disease, which would be the observed object.

original: gal te skra shad kyi shes pa la 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te skra shad kyi shes pa la 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is asked, Isn't the appearance of a non-existent object in the cognition of floating hair?

original: des na de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it has an observed object,

original: thams cad la zhes gsungs te /🔽ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes gsungs te / ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang ngo //
translated: it is said in all cases.🔽It is also in the cognition of a pillar, etc.

original: 'ga' la yang zhes bya ba ni rib rib can shes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang zhes bya ba ni rib rib can shes pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in any cognition, such as the cognition of one with eye disease.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: “If” introduces a doubt.

original: zla ba gcig gi shes pa go ji ltar dmigs pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi shes pa go ji ltar dmigs pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the cognition of one moon be without an objective support?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “That also . . . ”

original: gnod par bya ba'i phyir zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa yin no zhe na lan ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i phyir zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa yin no zhe na lan ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the cognition of two moons is without an objective support because of a defect, the response is “That also . . . ”

original: zla ba gcig gi shes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi shes pa la yang ngo //
translated: The cognition of one moon is also without an objective support.

original: bems po ni gsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po ni gsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that an insentient object is illuminated.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: “If” introduces a doubt.

original: de lta yin pa des na 'od zer gyis gdungs pa nyid de'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //🔽'di la brjod pa ni rol sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin pa des na 'od zer gyis gdungs pa nyid de'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o // 'di la brjod pa ni rol sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The idea is that the object of that cognition is the moon itself, which is affected by the rays of the sun.🔽The response to this is “The cognition of a double moon . . . ”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i @276b chu la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i @276b chu la'o //
translated: “That” refers to the real water.

original: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang mi bden pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang mi bden pa'i yul can no //
translated: “Both” refers to the real and the unreal objects.

original: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par ro //
translated: “Otherwise” refers to the case where there is an objective support.

original: gal te snang bzhin pas dmigs pa dang bcas par yin na de'i tshe dgon dung 'od zer gyis gdungs pa med par chu'i shes pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te snang bzhin pas dmigs pa dang bcas par yin na de'i tshe dgon dung 'od zer gyis gdungs pa med par chu'i shes pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is because it appears that it has an object, then in that case, the cognition of water would not occur without the mirage being affected by the sun’s rays.

original: des na de ni 'di'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod ka med de /
analyzed: des na de ni 'di'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod ka med de /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that that is its object.

original: 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i dgon dung ba de ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i dgon dung ba de ni mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mirage affected by the sun’s rays does not appear.

original: yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: It would be the object means it would be the object.

original: bde ba'i chu'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i chu'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The cognition of water that has the object of water would have an object.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is stated:🔽Direct perception and what is accepted.🔽Another refutation is stated:

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'jig rten grags brten zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'jig rten grags brten zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is accepted in the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad ces smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad ces smos so //
translated: Why? Because all.

original: smig rgyu ba la chur mthong ba des thag ring rab tu chu thob par brgya la srid par gyur na yang de'ang dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu ba la chur mthong ba des thag ring rab tu chu thob par brgya la srid par gyur na yang de'ang dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were possible for one to obtain water from a mirage, even that would be with an object.

original: pha rol po'i 'di spong ba ni de la ni kun gyi tshe thob par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol po'i 'di spong ba ni de la ni kun gyi tshe thob par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The opponent says: It is certain that one obtains it at all times.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply to that is “In all cases,”

original: shes pa thams cad la yang kun gyi tshe mthong ba thob pa ni med de mthong ba ni zhig ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad la yang kun gyi tshe mthong ba thob pa ni med de mthong ba ni zhig ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no obtaining of seeing at all times in all cognitions, because seeing is destroyed.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni mthong ba ma zhig na thob par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni mthong ba ma zhig na thob par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says: If seeing is not destroyed, it is obtained.

original: lan ni de ni ji ltar mi 'jigs 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan ni de ni ji ltar mi 'jigs 'gyur te /
translated: The reply is: How could it not be destroyed?

original: skad cig ma nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because momentariness is established.

original: ngo shes pas gcig nyid sgrub par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ngo shes pas gcig nyid sgrub par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that one is established by recognition,

original: ngo shes pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: the reply is “Recognition is not valid cognition.”

original: 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas pas dmigs pa dang bcas pas mthong ba des na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas pas dmigs pa dang bcas pas mthong ba des na /
translated: Because of the statement “If it is seen by a Buddhist,”🔽it is not valid cognition.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa snyam na /
translated: How is cessation to be accomplished?

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The rest is explained.

original: ni'i sgra ni rig pa gzhan du yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rig pa gzhan du yin te /
translated: The word “ni” is in another text.

original: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma shes pa de'i phyir ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma shes pa de'i phyir ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the counteragent is not known, therefore, how is the probandum to be accomplished?

original: sangs rgyas pas 'dod pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas 'dod pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin te ;
translated: How is the non-existence of the object of perception to be established as asserted by the Buddhist?

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po ste phyi'i yul nyid du'ang du ma ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po ste phyi'i yul nyid du'ang du ma ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because external things, i.e., external objects, are not established as manifold.

original: ji ltar khyad par ma grub na gzhan rtogs par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir phyogs mi 'grub pa de bzhin du khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis khyad par dmigs pa phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba gang yin te /🔽ma grub na yang mi @277a * //
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par ma grub na gzhan rtogs par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir phyogs mi 'grub pa de bzhin du khyad par dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis khyad par dmigs pa phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba gang yin te / ma grub na yang mi @277a * //
translated: Just as a position is not established because a distinction is not established, since it is not possible to understand the other, in the same way, a distinction is not established as external, i.e., as an external object, because of the non-existence of the object of perception.

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is not established, it is not the case that it is not established.

original: gal te phyi rol gyis zhes bya ba'i khyad par ma grub mod /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyis zhes bya ba'i khyad par ma grub mod /
translated: If the distinction “external” is not established,

original: de lta na yang re zhig spyi'i don mi grub po snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig spyi'i don mi grub po snyam na /
translated: If you think, In that case, the general meaning is not established,

original: tshig don zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig don zhes gsungs so //
translated: [the root text] says, the meaning of the words.

original: de ni zhes bya ba dag gi don ni de zhes bya ba tshig gi don sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba dag gi don ni de zhes bya ba tshig gi don sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of that is that the meaning of the words precedes it.

original: 'on te / de dag ni don bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te / de dag ni don bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think, Those are not established as the meaning,

original: phyogs kyang ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs kyang ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: [the root text] says, the position.

original: 'o na ji ltar na 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur ba snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur ba snyam na /
translated: If you think, How is it that it becomes a fault of the reason called 'non-erroneous contradiction'?

original: 'gal ba'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The root text] says, contradictory.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: If means a doubt.

original: yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: It is doubted, It is not tenable to refute because there is no error in seeing in another place, and so on.

original: gal te 'khrul pa med par de ltar na yang 'ga' zhig gis gzhan du brtags pas 'gog go snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa med par de ltar na yang 'ga' zhig gis gzhan du brtags pas 'gog go snyam na /
translated: If you think, In that case, even though there is no error, it is refuted because someone else imagined it,

original: yul sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: [the root text] says, place, and so on.

original: der zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du'o //
translated: There means in another place.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du mthong ba'o //
translated: “This” refers to the perception of an object in a different place.

original: re zhig 'khrul pa de ni tshad mas bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'khrul pa de ni tshad mas bzlog pa yin no //
translated: This error is refuted by a valid cognition.

original: gang zhig thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'khrul pa gang yin ba de bdag cag gis bzlog par bya ba la ji ltar mi bzod de /
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'khrul pa gang yin ba de bdag cag gis bzlog par bya ba la ji ltar mi bzod de /
translated: We cannot accept that we should refute any error that occurs in any way at all.

original: gal te de zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa gzhan du 'khrul pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa gzhan du 'khrul pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the error of perceiving an object in a different place.

original: gnod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni med ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni med ba nyid do //
translated: “The object that is the basis of the error” is the object that is the basis of the error of nonexistence.

original: des na 'ga' yang 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'ga' yang 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The point is that if the object that is the basis of the error is nonexistent, then no one would be in error.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //🔽de gcod dam zhes bya ba ni gnod bya'i shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o // de gcod dam zhes bya ba ni gnod bya'i shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
translated: “In this way” refers to the fact that the object that is the basis of the error is nonexistent.🔽“Would it be eliminated” means that the nature of the consciousness that is the basis of the error would be eliminated.

original: gzung zhes bya ba gnod bya'i shes pa'i gzung bya 'jig par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba gnod bya'i shes pa'i gzung bya 'jig par byed pa'am /
translated: “Would it be apprehended” means that the object of the consciousness that is the basis of the error would be destroyed.

original: gzung ba med pa zhes pa gnod bya'i shes pa'i gzung bya med par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa zhes pa gnod bya'i shes pa'i gzung bya med par byed pa yin te /
translated: “Would the object be nonexistent” means that the object of the consciousness that is the basis of the error would be made nonexistent.

original: phyogs gsum pa 'di ni las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa 'di ni las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no third alternative apart from these three.

original: de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “arisen or not arisen” refers to

original: gnod bya'i shes pa dang de'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod bya'i shes pa dang de'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: the cognition that is to be harmed and its object.🔽Although it is taught that the object to be harmed arises from its own cause,

original: rang gi rgyud las skyes pas gnod par bya ba ston mod la gnod byed las ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byung rgyal yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las skyes pas gnod par bya ba ston mod la gnod byed las ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byung rgyal yin te /
translated: the harm itself does not arise from its cause.🔽This is mere prattle, because it is untenable that one and the same thing

original: gcig nyid la gcig gi tshe yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la gcig gi tshe yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: can exist and not exist at the same time.

original: 'di thams cad kyis kyang ha cang thal ba brjod nas gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis kyang ha cang thal ba brjod nas gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: All of these arguments express the absurd consequences of the opponent’s🔽position, but he might say that the point is that the essence of the thing is

original: don de ni rang bzhin zhes bya @277b ba rang bzhin gyis dngos po de ma skyes pa de'i'o //
analyzed: don de ni rang bzhin zhes bya @277b ba rang bzhin gyis dngos po de ma skyes pa de'i'o //
translated: called “nature,” and that the nature of the unarisen thing exists.

original: des na de nyid rang bzhin gyis dmar ba'i keng shu ka bzhin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid rang bzhin gyis dmar ba'i keng shu ka bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is like the nature of the red color of a lotus.

original: de'i ngo bos kyang zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bos kyang zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “By its nature” means by the nature of the unarisen thing.

original: gal te ma skyes pa de'i rang bzhin gyis phyis 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa de'i rang bzhin gyis phyis 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the unarisen thing is engaged by the nature of the unarisen thing,🔽then

original: de'i tshe zhig pa las sngar rang bzhin gang gis ma skyes pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhig pa las sngar rang bzhin gang gis ma skyes pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, prior to disintegration, it would be the intrinsic reality of that which has not arisen.

original: 'on te sngar de'i rang bzhin can yin pa de nyid na de'i tshe de'i ngo bor zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on te sngar de'i rang bzhin can yin pa de nyid na de'i tshe de'i ngo bor zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Or, if it is the intrinsic reality of that which is already arisen, then at that time it would be the intrinsic reality of that which already exists.

original: 'on te rang bzhin de ni snga ma kho nar skyes pa des na phyis ni 'jig pa yin no snyam na brjod pa /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin de ni snga ma kho nar skyes pa des na phyis ni 'jig pa yin no snyam na brjod pa /
translated: But if you think that intrinsic reality is just that which arises earlier, and later it disintegrates, then Nāgārjuna addresses this:

original: gang de rang bzhin de snga ma kho nar yin no //
analyzed: gang de rang bzhin de snga ma kho nar yin no //
translated: That intrinsic reality is just that which arises earlier.

original: de'i tshe phyis de'i rang bzhin med pas na rang nyid med par 'jig par byed pas ci bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyis de'i rang bzhin med pas na rang nyid med par 'jig par byed pas ci bya /
translated: At that time, since later it would not have that intrinsic reality, what use is it to destroy itself?🔽Since you assert that it disintegrates earlier by the passage of time, “later it disintegrates,” this is the context.

original: phyis 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis sngar 'jig pa yang 'dod pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa de la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyis 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis sngar 'jig pa yang 'dod pa yin pas rnam par rtog pa de la brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore Nāgārjuna says:

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: rang bzhin 'jig pa ni snga ma kho na yin gyi phyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'jig pa ni snga ma kho na yin gyi phyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If disintegration is just that which arises earlier, and not later, then it would not be tenable that it disintegrates later.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni dngos po de ni rang gi rgyu nyid las rang bzhin de lta bur byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni dngos po de ni rang gi rgyu nyid las rang bzhin de lta bur byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The response to this is: that thing arises from its own cause in that way.

original: de lta yang 'jig par byed pas gzhan ci byar yod /
analyzed: de lta yang 'jig par byed pas gzhan ci byar yod /
translated: What else can be done by a destroyer?

original: nyes pa 'di ni gnod bya'i shes bya'i yul 'jig pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni gnod bya'i shes bya'i yul 'jig pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This fault is similar for the destruction of the object of knowledge that is to be destroyed.

original: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate just that, it is said, “In that case…”

original: ji ltar ma skyes pa de ltar ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar ma skyes pa de ltar ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not arisen, it is not destroyed,

original: don med dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is pointless.

original: ji ltar skyes pa de ltar yang ma yin te mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa de ltar yang ma yin te mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is arisen, it is not destroyed, because that is impossible.

original: des na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di tshad ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di tshad ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the characteristic of destruction is not realized by a valid cognition,

original: sems dang ldan pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa dag rtog pa tsam du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa dag rtog pa tsam du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be mere imagination for those who possess minds and imagination?

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa 'god pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa 'god pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The presentation of a third conception is “Or else…”

original: dngos de zhes bya ba ni gnod bya'i ni shes pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos de zhes bya ba ni gnod bya'i ni shes pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: “That thing” refers to the object of knowledge that is to be destroyed.

original: de lta yin mod kyi ci nyes snyam na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ste /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi ci nyes snyam na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ste /
translated: If you think that there is no fault in that, then “at that time” means

original: ma mthong ba'i dus na don gyi dngos po ma grub par gyur na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i dus na don gyi dngos po ma grub par gyur na /
translated: that if the thing that is the object does not exist at the time it is not seen,

original: de'i med pa ni 'di yin no zhes dngos po med pa khyad par dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i med pa ni 'di yin no zhes dngos po med pa khyad par dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nonexistence of that would not be specified.

original: khyab par ma grub mod /
analyzed: khyab par ma grub mod /
translated: “ But it is not established that it pervades.🔽”

original: re zhig dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: “ Nonexistence is certainly understood.🔽”

original: khyad par zhes bya ba don rab tu ma grub na khyed la rtogs nus te /
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba don rab tu ma grub na khyed la rtogs nus te /
translated: If the object is not established, then you can understand it.

original: dngos po med pa shes pa'i nus pa ji ltar yod /
analyzed: dngos po med pa shes pa'i nus pa ji ltar yod /
translated: How can there be the capacity to understand nonexistence?

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po ma rtogs pas rtogs nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po ma rtogs pas rtogs nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Nonexistence is not able to be understood through not understanding existence.

original: 'on te khyad par gyis dngos po gzhan du grub pa nyid dgag pa'i gnas @278a * //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par gyis dngos po gzhan du grub pa nyid dgag pa'i gnas @278a * //
translated: “ But if it is established as different through a distinction,

original: 'dir ni rjes su brjod pa tsam zhig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rjes su brjod pa tsam zhig byed pa yin no //
translated: then here we are just repeating what you have said.🔽”

original: des na khyad par gzhan du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na khyad par gzhan du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of being established as different,

original: dngos po med pa khyad par dang bcas pa kho nar rtogs so snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa khyad par dang bcas pa kho nar rtogs so snyam na /
translated: If you think that a non-entity is only realized as qualified,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni khyad par de ni gzhan der dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid du kho nar rtogs te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni khyad par de ni gzhan der dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid du kho nar rtogs te /
translated: we reply: that qualification is realized as just the nature of an entity in another way.

original: des na de ni dngos po med pa'i khyad par nyid du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: des na de ni dngos po med pa'i khyad par nyid du ma dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not perceived as a qualification of a non-entity,

original: dngos po med pa khyad par du bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa khyad par du bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a non-entity is not perceived as a qualification.

original: de nyid ces ni gzhan du dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces ni gzhan du dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: “ That itself” is the perception of another.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gang du de sngar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid du gal te dgag pa'i dus na yang rtogs na de'i tshe don de'i dgag pa la don ci yod /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gang du de sngar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid du gal te dgag pa'i dus na yang rtogs na de'i tshe don de'i dgag pa la don ci yod /
translated: “ Just that” is the nature in which it was previously perceived. If it is perceived as just that nature even at the time of negation, then what is the point of negating that object?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “ If” means “doubt.”

original: der ni zhes bya ba dgag pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba dgag pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: “ There” is the place of negation.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “ Memory” is the reply.

original: gal te dran pas rang bzhin 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te dran pas rang bzhin 'dzin na /
translated: If memory grasps the nature,

original: de'i rang bzhin yod pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dgag pa de ste mi 'dzin na de'i tshe don dngos po med pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dgag pa de ste mi 'dzin na de'i tshe don dngos po med pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not apprehended, then at that time, the distinction of the non-existence of the object will not be made.

original: snang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Appears” means is conceived.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig gcig nyid du sgro btags nas de la de'i bar du ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig gcig nyid du sgro btags nas de la de'i bar du ste /
translated: Having superimposed identity on the arising, in the middle of that,

original: de'i dbus su gnod par byed pa'i shes rab mngon par 'dod pa zhugs par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i dbus su gnod par byed pa'i shes rab mngon par 'dod pa zhugs par gyur na /
translated: if the desire for the wisdom that causes harm enters,

original: gnod par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa byed do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa byed do //
translated: it is posited as the cause of harm.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni don 'di 'chad pa med pa kho nar gyur pa las chad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni don 'di 'chad pa med pa kho nar gyur pa las chad pa yang yin te /
translated: This is stated: “This very explanation is only the absence of the explanation of this meaning, and it is also the cessation.

original: des na 'di ni gnod byed yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gnod byed yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the cause of harm.”

original: rgyu de'i phyir na chad pa'i rgyu ni gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na chad pa'i rgyu ni gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, the cause of cessation is the wisdom that causes harm.

original: rgyu des na bar du zhugs pa de ni gnod byed yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na bar du zhugs pa de ni gnod byed yin no //
translated: By that cause, that which enters in the middle is the cause of harm.

original: dmigs pa'i dngos po nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos po nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object of the perception is the basis of the perception, and it is said to be “just that.”

original: lkog tu gyur pa bum pa la sogs pa'i don la 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du sgro btags pa nas so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa bum pa la sogs pa'i don la 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du sgro btags pa nas so //
translated: The object, such as a pot, is hidden, but the perception is superimposed upon it.

original: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having the aspect of that” means

original: bum pa'i rnam pa can du shes pa skyes so //
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pa can du shes pa skyes so //
translated: that the perception arises having the aspect of the pot.

original: de zhes bum pa de la ni dmigs pa nyid du 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bum pa de la ni dmigs pa nyid du 'jog pa yin no //
translated: “That” refers to the pot, which is posited as the object of the perception.

original: gal te gsal bzhin pa'i don 'di med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gsal bzhin pa'i don 'di med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the manifest object did not exist,

original: rab tu gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni yongs su 'khyam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni yongs su 'khyam par 'gyur te /
translated: then a very clear consciousness would wander without support.

original: brtan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be stable.

original: yongs su 'khyam pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni ci 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'khyam pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni ci 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The wandering aspect of the consciousness is stated in the words “What is this?”

original: don gyi rang bzhin yongs su mthong ba na ni brtan par @278b 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin yongs su mthong ba na ni brtan par @278b 'gyur te /
translated: When the nature of the object is seen, the consciousness is stable.

original: dper na skyes bu 'khyam po sgram  du phyin nas brtan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'khyam po sgram  du phyin nas brtan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a man who is wandering in a desert becomes stable when he reaches a village.

original: rgyu des na bum pa la sogs pa de ni dmigs pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na bum pa la sogs pa de ni dmigs pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pot, etc. are posited as the objective domain.

original: 'khyam pa nyid yongs su gtod pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan gyis don gyi dmigs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go //🔽'di la gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'khyam pa nyid yongs su gtod pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan gyis don gyi dmigs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go // 'di la gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras te /
translated: The objective domain is posited as the objective support of the object by reason of the fact that it is the cause of the wandering.

original: de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i de kho na nyid ci ste ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i de kho na nyid ci ste ma yin snyam na /
translated: Here, another says: “If it is so, then why is it not the reality of the conventional?”

original: ma yin zhes gsungs te bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'di ni mngon sum dang / rjes dpag dag gis ma rtogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: ma yin zhes gsungs te bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'di ni mngon sum dang / rjes dpag dag gis ma rtogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: “It is not,” he says, “because the object, which has the previously mentioned characteristics, is the cause of non-comprehension by means of direct perception and inference.

original: dngos po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not a thing.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dri ba'o //
translated: “Why?” is the question of another.

original: de la zhes bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Therein,” is the hidden objective domain.

original: dngos po du ba la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa 'grub cing dngos po de las na'o //
analyzed: dngos po du ba la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa 'grub cing dngos po de las na'o //
translated: The thing, such as smoke, etc., is established as related to fire, and from that thing, it is inferred.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa dngos po go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the actual inference is understood from the words.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang bcas pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang bcas pa nyid las so //
translated: From that, means from the existence of direct perception.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las so //
translated: From that, means from the inference.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don to //
translated: The thing, means the external object.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas phyi'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa'i rgyus na khas blangs 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas phyi'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa'i rgyus na khas blangs 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: The assertion is only due to the lack of understanding of the nature of external things by the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference.

original: sngar gsungs so ;
analyzed: sngar gsungs so ;
translated: It was said before.

original: / rnam par rtog pa snga ma dang snga ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa snga ma dang snga ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is because the previous conceptualization exists.

original: rtog pa de zhes bya ba rtog pa snga ma snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas khyad par phyi rol dmigs pa med pa dang / khyad par can shes pa de gnyis kyi dngos po ni de nyid ni sngar ngas bstan cing khyed kyis kyang rtog pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa de zhes bya ba rtog pa snga ma snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas khyad par phyi rol dmigs pa med pa dang / khyad par can shes pa de gnyis kyi dngos po ni de nyid ni sngar ngas bstan cing khyed kyis kyang rtog pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: That conceptualization, means following the previous conceptualization, the external object that is the referent of the distinction is not observed, and the thing of those two, the distinction and the cognition, is just that which I previously taught and you also conceptualize. How?

original: dngos po de'i rang bzhin brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de'i rang bzhin brtags pa ste /
translated: The nature of that entity is investigated,

original: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ma byas pa yin no //
translated: and that investigation is not done.

original: yang phyis rnam par dpyad cing brtags na ji ltar na /
analyzed: yang phyis rnam par dpyad cing brtags na ji ltar na /
translated: Later, when it is investigated and examined,

original: phyi rol de rnam pa des na gal te rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dpyad nas phyi rol de med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol de rnam pa des na gal te rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dpyad nas phyi rol de med pa nyid do //
translated: if the external object is investigated by the characteristic of cognition, that external object does not exist.

original: phyi rol med pa 'dir skyon ci yod de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol med pa 'dir skyon ci yod de med pa kho na'o //
translated: What is the fault here of the nonexistence of the external object? It is just nonexistence.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
translated: Here, the opponent says, “If . . .”

original: snga phyi shes pa bdag cag ces bya ba ni snga phyi'i don yod ces rtog pa dang phyi rol med ces phyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: snga phyi shes pa bdag cag ces bya ba ni snga phyi'i don yod ces rtog pa dang phyi rol med ces phyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: The cognition of earlier and later is “our own.” The thought is that the meaning of earlier and later exists, and later the thought is that the external object does not exist.

original: shes pa de dag phan tshun gnod bya gnod byed yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa de dag phan tshun gnod bya gnod byed yin zhe na /
translated: Those cognitions mutually contradict each other.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni rang nyid rtogs na zhes @279a * //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni rang nyid rtogs na zhes @279a * //
translated: Here, the response is “If it is realized by itself . . .”

original: bya ba'o // rang nyid kho na nas dang po phyi rol yod do zhes rtogs la /
analyzed: bya ba'o // rang nyid kho na nas dang po phyi rol yod do zhes rtogs la /
translated: From itself alone, first it is realized that the external object exists.

original: phyi nas de med do zhes rtogs pa 'di la skyon ci yod /
analyzed: phyi nas de med do zhes rtogs pa 'di la skyon ci yod /
translated: Later, it is realized that it does not exist. What is the fault here?

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig bdag nyid la gzigs nas brgal zhing brtag pa byed pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig bdag nyid la gzigs nas brgal zhing brtag pa byed pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: But we do not see any person who, having seen himself, engages in debate and analysis.

original: gang gis sngar phyi rol yod pa nyid do zhes rtogs pa de'i 'khrul pa nyid ga las yin zhes pha rol pos de skad brjod pa na /
analyzed: gang gis sngar phyi rol yod pa nyid do zhes rtogs pa de'i 'khrul pa nyid ga las yin zhes pha rol pos de skad brjod pa na /
translated: When the opponent says, “How is it that you have erred in thinking that external objects exist?”

original: bshad pa bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply, “To me.”

original: gzhan yang phyi rol rtogs pa 'di ni re zhig 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol rtogs pa 'di ni re zhig 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, this understanding of external objects is an error.

original: de 'khrul pa nyid du nges pa na nga la 'khrul pa 'di 'dra ba ga las 'byung zhes rgyu'i rtsad bcad pas ci bya /
analyzed: de 'khrul pa nyid du nges pa na nga la 'khrul pa 'di 'dra ba ga las 'byung zhes rgyu'i rtsad bcad pas ci bya /
translated: When it is ascertained that it is an error, what use is it to investigate the cause, saying, “How could such an error arise in me?”

original: rnam par brtags pa 'di ni dngul ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa 'di ni dngul ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is like saying, “This is not silver.”

original: rgol zhing rtog pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgol zhing rtog pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression “I debate and analyze”

original: ji ltar ngas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ngas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is like saying “I.”

original: de'i khyad par ni dngul gyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni dngul gyi khyad par can no //
translated: The distinction is that it is a distinction of silver.

original: khyad par dngul rab tu ma grub na yang dngul de'i khyad par can ji ltar shes pa yin zhes so //
analyzed: khyad par dngul rab tu ma grub na yang dngul de'i khyad par can ji ltar shes pa yin zhes so //
translated: When the distinction of silver is not established, how can silver be known to have that distinction?

original: ji ltar rang nyid de ltar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan la grub na de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid de ltar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan la grub na de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: If it is established for the other in the same way that it is for oneself, then it is just like that.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no //
translated: “If” is the response of the other.

original: de ni med do zhes bya ba'o //🔽rgyu yod pas na 'khrul pa min //
analyzed: de ni med do zhes bya ba'o // rgyu yod pas na 'khrul pa min //
translated: “That does not exist” is the response of the opponent.🔽“Because the cause exists, it is not a mistake”

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod pa ni zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni 'khrul pa ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir don dam pa pa la yang rgyu yod pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod pa ni zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni 'khrul pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir don dam pa pa la yang rgyu yod pa nyid yin no /
translated: means that it is not a mistake just because the cause exists.🔽Because the cause exists, it is not a mistake.

original: don dam pa ni rgyu las byung yang 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ni rgyu las byung yang 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Although the ultimate arises from a cause, it is not a mistake.

original: des na gal te rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is a mistake because it has a cause,🔽then at that time, your assertion,

original: de'i tshe bram ze khyed kyi 'dod pa ni /🔽don dam pa ni mtshan nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bram ze khyed kyi 'dod pa ni / don dam pa ni mtshan nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Brahmin, would be undermined.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'khrul par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'khrul par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate would be a mistake because it would follow that it has a cause.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ma 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ma 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: “In that case” means because it is understood to be non-mistaken.

original: 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhe na brjod pa 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes 'khrul pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhe na brjod pa 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes 'khrul pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If you say that this is an error, then, because of the realization that the error itself is an error, it is the same for error, to say that this is an error.

original: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba la ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba la ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The word “error” is a response to a doubt.

original: gal te phyi'i yul can ma 'khrul par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i yul can ma 'khrul par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were not an error, then it would be an error with respect to an external object.

original: de'i tshe 'di phyi rol la 'khrul pa yin no zhes 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di phyi rol la 'khrul pa yin no zhes 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: At that time, it would be an error with respect to the external object. This is the thought of the opponent.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: ma 'khrul pa zhes yod mod 'on kyang de ci ltar rtogs par bya /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa zhes yod mod 'on kyang de ci ltar rtogs par bya /
translated: Although there is no error, how is it to be understood?

original: ji ltar rtogs par mi nus snyam du dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po nyid mi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan smra ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par mi nus snyam du dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po nyid mi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan smra ba ni /
translated: How is it not possible to understand? Anticipating this doubt, the reason why the opponent himself does not understand is stated:

original: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Error is . . .”

original: phyi rol gyi yul @279b can ma 'khrul pa med pas ma 'khrul pa yang rtogs par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul @279b can ma 'khrul pa med pas ma 'khrul pa yang rtogs par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Since there is no nonerroneous cognition of an external object, it is not possible to understand nonerror. This is the thought.🔽In response to this, the opponent says:

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the case of another . . .”

original: mtshungs pa nyid bsgrub pa ni ma 'khrul ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid bsgrub pa ni ma 'khrul ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof of the equivalence is “and it is not erroneous.”

original: de nyid de ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i tshul du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i tshul du khas len pa'o //
translated: “ It is just like that” means that it is accepted in the manner of the proof.

original: de la ni phyi rol la'o//
analyzed: de la ni phyi rol la'o//
translated: “ In that case” means in the case of external things.

original: gal te rgyu bcas phyir 'khrul na //
analyzed: gal te rgyu bcas phyir 'khrul na //
translated: If it is erroneous because it has a cause,

original: khyed kyi 'dod pa las nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pa las nyams 'gyur //
translated: then your assertion is undermined.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la pha rol gyis lan brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la pha rol gyis lan brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the opponent’s response is “But if it is like that . . .”

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //🔽khyad par dang bcas pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no // khyad par dang bcas pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: “ In that case . . .” is the response.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni yod pa la //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni yod pa la //
translated: The statement of the qualification is “The cause of error . . .

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.🔽

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin nyid shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin nyid shes par 'gyur na /
translated: If the nature of error is known,

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu rgyu des na yang 'khrul par shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu rgyu des na yang 'khrul par shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: then error should be understood to have a cause.

original: des na phan tshun brten pa nyid gcig la yang gnas pa med pas na /
analyzed: des na phan tshun brten pa nyid gcig la yang gnas pa med pas na /
translated: Therefore, since mutual dependence is not established in any one thing,

original: gnas pa med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gnas pa med do zhes brjod do //
translated: it is said that it does not exist.

original: gnas pa med do rgyu med par ji ltar 'khrul snyam na /
analyzed: gnas pa med do rgyu med par ji ltar 'khrul snyam na /
translated: If you think, “If it does not exist, how can error be causeless?”

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Its own nature” is mentioned.

original: da ni rang gi ngo bo de zhes rgyu 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: da ni rang gi ngo bo de zhes rgyu 'dri ba'o //
translated: Now, the cause of that is asked.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “This” refers to the philosophical tenet.

original: 'di la pha rol gyis 'khrul pa'i zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la pha rol gyis 'khrul pa'i zhes smras so //
translated: Here, the opponent says, “The error.”

original: phyi rol yod do zhes 'khrul pa gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa phyi rol med do snyam du rtogs pa de yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes ga las nges /
analyzed: phyi rol yod do zhes 'khrul pa gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa phyi rol med do snyam du rtogs pa de yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes ga las nges /
translated: How can it be ascertained that the error that external objects exist is not the realization of their own nature, and the realization that external objects do not exist is also not a realization that is nonerroneous?

original: de yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that this also would be an error.

original: 'di la lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is “If you think.”

original: phyi rol yod do zhes rtogs pa 'di 'khrul par rtogs par 'dod pa de ltar phyi rol med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa de yang 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs nas /
analyzed: phyi rol yod do zhes rtogs pa 'di 'khrul par rtogs par 'dod pa de ltar phyi rol med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa de yang 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs nas /
translated: If you think that the realization that external objects exist is an error, then you should realize that the realization that external objects do not exist is also an error.

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin mod /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin mod /
translated: At that time, it would be an error.

original: ci zhig skyon yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci zhig skyon yod pa nyid de /
translated: What is the fault?🔽In this way, if the realization that external objects do not exist is an error,

original: 'di ltar gal te phyi rol med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te phyi rol med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur na /
translated: then

original: de'i tshe phyi rol yod do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa snga ma ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol yod do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa snga ma ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “But that cognition of silver is also . . .”

original: dang po dngul du rtogs pa la dngul du rtogs pa de log pa na nya phyis su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po dngul du rtogs pa la dngul du rtogs pa de log pa na nya phyis su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the cognition of silver is overturned, the cognition of mother-of-pearl arises.

original: gal te ldog pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na nya phyis su rtogs pa de yang ldog pa de'i tshe dngul du 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa de slar bden par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na nya phyis su rtogs pa de yang ldog pa de'i tshe dngul du 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa de slar bden par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If there is another cause for the overturning of the cognition of silver, then when that cognition of mother-of-pearl is overturned, how could the cognition apprehending silver be true again?

original: gnyi ga dag kyang med do zhes //
analyzed: gnyi ga dag kyang med do zhes //
translated: “Both are nonexistent”

original: rtogs pas yang mthong med dam ci //
analyzed: rtogs pas yang mthong med dam ci //
translated: “Is it not seen by the cognition?”

original: dngul dang nya phyis gnyi ga yang de na med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba kho na'o //🔽gzhan gyis gal te @280a * //
analyzed: dngul dang nya phyis gnyi ga yang de na med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba kho na'o // gzhan gyis gal te @280a * //
translated: “Both silver and mother-of-pearl are nonexistent there” is seen.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, “If . . .”

original: bden pa de la bstan pa yod pa'i phyir gzhan med pa la bzlog pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa de la bstan pa yod pa'i phyir gzhan med pa la bzlog pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “Because the teaching exists in that truth, the negation of the other is mistaken.”

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is called “the refutation.”

original: gal te dmigs pa dang bcas pa de las bzlog pa bden pa nyid byed pa'i gnod par byed pa med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe bzlog par dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid med pa'i ngo bor gang gis rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa dang bcas pa de las bzlog pa bden pa nyid byed pa'i gnod par byed pa med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe bzlog par dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid med pa'i ngo bor gang gis rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: If the opposite of that which has an observation is the true absence of a refuting opponent, then at that time, how could the opposite be understood to be the nature of that which has an observation?🔽The conclusion is stated:

original: grub pa'i mtha' las 'di la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las 'di la zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Here.”

original: gal te bzlog pa rig gam de ltar ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bzlog pa rig gam de ltar ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the opposite is known,

original: de lta na yang dngos po med pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po med pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: in that case, how could the absence of an entity be ascertained?

original: bum pa'i shes pa yod pa na gang gi tshe snam bu'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe yang bum pa med par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i shes pa yod pa na gang gi tshe snam bu'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe yang bum pa med par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the consciousness of a pot exists, at that time, when the consciousness of a cloth arises, the absence of a pot would be ascertained.

original: 'on te med par nges pa mi dmigs pas byas pa yin na 'o na gnod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'on te med par nges pa mi dmigs pas byas pa yin na 'o na gnod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: But if the ascertainment of absence is produced by nonobservation, then what is the use of another refuting opponent?

original: pha rol gyis smras pa ni bzlog pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dmigs pa mi grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol gyis smras pa ni bzlog pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dmigs pa mi grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The opponent says: The very observation of the opposite is the nonestablishment of the observation.

original: de lta na 'o na rang rig pa tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rang rig pa tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it would be mere reflexive awareness.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na phyi rol rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na phyi rol rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, external awareness would not exist.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the observation.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pas bcas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pas bcas pa la yang ngo //
translated: “ In this case” refers to the case of the observation.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i don bsgrub par yin na dmigs pa med pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i don bsgrub par yin na dmigs pa med pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “ Otherwise” means that if the meaning of possession were the probandum, the absence of observation would not be the probandum.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
translated: “ By whom” refers to the Buddhist.

original: ji ltar de nyid ces bya ba ni ldan pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid ces bya ba ni ldan pa'i don nyid do //
translated: “ How could that be” refers to the meaning of possession.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa ldan pa'i don bsgrub byar mi 'dod mod /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa ldan pa'i don bsgrub byar mi 'dod mod /
translated: The opponent says: Although I do not assert that the meaning of possession is the probandum,

original: de lta yang rig pa de nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yang rig pa de nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: in that case, awareness itself would be the probandum.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ I accept” is the response.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i med de'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i med de'o //
translated: “ That kind of” refers to the absence of possession.

original: de ltar re zhig ldan pa'i don med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes khas blangs nas brjod pa ni /🔽dngos po med pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ldan pa'i don med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes khas blangs nas brjod pa ni / dngos po med pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, having accepted that the meaning of “endowed” is not to be established, he says:🔽“Endowed with non-entityness”

original: dmigs pa'i dngos po med pa dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos po med pa dang ldan par ro //
translated: means endowed with the non-entityness of the object of observation.

original: gal te don dam pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the meaning of the ultimate is not to be established,

original: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa ni don dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa ni don dam pa ma yin te /
translated: then being endowed with non-entityness is not the ultimate,

original: khyad kyi lta ba la don dam pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad kyi lta ba la don dam pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the view of the ultimate is not non-entityness.

original: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa dang ldan pa bsgrub bya yin nam snyam na don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa dang ldan pa bsgrub bya yin nam snyam na don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how could being endowed with non-entityness be the object of affirmation?🔽The meaning of “ultimately” is that the meaning of being endowed with the ultimate is the object of affirmation.

original: don dam pa'i ldan pa'i don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la ni tshad ci yang med do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ldan pa'i don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la ni tshad ci yang med do //
translated: There is no measure of this meaning at all.

original: gal te rtog pa la yang @280b gdon mi za bar rgyu mtshan cung zad cig brjod par bya ba ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa la yang @280b gdon mi za bar rgyu mtshan cung zad cig brjod par bya ba ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that even in terms of thought, is it not the case that some reason must be stated,

original: rang bzhin du zhes te gal te kun rdzob dngos po yin na de'i tshe de nyid de dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin du zhes te gal te kun rdzob dngos po yin na de'i tshe de nyid de dngos po nyid do //
translated: If the conventional were a thing, then it would be reality itself.

original: ming gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bden par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ming gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bden par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: By another name means by the name truth.

original: sgra bshad pa gsum pa ni de kho na la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra bshad pa gsum pa ni de kho na la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third explanation of the term is in reality.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of appearance means the nature of the object of attachment.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tshig tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i tshig tsam gyis so //
translated: By that alone means by that alone as a word.

original: de la ji ltar bden pa zhes brjod snyam na 'khrul pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar bden pa zhes brjod snyam na 'khrul pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one wonders how it is called truth, it is said in error.

original: dmigs pa can la sogs pa med na ji ltar 'dir 'dra'i 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa can la sogs pa med na ji ltar 'dir 'dra'i 'khrul pa yin /
translated: If there were no objects, etc., how could there be error here?

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating this, he says but it exists.

original: lan ni zla ba la sogs pa yod pa yang ci ltar 'khrul pa nyid yin /
analyzed: lan ni zla ba la sogs pa yod pa yang ci ltar 'khrul pa nyid yin /
translated: The answer is but the existence of the moon, etc. is also error.

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Anticipating this, he says but if it exists, etc.

original: zla ba yod kyang de nyid ma yin par snang bas 'khrul ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: zla ba yod kyang de nyid ma yin par snang bas 'khrul ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the moon exists but appears as not being that, so it is error,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is “It is not that.”

original: de nyid ma yin par snang na ji ltar kun rdzob ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ma yin par snang na ji ltar kun rdzob ma yin te /
translated: If it appears as not being that, how is it not a concealer?

original: kun rdzob nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a concealer.

original: gal te de nyid ma yin med bden pa go ci ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te de nyid ma yin med bden pa go ci ltar yin /
translated: If it is not that, how can it be true?

original: kun rdzob kyang yin la bden pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyang yin la bden pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not tenable to say that it is a concealer and also true.

original: bden par snang ba zhes bya ba ste /🔽bden pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bden par snang ba zhes bya ba ste / bden pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: The response to this is “It appears as true.”🔽It is the adherence to what is not true as being true.

original: mi bden pa yang bden par mngon par zhen par ni 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: mi bden pa yang bden par mngon par zhen par ni 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: It is the adherence to what is not true as being true.

original: des na don dam par na kun rdzob nyid yin pas gang yin pa de ni lhag par zhen pa la ltos na bden pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yod do //
analyzed: des na don dam par na kun rdzob nyid yin pas gang yin pa de ni lhag par zhen pa la ltos na bden pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yod do //
translated: Therefore, since it is a concealer in an ultimate sense, what is it that is true in dependence on adherence?

original: des na pha rol po dag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di slu ba'i tshig yin zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de la 'brel to zhes ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na pha rol po dag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di slu ba'i tshig yin zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de la 'brel to zhes ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The expression ‘conventional truth’ is a deceptive statement” is related to the opponent’s position.

original: ji ltar kha chu la mchu'i sbrang rtsi zhes brjod pa slu ba'i tshig ma yin pa de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽bden par snang ba zhes bya ba slu ba'i tshig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar kha chu la mchu'i sbrang rtsi zhes brjod pa slu ba'i tshig ma yin pa de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'am / bden par snang ba zhes bya ba slu ba'i tshig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Just as saliva is called “honey on the lips,” it is not a deceptive statement.

original: slu tshig ma yin pa de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni don gang zhig bden pa ma yin par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: slu tshig ma yin pa de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni don gang zhig bden pa ma yin par 'gyur ba na /
translated: In the same way, how could the expression “conventional truth” or “the appearance of truth” be a deceptive statement?🔽The establishment of the nondeceptive statement is as follows: When an object is not true,

original: bden par snang ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i don de'i bden pa ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bden par snang ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i don de'i bden pa ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: the expression of its untruth is not tenable.

original: de'i tshe slu ba ci zhig yod de ci yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe slu ba ci zhig yod de ci yang med do //
translated: At that time, what deception is there? There is none at all.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ma shes pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ma shes pa'i rgyus na /
translated: Why? Because the opponent does not understand the intention of the Buddha.

original: bdag stod pa brjod par 'dod pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya @281a * //
analyzed: bdag stod pa brjod par 'dod pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya @281a * //
translated: The statement, The so-called conventional truth is a deceptive🔽statement of the Buddhists, and so on, is just a mere statement, for there

original: ba la sogs pa 'di ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'drid tshig yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i smra ba 'ba' zhig po de las 'drid pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa 'di ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'drid tshig yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i smra ba 'ba' zhig po de las 'drid pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: is no deception other than this.

original: brjod pa 'di ni da brjod pa chen po yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //🔽gal te dmigs pa'i dngos po tha dad pa med do zhes pa ma yin bar dgag pa sgrub par byed dam med par dgag pa sgrub kyang rung ste /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di ni da brjod pa chen po yin no zhes dgongs pa'o // gal te dmigs pa'i dngos po tha dad pa med do zhes pa ma yin bar dgag pa sgrub par byed dam med par dgag pa sgrub kyang rung ste /
translated: This statement is a great statement!

original: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de /
translated: If you are proving nonexistence through a negation, or proving nonexistence through a negation, then you are proving what is already established.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid du shes pa las tha dad par med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid du shes pa las tha dad par med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is just that pots and so on are not different from consciousness in being the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: bum pa la sogs de yang shes par dmigs pa yin ba'i phyir nged kyi mi 'dod pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs de yang shes par dmigs pa yin ba'i phyir nged kyi mi 'dod pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Since pots and so on are also observed by consciousness, what is there that we do not accept?

original: gal te shin tu tha dad pas dmigs pa mid par brjod na yang de'i tshe khyed kyi lngar gyi phyogs de ltar brtags pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gal te shin tu tha dad pas dmigs pa mid par brjod na yang de'i tshe khyed kyi lngar gyi phyogs de ltar brtags pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If you say that the object is not perceived because of being very different, then at that time your position contradicts the examination you made earlier.

original: khyod kyis da la shin tu tha dad pas dmigs pa med par bsgrub po zhes da ltar brtags pa de dang sngar gyi phyogs 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya /
analyzed: khyod kyis da la shin tu tha dad pas dmigs pa med par bsgrub po zhes da ltar brtags pa de dang sngar gyi phyogs 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya /
translated: The meaning is that the proof you make now that the object is not perceived because of being very different contradicts the position you made earlier.

original: dngos rtsom zhes gsungs ste /
analyzed: dngos rtsom zhes gsungs ste /
translated: He says, “The composition of the thing.”

original: dngos po'i rnam pa gang yin par tha dad pas sangs rgyas pa blo dmigs pa med par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa gang yin par tha dad pas sangs rgyas pa blo dmigs pa med par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of the thing is that the mind does not perceive the object because of being different.

original: de ni shin tu tha dad pa dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub bar byed pa yin la dngos pa la yang shin tu tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni shin tu tha dad pa dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub bar byed pa yin la dngos pa la yang shin tu tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is the proof that the object is not perceived because of being very different, but the thing does not exist as very different,

original: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from the object of comprehension and so on.

original: des na dngos po las tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: des na dngos po las tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, if you are proving that the object is not perceived by something different from the entity,

original: de ni khyed sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa yin pas 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni khyed sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa yin pas 'gal ba yin no //
translated: then that is what the Buddhists accept, so it is contradictory.

original: 'on te 'dzin pa las gzung pa tha dad pa med pas bsgrub bar bya ba yin na ;
analyzed: 'on te 'dzin pa las gzung pa tha dad pa med pas bsgrub bar bya ba yin na ;
translated: But if you are proving that the object is not different from the subject,

original: de la brjod pa ni nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the response is “the capacity of that.”

original: gcig nyid la byed pa po'i nus pa dang / las kyi nus pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid la byed pa po'i nus pa dang / las kyi nus pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: In the case of a single entity, the capacity of the agent and the capacity of the object are clear.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas pa thams cad zad pas brgya la 'di skad ces smra bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bsams nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas pa thams cad zad pas brgya la 'di skad ces smra bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bsams nas brjod pa ni /
translated: But if it is thought that “it might be that all Buddhists are exhausted, and so this might be said,” the response is,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If that is so . . .”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med do snyam na'i blo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med do snyam na'i blo'o //
translated: “That” refers to the thought that all consciousnesses are without an object.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med de zhes grub bo snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni khyed ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med de zhes grub bo snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni khyed ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The passage beginning You say that all cognition anticipates the following qualm and addresses it: When this correct cognition arises, all the cognition that establishes it is without an object.

original: sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba las skyes ba'i blo shes pa @281b thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin no snyam pa'i nag po la sogs pa'i shes pa mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can gyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa🔽med pa nyid 'dzin nam mi 'dzin /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba las skyes ba'i blo shes pa @281b thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin no snyam pa'i nag po la sogs pa'i shes pa mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can gyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid 'dzin nam mi 'dzin /
translated: You think that all cognition that arises from the cognition that establishes is without an object. But do you apprehend the nonexistence of the object that is the basis of the cognition of black lines, etc.?

original: gal te 'dzin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed ba'i blo de nyid kyis ma nges te shes pa yang yin la dmigs pa med pa yin nam ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed ba'i blo de nyid kyis ma nges te shes pa yang yin la dmigs pa med pa yin nam ma yin te /
translated: If you do apprehend it, then it is not ascertained by that very cognition that establishes it, because it is cognition and it is without an object.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa de nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like that very inferential cognition.

original: 'on te mi 'dzin de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di ni smig rgyu la chu'i blo bzhin du rang gi cha la 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dzin de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di ni smig rgyu la chu'i blo bzhin du rang gi cha la 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: But if it does not apprehend it, then this knowledge of inference is like the cognition of water with respect to a mirage, it apprehends its own part.

original: des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i blo de gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir na ga pa la la sogs pa'i shes pa bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis 'gal zlar gyur pa de bzlog pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir na
analyzed: des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i blo de gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir na ga pa la la sogs pa'i shes pa bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis 'gal zlar gyur pa de bzlog pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir na
translated: Therefore, since the two cognitions of the apprehended and the apprehender are different objects, the knowledge of a cow, etc., which is the object of apprehension of the knowledge of a pot, etc., is not nonexistent. Because of the absence of an object of negation,

original: / nag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yod pa de gang gis zlog par byed de 'gas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: / nag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yod pa de gang gis zlog par byed de 'gas kyang ma yin no //
translated: the knowledge of a cow, etc., would be inherently possessed of an object of apprehension. Who could stop that? No one could.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i dogs bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i dogs bsu ba'o //
translated: “If” is a hypothetical supposition.

original: sgra gang la rig pa'i dmigs pa yod pa des 'gog na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra gang la rig pa'i dmigs pa yod pa des 'gog na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you refute that sound has an object of apprehension of awareness, then you are proving what is already established.

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i sgra la blo bskyed pa'i nus pa yod ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya bar gyur pas 'gog na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa'i khyed kyi bsgrub bya mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i sgra la blo bskyed pa'i nus pa yod ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya bar gyur pas 'gog na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa'i khyed kyi bsgrub bya mi 'grub po //
