translated: But if you refute it on the grounds that the word “realized” has the capacity to generate understanding and is the expressed meaning of a word that has a referent, then at that time your probandum is not established.

original: rtogs par byed pa med par ni sgrub par byed pa sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa med par ni sgrub par byed pa sbyor ba med do //
translated: Without a realizer, there is no application of a proof.

original: khyed kyis blo skyed par byed pa nyid kyis bkag pas ni rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis bkag pas de ji ltar bsgrub bya 'grub /
analyzed: khyed kyis blo skyed par byed pa nyid kyis bkag pas ni rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis bkag pas de ji ltar bsgrub bya 'grub /
translated: Since you refute it by the capacity to generate understanding, how is the probandum established by the capacity to realize?

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni brjod par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni brjod par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Another refutation is stated: “The expressed meaning of the word . . .”

original: sgra'i rjod par byed pa ni 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i rjod par byed pa ni 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The expressed meaning of a word is not unrelated.

original: 'brel pa med pa yang tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa yang tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the unrelated different, because the relation is based on two things.

original: tha dad pa de yang dag la brten pa'i tha dad par rtogs par byed pa'i blo med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa de yang dag la brten pa'i tha dad par rtogs par byed pa'i blo med pa ma yin no //
translated: And that difference is not without the cognition that realizes the difference based on reality.

original: dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed kyi ltar na ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par smra ba khyed kyi ltar na ni /
translated: According to you, who maintain that there is no object,

original: de 'dra ba'i blo yod pa ma yin te des na rgyu med pa'i dag sbyor pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i blo yod pa ma yin te des na rgyu med pa'i dag sbyor pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: there is no such cognition, and therefore it is not tenable that the syllogism is stated without a reason.

original: gzhan yang rtogs pa po rnams kyis zhes bya ba dbang po dang / nyan pa po rnams kyis cha shes dang bcas pa dag so sor ma bzung ba de bzhin du dag gi brjod par bya ba phyogs la sogs pa so sor ma bzung ba dang /🔽de bzhin du rtsod pa @282a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtogs pa po rnams kyis zhes bya ba dbang po dang / nyan pa po rnams kyis cha shes dang bcas pa dag so sor ma bzung ba de bzhin du dag gi brjod par bya ba phyogs la sogs pa so sor ma bzung ba dang / de bzhin du rtsod pa @282a * //
translated: Moreover, the one who understands, i.e., the one who has the sense faculty and hears, does not apprehend the parts individually, and in the same way, the one who understands does not apprehend the parts of the object individually, such as the directions.🔽Similarly, the one who understands does not apprehend the disputants individually, i.e., the proponent and opponent.

original: gang dag yin pa'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba de dag so sor ma bzung bar ni sgrub par byed pa sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag yin pa'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba de dag so sor ma bzung bar ni sgrub par byed pa sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without apprehending the disputants individually, the proof, i.e., the syllogism, is not stated.

original: gal te de dag ces bya ba sngar brjod pa de dag kun khas blangs nas dmigs pa med bar smra ba dag sgrub par byed na sbyor bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de dag ces bya ba sngar brjod pa de dag kun khas blangs nas dmigs pa med bar smra ba dag sgrub par byed na sbyor bar 'dod na /
translated: If you, who maintain that there is no object, accept all of the above, i.e., the one who understands, the object, and the disputants, and then state a proof, i.e., a syllogism,

original: de'i tshe khyed kyi dam bca' ba dmigs pa med pa nyid sngar gyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pas gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyed kyi dam bca' ba dmigs pa med pa nyid sngar gyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pas gnod do zhe na /
translated: At that time, you accept that the thesis of the absence of an object is itself associated with an object, and so it is undermined.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is a proponent of tenets

original: thams cad ni ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad ni ces gsungs so //
translated: says, “Everything is . . .”

original: de'i tshe yod kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa yang ngo //
translated: At that time, “even though it exists” means that it is associated with the property of being an object of knowledge and so on.

original: gzhal bya las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal bya las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ From the object of knowledge” means

original: bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: from a pot and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid do //
translated: “ That” refers to the object of knowledge.

original: rig pa dang de las gzhan pa'i sngon po la sogs pa de dag gal te gzhal bya nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: rig pa dang de las gzhan pa'i sngon po la sogs pa de dag gal te gzhal bya nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa yin na /
translated: If cognition and that which is different from it, such as blue and so on, are not intrinsically different due to being objects of knowledge,

original: de'i tshe myong pa las sngon po la sogs pa de gzhan ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa de ni shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe myong pa las sngon po la sogs pa de gzhan ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa de ni shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, from the experience of that blue and so on, it is not different. However, that blue and so on would become cognition itself.

original: ji ltar grub pa la sgrub par mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar grub pa la sgrub par mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could it not be the case that you are proving what is already established?

original: rtogs med yin na tha dad par 'gyur gyi rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs med yin na tha dad par 'gyur gyi rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were non-apprehension, it would be different, but it is not different.

original: des na dmigs pa med na zhes bya ba ni shin tu tha dad pa des dmigs pa med na'o //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med na zhes bya ba ni shin tu tha dad pa des dmigs pa med na'o //
translated: Therefore, if there is no object means if there is no object due to that very difference.

original: gal te de lta na yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But even if that is so, is there not a difference in nature, such as blue and yellow?

original: shes pa'i rnam pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be the aspect of consciousness.

original: gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “grasped” refers to the aspect of the grasped, etc.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if blue, etc. are consciousness,

original: de lta na yang de ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: in that case, they would be blue, etc.

original: des na dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'grub snyam na /🔽gnyis ka zhe smos te /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'grub snyam na / gnyis ka zhe smos te /
translated: Therefore, how is it established without an object?🔽Both means

original: sngon po dang ser po gnyis ka'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po gnyis ka'o //
translated: blue and yellow.

original: dpe gsungs pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga rtogs pa yin na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe gsungs pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga rtogs pa yin na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The example is stated: If both pleasure and pain are realized, then the existence of an object is not.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la dang shes pa gnyi ga rtogs pa yin na dmigs pa nyid der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la dang shes pa gnyi ga rtogs pa yin na dmigs pa nyid der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if both blue and consciousness were to be realized, the object would not be the object.

original: rtogs pa las tha dad pa med pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye pa dang / dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bar yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa las tha dad pa med pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye pa dang / dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bar yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how could there be a distinction between subject and object, or a distinction between white, blue, and so on, if they were not separate from the realization?

original: 'di la brjod pa dngos po gang zhig ta mi dad pa med min te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa dngos po gang zhig ta mi dad pa med min te /
translated: In response to this, we say that there is no thing that is not separate.

original: tha dad pa snang tshogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa snang tshogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of separateness exists.

original: bsams @282b pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsams @282b pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: dngos tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na dngos po dang shes pa dag tha dad pa med do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na dngos po dang shes pa dag tha dad pa med do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: We say that things and consciousness are not separate because they are not separate things.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: But there is a difference in their nature, such as blue and yellow.

original: des na gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye pa yang 'di nyid la nges pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye pa yang 'di nyid la nges pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the distinction between subject and object is also ascertained in this way.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The clarification of this is For example, etc..

original: gzung ba dang cig shos 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin rig pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang cig shos 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de bzhin rig pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of suchness does not exist in the nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de kho na nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'o //
translated: The difference of reality is the difference of nature.

original: ma rung ba'i bdag nyid bram ze la sogs pa rnams kyis so ;🔽/ sngar gyi phyogs las zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i phyogs la so //
analyzed: ma rung ba'i bdag nyid bram ze la sogs pa rnams kyis so ; / sngar gyi phyogs las zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i phyogs la so //
translated: The unfit nature is of the Brahmins, etc.

original: de bzhin thams cad skye pa ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad skye pa ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: From the former position, i.e., from the position of non-apprehension, all things are non-arisen is established.🔽The non-apprehension of all things is the non-apprehension of the grasped and the grasper.

original: phyogs 'di gnyi la sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di gnyi la sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In both of these positions, there is no difference in the proof.

original: des na ji ltar chos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar chos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin /
translated: Therefore, how can the Dharma not be established?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs med pa nyid do //
translated: That, i.e., non-apprehension, is not understood by the world.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i sgra 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la brjod pa ni rtog 'i  sgra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i sgra 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la brjod pa ni rtog 'i  sgra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If this word understanding is used, etc., the word understanding is used.

original: pha rol gyi 'khrul ba ni dmigs pa dang bca' pa nyid sgrub par byed bshes pa nyid bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'khrul ba ni dmigs pa dang bca' pa nyid sgrub par byed bshes pa nyid bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The error of the opponent is the proof of the existence of the object and the negation of the non-existence of the object.

original: dper na du bas me ma yin pa las gzhan ldog pa bsgrub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du bas me ma yin pa las gzhan ldog pa bsgrub pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the proof of the exclusion of fire from the non-existent by smoke.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were not so,

original: don 'di rgol bas rtogs par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: don 'di rgol bas rtogs par ma gyur na'o //
translated: if the opponent did not understand this meaning.

original: de dmigs pa med pa'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa nyid do snyam pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i blo gang yin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de dmigs pa med pa'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa nyid do snyam pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i blo gang yin pa yang ngo //
translated: The cognition that there is no object, that is, the cognition that all cognitions are without objects,

original: dogs pa bsu nas rjes su dpag pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bas pa nyid med do zhes bya de ni ji ltar mi slu ba yin na zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas rjes su dpag pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bas pa nyid med do zhes bya de ni ji ltar mi slu ba yin na zhe na /
translated: is not without an object, because it is a cognition. How can it be non-deceptive?

original: 'di la brjod pa dmigs pa dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa dmigs pa dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is: because the object is the cause of the cognition.

original: 'di gnyis gzhan la dri ba'i sogs nas bsgrub pa ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gzhan la dri ba'i sogs nas bsgrub pa ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo'o //
translated: These two are to be asked of the other. The proof is the cognition that the pot does not exist, etc.

original: gal te snang ba ma dmigs pas don de ma dmigs pas de'i tshe ni slu ba 'di 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba ma dmigs pas don de ma dmigs pas de'i tshe ni slu ba 'di 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If, on the other hand, the object is not perceived because the appearance is not perceived, then this is a deception.

original: zhes gzhan gyis lan btab pa na de lta na ni zhes gsungs sos //
analyzed: zhes gzhan gyis lan btab pa na de lta na ni zhes gsungs sos //
translated: Thus, the opponent replies.

original: de kho na nyid nges pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid nges pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of reality is the reason for the statement, “There is no perception.”

original: phyis dmigs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyi rna mi slu pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis dmigs pa ma dmigs pa'i phyi rna mi slu pa yin no //
translated: Later, the non-perception of the perception is non-deceptive.

original: dmigs pa gzhan sel ba ni ste @283a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan sel ba ni ste @283a * //
translated: The exclusion of other perceptions

original: dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa med pa nyid de'i rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa med pa nyid de'i rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: is the cause of the cognition of the non-existence of non-perception.

original: brjod pa 'brel ba med pa min //
analyzed: brjod pa 'brel ba med pa min //
translated: The statement that is not unrelated

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o //🔽don rnams kyi 'brel ba yod pa nyid la brtags ba'i tha dad pa yang yod do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o // don rnams kyi 'brel ba yod pa nyid la brtags ba'i tha dad pa yang yod do zhes 'brel to //
translated: refers to the statement “Therefore, . . .”🔽The existence of the relation of the objects is examined.

original: tha dad par 'dzin pa blo gang yin pa de'i yul yang brjod du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad par 'dzin pa blo gang yin pa de'i yul yang brjod du yod pa nyid do //
translated: The object of the cognition that grasps the difference is also expressible.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol dbang phyir rgol pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol dbang phyir rgol pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The also is in reference to the fact that the proponent and opponent are held to be different.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par ston par byed pa'i rnam 'grel bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par ston par byed pa'i rnam 'grel bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: The previously is in reference to the context of the commentary on the Vigrahavyāvartanī, which teaches nonduality.

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni tha dad ba med par sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni tha dad ba med par sgrub pa la'o //
translated: The without that is in reference to the proof of nondifference.

original: rang gi snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The own appearance is in reference to such things as pots.

original: ji ltar gnod ce na de yang zhe smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnod ce na de yang zhe smras te /
translated: How is it harmed? He says, That also....

original: rang gi snang ba nyid du rtogs par bya'i bum pa la bo pa yang ngo //🔽gal te dogs par byed pa rnams kyis re zhig de nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi snang ba nyid du rtogs par bya'i bum pa la bo pa yang ngo // gal te dogs par byed pa rnams kyis re zhig de nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: It is to be understood as own appearance, not as pot, and so on.🔽If one thinks, Are not those who doubt understanding that?

original: de ji ltar de'i tshig las kyang yid ches pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na rtogs par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i tshig las kyang yid ches pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na rtogs par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How could it be that they have no confidence in that statement? [the response is that] those who doubt...

original: phyogs gcig tu lhung bas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyogs lhung bas so / phan tshun 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu lhung bas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyogs lhung bas so / phan tshun 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Mutually contradictory” means

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
translated: apprehension and non-apprehension.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rtogs pa can no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rtogs pa can no //
translated: The one who has the apprehension of mutually contradictory things is a conceptualist.

original: de dang 'gal zhes bya ba tshad mas grub pas de dang 'gal ba sngar gyi khas blangs pa gang yin pa sel to zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal zhes bya ba tshad mas grub pas de dang 'gal ba sngar gyi khas blangs pa gang yin pa sel to zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i blo'o //
translated: “Contradictory to that” means that the previously asserted apprehension is eliminated by the establishment of a valid cognition. This is a different idea.

original: phyin ci log tu song ba zhes bya ba de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu song ba zhes bya ba de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having gone wrong” means having become otherwise.

original: ci ste 'gal bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'gal bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it not to be contradicted?”

original: gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so //
translated: [The answer is] “If” is stated.

original: rnam pa ci zhig ltar khas blangs pa'i tha dad pas tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i tha mi dad pa la gnod kyi tshad ma'i stobs kyi shugs las 'ongs pa'i tha mi dad pa 'dis ni snga ma tha dad pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: rnam pa ci zhig ltar khas blangs pa'i tha dad pas tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i tha mi dad pa la gnod kyi tshad ma'i stobs kyi shugs las 'ongs pa'i tha mi dad pa 'dis ni snga ma tha dad pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya
translated: In what way is the difference that is accepted by you, who are not purified by valid cognition, harmed by non-difference that is established by the power of valid cognition? This non-difference that comes from the power of valid cognition does not harm the previously accepted difference.

original: ba'i mi 'thad pa 'di pas bstod nas ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: ba'i mi 'thad pa 'di pas bstod nas ji ltar brjod /
translated: How could this be praised by you, who are not tenable?

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase whatever and so on is a summary of everything.

original: slob dpon dang bdang nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs pa grub pa med na tshes la sog pa nye bar ston pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dang bdang nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs pa grub pa med na tshes la sog pa nye bar ston pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the master and the self, and the realization of dharma and non-dharma, are not established, then the teaching of dharma and so on is not tenable.

original: de sgrub pa phyir na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa des rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub pa phyir na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa des rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of establishing that, means because of establishing that teaching.

original: de ltar re zhig nye bar bstan pa gzhan du mi @283b 'thad pa tha dad pa khams blangs par bsgrub pas nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nye bar bstan pa gzhan du mi @283b 'thad pa tha dad pa khams blangs par bsgrub pas nas /
translated: Thus, first, the teaching is not tenable as a difference.

original: dngos po nyid du bsgrub pa'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po nyid du bsgrub pa'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of establishing as an entity is stated.

original: gsal par nges zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal par nges zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is certain that it is clear” .

original: de med par bsgrub pa ni lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur pa yin /
analyzed: de med par bsgrub pa ni lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur pa yin /
translated: If it is established that it does not exist, then it contradicts scripture.

original: phyogs la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: phyogs la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: “In the case of the position” refers to the nonexistence of the object.

original: thams cad med pa'am zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad med pa'am zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Everything would be nonexistent” means that even the object would not exist.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i blo phyin ci log yin na ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i blo phyin ci log yin na ni /
translated: If the cognition that establishes is erroneous,

original: des bsgrub par bya ba dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the object of the establishment, the nonexistence of the object, would not exist.

original: ci 'dod par ma tshang la sogs //
analyzed: ci 'dod par ma tshang la sogs //
translated: If one says that the establishment is incomplete, etc.,🔽if at that time the establishment is not incomplete and does not have an extra part,🔽then how could the object of the establishment be established?

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sgrub par byed pa brjod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sgrub par byed pa brjod /
translated: If one says that the establishment is erroneous,🔽then the object of the establishment, the nonexistence of the object, would not exist.🔽If one says that the establishment is incomplete, etc.,🔽if at that time the establishment is not incomplete and does not have an extra part,🔽then how could the object of the establishment be established?🔽If one says that the cognition that establishes is erroneous,

original: de'i tshe bden par bya ba'i ma tshang pa ma yin pa dang / lhag ma yang ma yin par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe sgrub par byed pa'i blo brdzun pa yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar sbyar bya la rag par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bden par bya ba'i ma tshang pa ma yin pa dang / lhag ma yang ma yin par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe sgrub par byed pa'i blo brdzun pa yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar sbyar bya la rag par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: then how could the object of the establishment be established?

original: de dag ces bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i blos bskyed pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i blos bskyed pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: “Those” refers to the cognitions produced by the cognition that proves the statement, “All cognitions are without an object.”

original: ma nges pa ni shes pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni shes pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Uncertain” means that cognition itself is the reason.

original: shes pa'ang yin la dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'ang yin la dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that cognition is not without an object,

original: dper na sgrub par byed pa skyed pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar ro //🔽sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsun ba ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽sgrub par byed pa shes bya las skyes pa las gzhan dam bcas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sgrub par byed pa skyed pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar ro // sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsun ba ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni / sgrub par byed pa shes bya las skyes pa las gzhan dam bcas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: just as, for example, the cognition that produces the proof is not without an object.🔽The refutation of the doubt of the Buddhist: If you say that the cognition that is the object of the proof is different from the cognition that is the proof,🔽then the cognition that is the object of the proof is different from the cognition that is the proof.

original: phyi rol pa sun 'byin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i shes bya las gzhan no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa sun 'byin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i shes bya las gzhan no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of the non-Buddhist: The cognition that is the object of the proof is different from the cognition that is the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa las skyes pa'i shes pa kho na bden pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ni thams cad mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa las skyes pa'i shes pa kho na bden pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ni thams cad mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the cognition produced by the proof is true, and the other is not true at all.

original: yang ji ltar na gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa brdzun no zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa brdzun no zhe na /
translated: And how is the cognition of the other false?

original: phyogs sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the directions, etc.”

original: gang gis de bzhin no snyam pa'i shes pa la ni phyogs log pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin no snyam pa'i shes pa la ni phyogs log pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of the other as it is does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na phyogs pa'i nang du ma 'dus na ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs la sogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyi ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na phyogs pa'i nang du ma 'dus na ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs la sogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyi ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How so? The meaning is that it is not included among the directions, etc., because it is not included among the directions, etc., without being included among them.

original: 'di ltar sgrub par byed pas bskyed pa'i blo kho na la phyogs nyid med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub par byed pas bskyed pa'i blo kho na la phyogs nyid med kyi /
translated: Thus, only the cognition produced by the proof is not a direction,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa thams cad la ni phyogs nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa thams cad la ni phyogs nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: but all other cognitions have a direction.

original: de lta yin dang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa la 'di @284a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa la 'di @284a * //
translated: If that is so, then in the cognition produced by the proof,

original: dag gzhan yin no snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs nyid yin te /
analyzed: dag gzhan yin no snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs nyid yin te /
translated: The cognition that thinks “it is different” is also the thesis,

original: sgrub par byed pas skyed pa'i blo las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pas skyed pa'i blo las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from the cognition produced by the proof.

original: gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa'i brdzun pa nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa'i brdzun pa nyid yin mod /
translated: It is true that the cognition that thinks “it is different” is false.

original: nyes ba ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: nyes ba ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: de ni log par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni log par zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “that is mistaken.”

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the cognition that is different from the cognition that is the proof is to be established as not having an object,

original: gang gi tshe gzhan zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'khrul ba yin ba de'i tshe shes pa des yul du byas pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir na gang zhig phyogs nyid yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'khrul ba yin ba de'i tshe shes pa des yul du byas pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir na gang zhig phyogs nyid yin /
translated: then when the cognition called “different” is mistaken, the object that is the object of that cognition does not exist, and therefore what is the thesis?

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: He states that:

original: de tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang gzhan no snyam pa'i shes pa las gzhan phyogs su byed do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang gzhan no snyam pa'i shes pa las gzhan phyogs su byed do snyam na /
translated: If you think that the thesis is that which is different from the cognition that is the proof and that which is different from the cognition that thinks “it is different,”

original: ji srid ci srid ces smras so //
analyzed: ji srid ci srid ces smras so //
translated: “For as long as” and “to the extent that” are said.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang / gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa las kyang gzhan gang yin pa de dag phyogs yin no zhes bya ba gang gi tshe dam bcas pa de'i tshe phyi ma gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa phyi ma log pa yin pa'i phyir dag po la gnang ngo //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dang / gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa las kyang gzhan gang yin pa de dag phyogs yin no zhes bya ba gang gi tshe dam bcas pa de'i tshe phyi ma gzhan snyam pa'i shes pa phyi ma log pa yin pa'i phyir dag po la gnang ngo //
translated: And when it is asserted that “the position is whatever is other than the cognition that establishes and the cognition that conceives of other,” then the latter, the cognition that conceives of other, is undermined, and so the position is undermined.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By inference.”

original: 'gal pa mi 'khrul ba nyid ston pan phyi rol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal pa mi 'khrul ba nyid ston pan phyi rol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that there is no contradiction, he says, “External objects do not exist.”

original: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gsal pa yang yin mod /
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gsal pa yang yin mod /
translated: Since this is an inference, it is also clear.

original: de yang zhes bya ba rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod pa'i blo yang lod pa yin no zhes gsungs rgyas pa smra na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod pa'i blo yang lod pa yin no zhes gsungs rgyas pa smra na /
translated: And that is also undermined by the cognition that is undermined in dreams and so on.

original: de'i tshe rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the cognition of dreams and so on is not undermined,

original: de la gnod par byed pa shes pa log pa yin ba'i phyi ro //
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa shes pa log pa yin ba'i phyi ro //
translated: because the cognition that undermines it is undermined.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa med pa yin na /
translated: If dreams and so on do not exist,

original: yang da ni khyed sangs rgyas pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang da ni khyed sangs rgyas pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: then all of your proofs of Buddhism are without an object.

original: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no zhes chos mthun pa'i dpe med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no zhes chos mthun pa'i dpe med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, like dreams and so on.

original: gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni rnam shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni rnam shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other refutation is stated in the line “consciousness.”

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yod pa yin dang / tha dad pa dang skad cig ma nyid kyis shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yod pa yin dang / tha dad pa dang skad cig ma nyid kyis shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that alone, the reason “because consciousness exists and because of difference and momentariness” is indeterminate.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid la 'gog pa'i blo rnams log pa gang yin pa de rtogs par khas len na phyogs la @284b gnod par thal lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid la 'gog pa'i blo rnams log pa gang yin pa de rtogs par khas len na phyogs la @284b gnod par thal lo //
translated: If you accept that the cessation of consciousness is the realization of the cessation of consciousness, then it follows that the position is undermined.

original: lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid 'ga' yang med na'o //
analyzed: lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid 'ga' yang med na'o //
translated: If there is no reality at all, then the world would be like a sky-flower.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no bondage and no liberation,

original: thar pa'i 'bad pa la bsgom pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu med par khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: thar pa'i 'bad pa la bsgom pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu med par khas len no zhe na /
translated: we accept that striving for liberation, such as meditation, is fruitless.

original: da ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Now the proponent of tenets says, “That is not so.”

original: 'dod chags kyi sgras ni mi 'dod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sgras ni mi 'dod pa gzung ngo //
translated: By the word “attachment,” he means “non-apprehension.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to cyclic existence.

original: dngos po gang la skyes bu gang gis de nyid kyi blo yod pa de ni de la 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po gang la skyes bu gang gis de nyid kyi blo yod pa de ni de la 'jug go //
translated: When a person has the cognition of reality with regard to any thing, he engages with it.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten la 'jug pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang glang po'i gzigs tshul du mdzad nas dngos po de dang de nye bar ston pa yin nam ci ste ston pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten la 'jug pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyang glang po'i gzigs tshul du mdzad nas dngos po de dang de nye bar ston pa yin nam ci ste ston pa kho na'o //
translated: Is it the case that the Bhagavat, like an elephant, having engaged with the world in that way, teaches this and that thing?

original: der zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: “There” refers to the things taught by the Bhagavat.

original: des de'i bsam pas zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i skye bo'o bsam pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde dag gis so //
analyzed: des de'i bsam pas zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i skye bo'o bsam pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde dag gis so //
translated: The word by it refers to the sutras spoken by the thought of the one who is born in cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten kun gyi grags pas kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi grags pas kyang //
translated: And by the world's renown.

original: zhes gang brjod pa de la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gang brjod pa de la brjod pa ni /
translated: As for what was said, there, that is not taught,

original: de la ni de nyid ma rig pa la ni dmigs ba thams cad dang bral ba ma bstan to //
analyzed: de la ni de nyid ma rig pa la ni dmigs ba thams cad dang bral ba ma bstan to //
translated: there, in the ignorance, all objects are not taught.

original: de la ni de nyid ma rig pa la'o //
analyzed: de la ni de nyid ma rig pa la'o //
translated: There, in the ignorance.

original: dmigs pa thams cad med kyang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad med kyang ngo //
translated: Even though there are no objects,🔽if you teach the absence of error, then that,

original: skyon med pa nyid ston na ni de'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub byed kyi rjes su dpag pa nyid dmigs pa med pas dmigs pa med pa'i rjes su dpag pa de las dmigs pa med pa nyid de ma 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: skyon med pa nyid ston na ni de'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub byed kyi rjes su dpag pa nyid dmigs pa med pas dmigs pa med pa'i rjes su dpag pa de las dmigs pa med pa nyid de ma 'grub po zhe na /
translated: that is, the inference that proves the absence of objects, is itself without an object. Therefore, the absence of objects is not established from that inference that lacks an object.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni slu med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni slu med ces bya ba'o //
translated: As for what was said, it is not deceptive,

original: dmigs pa yod pa nyid ni bsgrub par yang ba yin na /
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa nyid ni bsgrub par yang ba yin na /
translated: if the existence of objects is being proven,

original: des na sgrub par byed pas bskyed pa'i shes pa de ni chos mthun pa can dpe zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pas bskyed pa'i shes pa de ni chos mthun pa can dpe zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition produced by the proof is called the example that has the property in common, because it is the similar class.

original: de ltar yin dang de las gzhan pa'i dam bca' ba log pa nyid yin par 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de las gzhan pa'i dam bca' ba log pa nyid yin par 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is like that, then the opposite of that thesis is asserted to be the very opposite.

original: de sna log pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis shes pa'i log pa sngon du 'gro pa can gyi skyon gyis so //
analyzed: de sna log pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis shes pa'i log pa sngon du 'gro pa can gyi skyon gyis so //
translated: The opposite of that is called the other, because it is preceded by the fault of the opposite of cognition by others.

original: ji ltar na thug pa med par mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thug pa med par mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, how can it not be infinite,

original: de las gzhan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said to be the other than that.

original: mi slu ba'i shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, how can non-deceptive cognition be without an object,

original: slu ba med pa zhes gsungs so /🔽gal te rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: slu ba med pa zhes gsungs so / gal te rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: it is said to be non-deceptive.🔽If cognition of harm in dreams and so on has an object,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi mthun phyogs nyid du 'gyur pa gal te gnod pa'i blo @285a * //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi mthun phyogs nyid du 'gyur pa gal te gnod pa'i blo @285a * //
translated: it would be the similar class in the context of establishing dreams and so on as without an object. If cognition of harm

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid kyis ma nges so snyam na rmi sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid kyis ma nges so snyam na rmi sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it has an object, then it is not established by that.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i blo bden ba ni rmi lam la sogs par mi dmigs pas bsgrubs pa yin gyi gnod byed kyi dmigs pa dang bcas ba ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i blo bden ba ni rmi lam la sogs par mi dmigs pas bsgrubs pa yin gyi gnod byed kyi dmigs pa dang bcas ba ni ma yin no ;
translated: The cognition that invalidates dreams, etc., is established by the non-apprehension of dreams, etc., but it is not that the invalidator has an object.

original: / des bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs la gnod pa'i blos bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: / des bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs la gnod pa'i blos bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Generated by that” means generated by the cognition that invalidates dreams, etc.

original: rnam shes yod pa dang tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod ba ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes yod pa dang tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod ba ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Not different from the existence of consciousness” and so on means that the expression is momentary.

original: shes pa skad cig yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa skad cig yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is momentary, but external objects are not.

original: rgyu des phyi ro dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: rgyu des phyi ro dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub po //
translated: For that reason, the establishment of the existence of external objects is not established.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa ma grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa ma grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The non-establishment of external objects is intended.

original: gal te khyod kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang mi 'grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang mi 'grub pa kho na ste /
translated: If you say that the non-existence of objects is not established,

original: skad cig ma'i blo ni rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i blo ni rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the momentary mind is the object of consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs yin no shes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs yin no shes gsungs te /
translated: This is the opponent’s position.

original: dmigs pa gzhan gyis ni dmigs dang bcas pa rmi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag cig gi phyogs yin no /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan gyis ni dmigs dang bcas pa rmi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag cig gi phyogs yin no /
translated: “The one with an object is the one that arises with an object” is our position.

original: gal te dang gi ngo bos dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dang gi ngo bos dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind were to have an object by its very nature,

original: de'i tshe 'gyur la rags te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gyur la rags te /
translated: then it would always have an object.

original: rang gi rang bzhin ni dmigs par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin ni dmigs par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its own nature is asserted to be its object.

original: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni bdag chag gi phyogs yin no ;
analyzed: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni bdag chag gi phyogs yin no ;
translated: “In that way” is our position.

original: / rnam par shes pa'i dbang nyid du gyur pas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa'i dbang nyid du gyur pas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind has an object because it is under the power of consciousness, not because it has an object.

original: dmigs pa tha dad par zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad par zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa las gzhan no //
translated: “A different object” is something other than the apprehender.

original: de ni phyi rol yin nam shes pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de ni phyi rol yin nam shes pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is external or consciousness,🔽what is the difference?

original: khyad ci yong ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: khyad ci yong ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the opponent’s thought.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni skad cig nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni skad cig nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “momentariness” is used here.

original: de re zhig rjes su dmigs pa ni shes pa gzhan na ma khyi rol gyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de re zhig rjes su dmigs pa ni shes pa gzhan na ma khyi rol gyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the object of cognition is not grasped by another cognition,

original: de ni rang dmigs pa rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas gzhan sel ba dang bcas par bsams zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang dmigs pa rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas gzhan sel ba dang bcas par bsams zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been grasped by the cognition that has it as its object.

original: gal te rjes su dpag par mi slu bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag par mi slu bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: If it is argued that it is not deceptive with respect to inference,

original: ci ltar dmigs pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar dmigs pa med snyam na /
translated: how can it be grasped?

original: slu ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slu ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be non-deceptive.

original: yang ji ltar de mngon sum nyid yin snyam na dngos su byas na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar de mngon sum nyid yin snyam na dngos su byas na zhes gsungs so //
translated: And how is it direct perception? It is said to be direct.

original: rig pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa'i skad cig ma nyid gang yin pa de ni gang de'i bdag tu gyur pa'i rig pa de las @285b gzhan pa'i rig pas gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa'i skad cig ma nyid gang yin pa de ni gang de'i bdag tu gyur pa'i rig pa de las @285b gzhan pa'i rig pas gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That very momentariness which is the nature of that cognition cannot be grasped by another cognition that has a different nature.

original: ci ste zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ci ste zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Anticipating this doubt,

original: de'i rang bzhin gsungs sos //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gsungs sos //
translated: its nature is stated.

original: de'i rang bzhin rig par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis kyang de rig par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis kyang de rig par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that the nature of that object is not known by the knower, then it would be known by something else.

original: rig pa med par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rig pa med par zhes gsungs so //
translated: But it is not known by anything else.

original: don gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas rig bar byed pa tha dad pa khas len pa yin la /
analyzed: don gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas rig bar byed pa tha dad pa khas len pa yin la /
translated: Since it is not tenable that a clear object is different, you accept that the knower is different.

original: gsal ba yang rang las 'gyur pa nyid de ltar na mthong ba ni rang ni kho na gsal bar khas len pa de bzhin du gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas ci zhig bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba yang rang las 'gyur pa nyid de ltar na mthong ba ni rang ni kho na gsal bar khas len pa de bzhin du gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas ci zhig bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: But the clear object is just the transformation of the knower. In that case, what is the use of accepting that the knower is clear by itself and that the knower and the clear object are different?

original: 'on tre rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid bdag sngon po la sogs pa myong mong bar byed pa ni lta ba po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on tre rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid bdag sngon po la sogs pa myong mong bar byed pa ni lta ba po yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self, which has the nature of the characteristic of the experiencer of blue and so on, is the seer,

original: de'i tshe bdag de'i mthong byed ga las 'dod /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag de'i mthong byed ga las 'dod /
translated: then how could that self be the seer?

original: de lta ma yin na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: rang rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is reflexive awareness,

original: de ltar zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes smos te /
translated: then it is said that it is not so.

original: rang nyid rig par byed pa ni'o //
analyzed: rang nyid rig par byed pa ni'o //
translated: The knower is not the object of knowledge.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang rang rig bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang rang rig bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: Blue and so on are the objects of self-awareness.

original: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of both is the nature of substance and self-awareness.

original: rig bya rig byed gang yin bde ni gcig yin te /
analyzed: rig bya rig byed gang yin bde ni gcig yin te /
translated: What is to be cognized and what cognizes are one.

original: des na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin gnyis su gcig tu 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin gnyis su gcig tu 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that the nature of realization and the nature of substance are one.

original: des na bdag dang sngon po yang rig bya rig byed kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag dang sngon po yang rig bya rig byed kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the self and blue would be one by the nature of being cognized and cognizer.

original: gal te sngon po dang sngon por rig par byed pa dang gi yul tha dad pa nyid kyis gcig tu rmi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te sngon po dang sngon por rig par byed pa dang gi yul tha dad pa nyid kyis gcig tu rmi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that it is not tenable that blue and the cognition of blue are one because their objects are different,

original: yul tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said that their objects are different.

original: gal te yul 'thad dad pas gcig ma yin na de'i tshe bdag kyang rig par byed pa dag kyang rang bzhin tha dad pas na ji ltar gcig yin /
analyzed: gal te yul 'thad dad pas gcig ma yin na de'i tshe bdag kyang rig par byed pa dag kyang rang bzhin tha dad pas na ji ltar gcig yin /
translated: If they are not one because their objects are different, then since the self and the cognizer have different natures, how can they be one?

original: de lta zhes bya ba ni gal te yul tha dad pas rang bzhin tha dad par byed pa yin pa rgyur na'o //
analyzed: de lta zhes bya ba ni gal te yul tha dad pas rang bzhin tha dad par byed pa yin pa rgyur na'o //
translated: Thus means: if the difference of objects makes the difference of natures the cause.

original: de'i se khyab byed na mkha' la sog par rang bzhin yin par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i se khyab byed na mkha' la sog par rang bzhin yin par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the case, then space, etc. would be natures that are causes.

original: de lta yin dag bcing nas pa dang grol pa la sogs pa rnams gzhang tu ma yin zhes bya ba log par brjod pa ni bcing sgrol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dag bcing nas pa dang grol pa la sogs pa rnams gzhang tu ma yin zhes bya ba log par brjod pa ni bcing sgrol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the statement Bondage, freedom, etc. are not at all is a false statement. Bondage, freedom, etc. is the statement.

original: 'on thar pa la 'bad ba mi bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on thar pa la 'bad ba mi bya'o snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, Then one should not strive for liberation,

original: gal te phyi rol la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ni re zhig khyod do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ni re zhig khyod do snyam na /
translated: one might think, The differentiation of external objects, etc. is, after all, yours.

original: phyi sogs zhe gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi sogs zhe gsungs so //
translated: Thus, external, etc. is stated.

original: rnam par rtogs pa med pa'i dbang gis tha snyad 'dir 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pa med pa'i dbang gis tha snyad 'dir 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that the conventional is not due to the power of non-conceptualization.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni shes pa yod pa nyid @286a * //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni shes pa yod pa nyid @286a * //
translated: Here means in the existence of consciousness.

original: la'o ; / mi 'thad ces bya ba ni rigs par ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la'o ; / mi 'thad ces bya ba ni rigs par ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Unreasonable means endowed with reasoning.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan med pas rnam par rtog pa tsam mar khas len na thar pa lags zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan med pas rnam par rtog pa tsam mar khas len na thar pa lags zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you accept that it is mere conceptualization because there is no other aspect, then liberation is impossible.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma yin par yang khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma yin par yang khas blangs dgos te /
translated: In the same way, you must accept that it is a valid cognition,

original: tshad mas sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad mas sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because there is no establishment by a valid cognition.

original: bag chags dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance that has the nature of being related to latent impressions.

original: mi mngon pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mngon pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma dpyad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The “unmanifest” is the nature that is not analyzed.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba don dam pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba don dam pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: “ This” refers to the fact that it is not the ultimate nondeceptive object.

original: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba dang chos bstan pa dag las so //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba dang chos bstan pa dag las so //
translated: “ The opposite of those” refers to the proximity and the teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'di dag grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “ Their establishment” is that of the other.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ This is said” is the statement.

original: gal te thams cad kyang log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba bzhin du mu stegs pa la sogs pa yang ci ste dad pa la sogs pa mi bya snyam na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyang log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i lta ba bzhin du mu stegs pa la sogs pa yang ci ste dad pa la sogs pa mi bya snyam na /
translated: If you think, “Since all are false, why do non-Buddhists, like Buddhists, not engage in faith, etc., in regard to their own tenets?”

original: sangs rgyas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha said, “They are not false.”

original: ci'i phyir gnod par byed pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnod par byed pa med snyam na /
translated: If you think, “Why is there no harm?”

original: de ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: He said, “It is like this.”

original: gal te bag chags yod pa de ltar na yang gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags yod pa de ltar na yang gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you think, “Even if there are latent propensities, there is still harm,”

original: gnod byed bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bag chags de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnod byed bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bag chags de nyid yin no //
translated: the cause of the production of harm is those very latent propensities.🔽If that were not so, it would not be tenable that one understands error in the absence of an object of knowledge, and that one understands disputes and adversaries.

original: de lta ma yin na yang gegs byed pa yang dag pa'i shes pa med na 'khrul par ji ltar shes ji ltar rtsod pa dang phas kyi rgol ba rtogs par byed pa mi 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang gegs byed pa yang dag pa'i shes pa med na 'khrul par ji ltar shes ji ltar rtsod pa dang phas kyi rgol ba rtogs par byed pa mi 'thad snyam na /
translated: If you think, “In that case, there is no understanding of the meaning of the words,”

original: gal te de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: he said, “It is like this.”

original: pha rol po la'o //
analyzed: pha rol po la'o //
translated: It is like this in regard to others.

original: ci ste bag chags sad pa mngon du gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe tshig brgyas kyang rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bag chags sad pa mngon du gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe tshig brgyas kyang rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think, “If the activation of the latent propensities does not manifest, then one does not understand even with a hundred words,”🔽he said, “It is like this.”

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “That is not true. ”

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa des so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa des so //
translated: “By that” means by that mode.

original: blo'i zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: blo'i zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i blo'o //
translated: “Mind” refers to the mind of the waking state.

original: de yin na zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de yin na zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: “If that were so” means if that were false.

original: rnam gzhag ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig ni bden la 'ga' zhig ni brdzun zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam gzhag ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig ni bden la 'ga' zhig ni brdzun zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “The distinction” means that it would not be the case that some things are true and some things are false.

original: thams cad brdzun pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad brdzun pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Everything would be false.

original: khyed sangs rgyas pa la sad pa dang rmi lam gyi rnam shes dag gi dbye ba yang gang gis byas /
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas pa la sad pa dang rmi lam gyi rnam shes dag gi dbye ba yang gang gis byas /
translated: How do you Buddhists make the distinction between the consciousnesses of the waking state and the dream state?

original: ji ltar gnod byed shes pa la zhes bya bar ni ji ltar rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa la sel byed dmigs pa de bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la ni 'ga' yang ma dmigs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnod byed shes pa la zhes bya bar ni ji ltar rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa la sel byed dmigs pa de bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la ni 'ga' yang ma dmigs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the object that is eliminated is perceived in the consciousness of a dream, so in the consciousness of the waking state, nothing is perceived.

original: ji ltar 'di spangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di spangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: @286b rtogs pa'am zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @286b rtogs pa'am zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “If it is imagined or directly perceived. ”

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bag chags sad pa na /
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bag chags sad pa na /
translated: Just as that is, means just as that is, when the latent potentialities are aroused,

original: gzhan don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba nges par rtogs nas de'i bag chags sad pa'i don du tshig 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba nges par rtogs nas de'i bag chags sad pa'i don du tshig 'jug go //
translated: one definitely realizes that one will strive for the sake of others, and one engages in speech for the sake of arousing those latent potentialities.

original: des na / gal te blo ni mi bden na //
analyzed: des na / gal te blo ni mi bden na //
translated: Therefore, if cognition is not real,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri ba la /
translated: is the question.🔽The answer is: because there are no latent potentialities that are aroused in that way.

original: de lta bu'i bag chags sad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bag chags sad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di nyid la 'o na zhes dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'o na zhes dri ba'o //
translated: The question is: Well then,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni bag chags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni bag chags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: latent potentialities.

original: mi bden pa'i don ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of unreal is that there is no object.

original: ji ltar slu bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar slu bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How can there be deception?

original: phyin ci log ces gsungs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said: erroneous.

original: 'di tsam du zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba tsam du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam du zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba tsam du bya ba'o //
translated: Just this much means just this much: the connection with latent potentialities.

original: gal te rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod byed kyi shes pa'i stobs kyis mi bden pa'i don nyid ma yin nam sad pa'i shes pa la ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te nges na mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod byed kyi shes pa'i stobs kyis mi bden pa'i don nyid ma yin nam sad pa'i shes pa la ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te nges na mi bden pa'o //
translated: But isn’t it that the consciousnesses of dreams, etc., are not the reality of their objects by the force of the consciousnesses that invalidate them? And the consciousnesses of the waking state are not invalidated, so they are not unreal.

original: don du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: don du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How can that be the meaning?

original: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: “By which” is stated.

original: de med pas ni gnod byed med pas so //
analyzed: de med pas ni gnod byed med pas so //
translated: “By the absence of that” means by the absence of the invalidator.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
translated: Here, another says, “If . . .”

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba sad pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba sad pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the consciousness of the waking state.

original: gzhan ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the consciousness of the dream state.

original: ji ltar 'di 'thad snyam na gcig la zhes smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'thad snyam na gcig la zhes smras so //
translated: How is this tenable? “In one” is stated.

original: rang gis der mi slu ba nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang gis der mi slu ba nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “It would not be deceptive in that” is the remainder.

original: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “That is not so.”

original: shes pa thams cad bag chags dag 'brel pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad bag chags dag 'brel pa yin yang ngo //
translated: Although all consciousnesses are related to latent predispositions, . . .

original: ji ltar sngon po log pa'i dbye ba dang myur ba dang yun ring por 'jig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi slu ba la sogs par cis mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po log pa'i dbye ba dang myur ba dang yun ring por 'jig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi slu ba la sogs par cis mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Just as the distinction of blue and so on and the quick and slow passing away are not mistaken, why would the non-mistaken and so on not be so? They would be so.

original: gal te bag chags dang 'brel par khyad par med pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang mi 'thad do snyam na /🔽rnam 'gas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te bag chags dang 'brel par khyad par med pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang mi 'thad do snyam na / rnam 'gas zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that the distinction of blue and so on is not tenable because there is no difference in relation to the connection with latent propensities,🔽then how?

original: de blta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de blta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen,

original: mi nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is a human.

original: gzhan yang bram ze khyed kyi ltar na shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bram ze khyed kyi ltar na shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, according to you Brahmins, all consciousnesses have objects.

original: des na ji ltar don dang 'brel pa nyid du mtshungs na yang shes pa kun mi slu ba can ma yin pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni mi slu ba yin la /
analyzed: des na ji ltar don dang 'brel pa nyid du mtshungs na yang shes pa kun mi slu ba can ma yin pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni mi slu ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, just as consciousnesses are similar in being related to objects, but some are non-deceptive and some are not,

original: gzhan ni de lta ma yin pa 'di ni bzlog pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa nyid la yang glo bur du mi srid pa ji ste srid pa kho na'o //🔽'dir pha rol gyis smras pa don la dmigs @287a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta ma yin pa 'di ni bzlog pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa nyid la yang glo bur du mi srid pa ji ste srid pa kho na'o // 'dir pha rol gyis smras pa don la dmigs @287a * //
translated: The other is not so. This is the similarity of the absence of the object. Even in the case of the absence of the object, it is not possible. How is it possible?

original: pa'i rim pa rnams la ni bag chags dang 'brel pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i rim pa rnams la ni bag chags dang 'brel pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the opponent says: In the case of the stages of the object-apprehension, the connection with the residual impressions is not possible.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa thams cad ni don du lhag par zhen pa nyid du mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa thams cad ni don du lhag par zhen pa nyid du mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: Because all cognitions are seen to be just the superimposition of the object.

original: 'di gsungs pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gsungs pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is said: That is not so.

original: shes pa 'ga' zhig la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yul med par 'dzin pa ji ltar te mi 'grub pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don 'di la gzhan gyis 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yul med par 'dzin pa ji ltar te mi 'grub pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don 'di la gzhan gyis 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: How is it that any cognition that is contradicted by another cognition apprehends a non-existent object? The meaning is: it is not established at all. In this regard, the opponent says: The world, etc.

original: de lha'i zhes bya ba rnam pa des yang don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lha'i zhes bya ba rnam pa des yang don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because it is not so.

original: des na mi slu ba dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi slu ba dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not deceptive.

original: sngon mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it follows after what was seen before.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar bag chags rgyu ma yin pa ste bag chags nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar bag chags rgyu ma yin pa ste bag chags nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, how could the latent potentialities not be the cause? The meaning is that the latent potentialities themselves are the cause.

original: dpe la sbyar nas don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni rig pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe la sbyar nas don la yang sbyor bar byed pa ni rig pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Applying the example to the meaning, it is said, “This is the way it is.”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te thams cad kyis nges pa kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid tshad mas mi byed na de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te thams cad kyis nges pa kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid tshad mas mi byed na de'i tshe'o //
translated: If it were not so, if valid cognition did not establish the conventional nature of all things, then

original: gal te phyin ci log tu snang ba dang ldan pa las 'di ltar snang ba yin no zhes nges pa yang 'jig rten pa rnams la yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log tu snang ba dang ldan pa las 'di ltar snang ba yin no zhes nges pa yang 'jig rten pa rnams la yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: why do worldly people have the conception that things appear in this way due to erroneous perception?

original: des na de yang tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des na de yang tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: In that case, that would be a valid cognition.

original: 'dir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, Candrakīrti says,

original: gal te phyin ci log la sogs par rig pa yin na de'i tshe rig pa de rig pa snga ma de las byung bar khas blangs te /
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log la sogs par rig pa yin na de'i tshe rig pa de rig pa snga ma de las byung bar khas blangs te /
translated: If it is known to be erroneous, then at that time it must be accepted that this cognition arises from that previous cognition.

original: thag pa la sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the idea of a snake in regard to a rope.

original: rig pa 'ga' zhig rig pa snga ma'i rgyu can yin mod snyam na /
analyzed: rig pa 'ga' zhig rig pa snga ma'i rgyu can yin mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that some cognition is the cause of a previous cognition,

original: des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the statement “because of that” is made.

original: de lta nyid ces bya ba ni rig pa snga ma'i rgyu can du'o //
analyzed: de lta nyid ces bya ba ni rig pa snga ma'i rgyu can du'o //
translated: “Just like that” means that it is the cause of a previous cognition.🔽“Another” is the previous cognition.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan la zhes smras te 'das pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan la zhes smras te 'das pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: “In regard to another” is in regard to a subsequent cognition.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni kun la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni kun la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In this regard” refers to the statement “in all cases.”

original: gal te don yin no snyam pa'i nges pa ni yod pa yin la nges pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te don yin no snyam pa'i nges pa ni yod pa yin la nges pa de'i phyir na /
translated: If you think that there is a determination that the object exists and that because of that determination,

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba don thob par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brtag par bya ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba don thob par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brtag par bya ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: then the statement “otherwise” means that it is not the case that the object is not to be ascertained,

original: de ni mi 'thad de phyi'i don yin no snyam pas nges pa de 'jig rten min pa dngos po sogs pa'i sgras phyin ci log tu snang ba la sogs pa la yang mi 'gyur ram ci ste yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de phyi'i don yin no snyam pas nges pa de 'jig rten min pa dngos po sogs pa'i sgras phyin ci log tu snang ba la sogs pa la yang mi 'gyur ram ci ste yod pa nyid do //
translated: then that is unacceptable. If the determination that the object exists is not of the world, then is the determination that the object is external not also mistaken?

original: des na der yang de ltar nges pa las don thob pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na der yang de ltar nges pa las don thob pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in that case, there would be the attainment of the object from the ascertainment of it.

original: des na tshad mas bsgrub pa don mod do snyam pa'i nges pa las ni gang du yang don @287b thob pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na tshad mas bsgrub pa don mod do snyam pa'i nges pa las ni gang du yang don @287b thob pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought is that there is no attainment of the object from the ascertainment that the establishment by validating cognition is meaningless.

original: gal te don med par nges pa yang 'khrul ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don med par nges pa yang 'khrul ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the ascertainment that the object is meaningless is not itself mistaken,

original: de las kyang don med pa'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de las kyang don med pa'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how could there be the convention of the meaningless?

original: don la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don la zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is: “In the object.”
