original: de'i zhes bya ba ni don la yang 'jug pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni don la yang 'jug pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The word “that” refers to the object, so there is no uncertainty.

original: don mod snyam pa'i nges pa ni don la ma zhugs pa'i phyir gang gis der yang don mod do snyam pa'i nges pa 'jug par 'gyur ba don ni 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don mod snyam pa'i nges pa ni don la ma zhugs pa'i phyir gang gis der yang don mod do snyam pa'i nges pa 'jug par 'gyur ba don ni 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The ascertainment that the object is meaningless does not apply to the object, and therefore there is no possibility of any object whatsoever that would cause the ascertainment that the object is meaningless to apply to it.

original: bag chags kyang gzhi can nyid du yongs su shes pa nyid don du snang ba'i gnod byed yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyang gzhi can nyid du yongs su shes pa nyid don du snang ba'i gnod byed yin te /
translated: The residual impression is also the invalidator of the appearance of the object, since it is known to have a basis.

original: rgyu des na sad pa'i shes pa la ni gnyen po mi srid pa yongs su ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu des na sad pa'i shes pa la ni gnyen po mi srid pa yongs su ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the antidote is not impossible for the consciousness of the waking state, but it is not completely so.

original: 'on kyang bag chags kyi rgyu can du nges pa zhes bya ba gnod par byed pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bag chags kyi rgyu can du nges pa zhes bya ba gnod par byed pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: However, it is certain that it has a cause of latent impressions, and thus it is certainly impaired.

original: de nyid ston pa ni shes pa sngon mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni shes pa sngon mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is shown by “the consciousness of what was seen before.”

original: sad pa'i ka sogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis sangs rgyas pa'i lugs nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i ka sogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis sangs rgyas pa'i lugs nye bar bkod pa'o //
translated: “The waking state, etc.” refers to the system of the Buddhists.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Its state is the state of the yogi.

original: gnod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i ka ba la sogs pa gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i ka ba la sogs pa gnod pa'o //
translated: “This impairment” is the impairment of the pillar, etc. of the waking state.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: Having thus anticipated the objection of the Buddhists, he states the refutation of the opponent:

original: des ni zhes bya ba ste sangs rgyas pa des na'o //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ste sangs rgyas pa des na'o //
translated: “By that” means by the Buddhists.

original: re zhig skye ba 'di la ni sad pa'i shes pa la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o zhes bya ba gzhan gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de spang ba yin no zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba 'di la ni sad pa'i shes pa la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o zhes bya ba gzhan gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de spang ba yin no zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: “For the time being, in this life, the other one, called the ‘cognition that harms the cognition of the waking state,’ is eliminated,” is the connection with what precedes.

original: ji ltar bsal snyam du dogs na 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bsal snyam du dogs na 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: If you wonder how it is eliminated, it is connected with “in this way.”

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pas gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pas gnyen pa'o //
translated: “You” refers to the Buddhists.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i blo can gang yin pa de dag kyang gal te rnal 'byor pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i blo can gang yin pa de dag kyang gal te rnal 'byor pa yin na /
translated: Those who have such a mind are also, if they are yogis,

original: de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pas bslad pa yang ci ste rnal 'byor ba ma yin 'di 'dra la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pas bslad pa yang ci ste rnal 'byor ba ma yin 'di 'dra la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: at that time, harmed by nirvana. Why are they not yogis? “Such” refers to the absence of an object.

original: khyed kyi la ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bsgrub pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi la ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bsgrub pa rnams la'o //
translated: “For you” refers to those who practice with an object.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod par bya ba nyid du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod par bya ba nyid du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “Therefore” and so on proves that they are harmed.

original: gang yang blo yin pa de ni gnod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang blo yin pa de ni gnod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is cognition is what is to be invalidated,

original: dper na smig rgyu la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of a mirage, and so on.🔽The cognition of a pillar, and so on, is of that aspect.

original: ka la sogs pa'i blo rnam pa de 'di dbang blo yin no zhes sbyor ba blta bar bya'o //🔽'dod pa nyid ces bya ba ni gal te gnyen po dang @288a * //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa'i blo rnam pa de 'di dbang blo yin no zhes sbyor ba blta bar bya'o // 'dod pa nyid ces bya ba ni gal te gnyen po dang @288a * //
translated: The assertion is that it is just as in the case of the cognition of a mirage, and so on.

original: bcas pa rnams sgrub na de'i tshe ni 'dod pa nyid de smig rgyu'i blo la sogs pa rnams kyis gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcas pa rnams sgrub na de'i tshe ni 'dod pa nyid de smig rgyu'i blo la sogs pa rnams kyis gnyen po dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one establishes the cognition of a pillar, and so on, together with its antidote, then it is just as in the case of the cognition of a mirage, and so on, because it is accompanied by its antidote.

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i blo rnam pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de smig rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis gnod par byed pa yin na ni 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i blo rnam pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de smig rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis gnod par byed pa yin na ni 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: If the cognition of a pillar, and so on, is by nature what invalidates a mirage, and so on, then it is just as in the case of the cognition of a mirage, and so on.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzung bas kyang gnod par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzung bas kyang gnod par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The assertion is that it is also to be invalidated by the apprehended object, which is characterized by a pot, and so on.

original: 'di la brjod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de ltar ni gnod byed gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni gnod byed gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The opponent is not in a position to say this.

original: gang gi phyir rtsa ba gcod par byed pa gnod byed du brjod par 'dod kyi smig rgyu'i shes pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsa ba gcod par byed pa gnod byed du brjod par 'dod kyi smig rgyu'i shes pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the root-cutter that is called the “harm-doer,” not others such as the consciousness of a mirage.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar rung bar zhes bya ba smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pas kyang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams gnyen po dang bcas par brjod pa 'di ni rang gis mi shes pa'i gsal 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar rung bar zhes bya ba smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pas kyang ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams gnyen po dang bcas par brjod pa 'di ni rang gis mi shes pa'i gsal 'debs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, how is it suitable? The consciousness of a mirage, etc. also is said to be the antidote of the consciousness of a pillar, etc. This is a clear indication of your own ignorance.

original: gal te gang dang blo yin par de gnod par bya ba yin /
analyzed: gal te gang dang blo yin par de gnod par bya ba yin /
translated: If that which is the mind is the object of harm,

original: de'i tshe gnod par byed pa'i shes pa nyid gnod bya yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnod par byed pa'i shes pa nyid gnod bya yin nam ma yin /
translated: then is the consciousness that is the harm-doer the object of harm or not?

original: gal te yin na ji ltar des gzhan gnod de ma yin na de'i tshe gnod byed de sam nges te /
analyzed: gal te yin na ji ltar des gzhan gnod de ma yin na de'i tshe gnod byed de sam nges te /
translated: If it is, how can it harm another? If it is not, then it is not the harm-doer.

original: blo yang yin la gnod bya yang ma yin te dper na gnod byed kyi blo bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo yang yin la gnod bya yang ma yin te dper na gnod byed kyi blo bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the mind and it is not the object of harm, just like the mind that is the harm-doer.

original: 'on te gnod byed las gzhan pa'i blo gnod par bya ba yin no zhes 'dod na de'i tshe las gzhan pa'ang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'on te gnod byed las gzhan pa'i blo gnod par bya ba yin no zhes 'dod na de'i tshe las gzhan pa'ang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: But if you maintain that the cognition is harmed by something other than the object, then the same objection applies as before.

original: thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'gal ba sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'gal ba sun dbyung ngo //
translated: The fault of infinite regress, etc., is to be refuted.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams gzhan nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa yang brdzun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams gzhan nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa yang brdzun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition that establishes the difference of other cognitions from the cognition of a Buddha, etc., would itself be false.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But this is not maintained.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to this is “Here also . . . ”

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na yod pa log pa'i blo la ltos nas gnyen po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na yod pa log pa'i blo la ltos nas gnyen po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In dreams, etc., the cognition that is the antidote is in dependence on a false cognition,

original: phyin ci log tu khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no difference in error.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply to this is “The same was said before . . . ”

original: log pa nyid yin yang bag chags che chung yod pa las blo thams cad khyad par gyi rim pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: log pa nyid yin yang bag chags che chung yod pa las blo thams cad khyad par gyi rim pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: Even though they are erroneous, all cognitions are things that are ranked in a hierarchy according to the strength of their habitual tendencies.

original: de las gnod bya gnod byed kyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gnod bya gnod byed kyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: And from that, there is the thing that is the object of harm and the thing that is the agent of harm.

original: ji ltar ci'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis blo thams cad phyin ci log pa yin yang gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ci'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis blo thams cad phyin ci log pa yin yang gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though all cognitions are erroneous by virtue of their connection with a thing that is a cause of error, there is the thing that is the object of harm and the thing that is the agent of harm.

original: @288b rnal 'byor pa nyid dang 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa dag gi mtshan ma gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: @288b rnal 'byor pa nyid dang 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa dag gi mtshan ma gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i blo'o //
translated: The cognition that possesses the sign of the exhaustion of desire and so on and of the yogi himself.

original: 'dod chags pa la sogs pa zad pa dang rnal 'byor pa gnyid log pa'i mtshan ma mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags pa la sogs pa zad pa dang rnal 'byor pa gnyid log pa'i mtshan ma mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The cognition that possesses the sign of the exhaustion of desire and so on and of the yogi himself.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ci ste bcom ldan 'das la 'dod pa de ma thag bkag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ci ste bcom ldan 'das la 'dod pa de ma thag bkag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If you think that the difference in realization is the reason, then the reason is contradictory because desire and so on were just refuted.

original: ji ltar rmi lam ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pas gnyen po dang bcas pa las log pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa log pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pas gnyen po dang bcas pa las log pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa log pa yin no //
translated: Just as the cognition of a pillar, etc., is refuted by its antidote, so too is the cognition of a pillar, etc., refuted.

original: ka ba'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs yin te /
analyzed: ka ba'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs yin te /
translated: The antidote to the cognition of a pillar is the mind of the Tathāgata.

original: des na de yang log par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de yang log par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it follows that that [antidote] is also refuted. This is the meaning.

original: de ni gtan tshigs ma lus pa'i nus pa ste mthu gang yin pa 'gog pa min te /
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs ma lus pa'i nus pa ste mthu gang yin pa 'gog pa min te /
translated: This is the power, the capacity, of all reasons, but it is not refuted.

original: 'on kyang de 'dra ba de ni gtan tshigs thams cad la 'gal ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'dra ba de ni gtan tshigs thams cad la 'gal ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, such a [reason] would be contradictory to all reasons.

original: khyad par gyi gnyen po dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gnyen po dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that it has an antidote that is a distinguishing feature.

original: log pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi gnyen po nyid ni sangs rgyas pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi gnyen po nyid ni sangs rgyas pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The distinguishing feature of a false cognition is not established by a Buddhist.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Just as, etc. shows that it is not a reason.

original: nam ka ba'i yon tan nyid kyang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: nam ka ba'i yon tan nyid kyang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Because the treatise accepts the very qualities of the pillar, it is only the probandum.

original: des gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that because it is undermined, the reason is contradictory,

original: bstan bcos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes gsungs so //
translated: [the response is that] the treatise says,

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of the contradiction with inference is If it is said....

original: bzlog pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the reversed probandum is The basis of debate....

original: mthong ba tsam zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The mere seeing is the mere seeing in the similar class. That which has that is called that which has mere seeing.

original: dpe yang mi 'grig par byed pa'i don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe yang mi 'grig par byed pa'i don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is also not suitable. The meaning of ultimately is...

original: 'on te kun rdzob tu rmi lam gnod par byed pa'i blo gnod bya ma yin par brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu rmi lam gnod par byed pa'i blo gnod bya ma yin par brjod na /
translated: If it is said that the mind that is undermined in a dream is not to be undermined conventionally,

original: de'i tshe ka ba la sogs pa'i blo yang kun rdzob tu gnod bya ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ka ba la sogs pa'i blo yang kun rdzob tu gnod bya ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: then at that time the mind of a pillar and so on is also not to be undermined conventionally.

original: de la 'chad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de la 'chad pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is no explanation at all.

original: blos zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba'i blos so //
analyzed: blos zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba'i blos so //
translated: The word “mind” refers to the mind that sees the dream.

original: rmi lam la sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa mi gnod pa de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnod pa byed pa'i blos kyang rmi lam gnod par mi 'gyur te /🔽mi bden par @289a * //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa mi gnod pa de bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnod pa byed pa'i blos kyang rmi lam gnod par mi 'gyur te / mi bden par @289a * //
translated: The phrase “like a dream, etc.” means that just as the cognition of a pillar, etc., in a dream is not undermined, so the mind that harms in a dream does not undermine the dream.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no difference between them in terms of their unreality.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni che chung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni che chung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “The greater and lesser.

original: bden pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The word “true” means that they have objects.

original: 'o na ji ltar gnod snyam na /🔽de'i gzhal bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gnod snyam na / de'i gzhal bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: But how can they be undermined?🔽The response is “The object of its evaluation.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni de'i gzhal bya ma dmigs so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de'i gzhal bya ma dmigs so //
translated: The word “its” refers to the object of its evaluation.

original: de ni zhes bya ba phyin ci log dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba phyin ci log dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no /
translated: The word “that” refers to the object of the mistaken cognition.

original: gang gi tshe rigs pa la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi blo la'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rigs pa la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi blo la'o //
translated: The phrase “when it is reasonable” refers to the mind in a dream.

original: de las bzlog ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'i dmigs pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'i dmigs pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the opposite of the object of the dream consciousness.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi blo la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi blo la'o //
translated: The other is the dream consciousness.

original: sgrub byed shes pa nyes zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te dogs pa bsgrub pa na gal te sad pa'i blo rnams kyang rmi lam gyi blo dang mtshungs pa de'i tshe nged la gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos pos ci zhig dogs te /
analyzed: sgrub byed shes pa nyes zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te dogs pa bsgrub pa na gal te sad pa'i blo rnams kyang rmi lam gyi blo dang mtshungs pa de'i tshe nged la gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos pos ci zhig dogs te /
translated: The proof is the cognition, which is the meaning of the reason. When proving the thesis, if the waking consciousnesses are the same as the dream consciousnesses, then what do we have to fear from the fact that the things to be refuted and the refutations are the same?

original: 'dir dran bya zhes bya ba ni gnod byed nyid bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs blo nyid la dran par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dran bya zhes bya ba ni gnod byed nyid bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs blo nyid la dran par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the object of memory is the reason that proves the refutation. The cognition itself is the object of memory.

original: sngar gyi sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid de'i rgyan de la yang da ltar mdor bsdus te brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar gyi sgrub par byed pa shes pa nyid de'i rgyan de la yang da ltar mdor bsdus te brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The former proof is the cognition itself. That ornament is also stated here in brief.

original: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni rtogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni rtogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the first half is “the understanding” and so on.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i rgyus na /
translated: Because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: gtan tshigs shes pa nyid tha dad pa brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs shes pa nyid tha dad pa brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to express the reason as something different from the cognition itself.

original: 'di ltar shes pa nyid ni chos can yin la gtan tshigs kyang de nyid yin no //🔽gal te zhes sangs rgyas pa dang bram ze rtag la'o //🔽de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa nyid ni chos can yin la gtan tshigs kyang de nyid yin no // gal te zhes sangs rgyas pa dang bram ze rtag la'o // de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, cognition itself is the subject, and the reason is that very [cognition].

original: 'on te 'dra ba dang shes pa ma yin pa dag las ldog pa ni rtogs pa thams cad la yod pas de nyid spyir 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba dang shes pa ma yin pa dag las ldog pa ni rtogs pa thams cad la yod pas de nyid spyir 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If [the opponent says:] “The exclusion from what is dissimilar and what is not cognition exists in all realizations, so that itself is the universal.”

original: 'dra dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dra dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: [Dharmakīrti] says, “Similarity . . .”

original: gnyis ka la ni sangs rgyas pa dang bram ze rtag la'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la ni sangs rgyas pa dang bram ze rtag la'o //
translated: Both [the universal and the exclusion] are for Buddhists and Brahmins.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, “this” refers to the exclusion.

original: dngos por ni zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: dngos por ni zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: “In reality” means ultimately.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni spyi 'di'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni spyi 'di'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: “Realization” means “universal.” What is the meaning of this term?

original: don brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba ste zhes bya ba'i shes pa chos can yin /
analyzed: don brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba ste zhes bya ba'i shes pa chos can yin /
translated: The expression of the meaning is “experience . . .” The subject is cognition.

original: de bzhin du rang rgyud dam bdag gi chos zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa gang yin pa de dran par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang rgyud dam bdag gi chos zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa gang yin pa de dran par byed pa ni /
translated: In the same way, whatever is expressed as “the property of a self, or of a real entity,” is remembered.

original: khyad par can ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ The special” is the one who remembers.

original: 'gal ba nyid ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The contradiction is because of the pervasion by the possession of an object.

original: dpe rmi lam bsgrub byas stong pa nyid ni thams cad kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe rmi lam bsgrub byas stong pa nyid ni thams cad kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example is the dream. The probandum is emptiness. Because all are possessed of an object.

original: ji ltar rang @289b rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rang @289b rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that self-awareness is the effect?

original: rnam par shes par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Consciousness” and so on.

original: 'dir phyi'i don smra bas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi'i don smra bas brjod pa'o //
translated: Here, the proponent of external objects speaks.

original: 'bad pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid las so //
translated: “ In this effort” is from the definition of the establishment of the absence of an object.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par ro //
translated: “ How” is with an object.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nyid gzhan du byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nyid gzhan du byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the establishment is as an absence of an object, then the worldly conventions themselves are made otherwise.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The object” is the object of the word.🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”

original: gal te tha snyad de ltar mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad de ltar mi 'gyur mod /
translated: “If that is not so, then what?”

original: de lta na yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa la 'bras bu gzhan nyid yod do zhe na /🔽tha snyad las zhes smras so //
analyzed: de lta na yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs pa la 'bras bu gzhan nyid yod do zhe na / tha snyad las zhes smras so //
translated: “If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”

original: de'i tshe tha snyad ci ltar zhes bya ba'i rig byed skyes bus byas pa nyid du yin pa de ltar de skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur mod /🔽rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa'i lam 'bras bu ci yod de ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe tha snyad ci ltar zhes bya ba'i rig byed skyes bus byas pa nyid du yin pa de ltar de skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur mod / rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa'i lam 'bras bu ci yod de ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: “If that is not so, then what?”

original: 'on te gal te skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin na /🔽de'i tshe mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin na / de'i tshe mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”🔽“If that is not so, then what?”

original: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If that is not so, then what?”

original: des na zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa med na'o //🔽de nyid ces bya ba ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa med na'o //🔽de nyid ces bya ba ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “If that is not

original: rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Examination” means

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du nges pas so //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du nges pas so //
translated: certainty that it is not created by a person.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa tsam zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa tsam zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: “In other cases” refers to this “mere cognition.”

original: lan 'di ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa la sangs rgyas pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: lan 'di ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa la sangs rgyas pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This reply is the same for the other Buddhists.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of that is “not created by a person.”

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgos pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgos pa nyid brjod do //
translated: “Moreover” and so on state the purpose.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa zad pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the exhaustion of faults such as attachment.

original: de nyid dpyod pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid dpyod pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That examination” is “of external objects.”

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i don du re zhig gzhan gyi phyogs brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i don du re zhig gzhan gyi phyogs brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the opponent’s position for the sake of examination is “If you say . . .”

original: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni phyi rol sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'i rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni phyi rol sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'i rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rnam pa can no //
translated: “Having the aspect of that” means that which has the aspect of external objects such as blue.

original: yang de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i don to ;
analyzed: yang de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i don to ;
translated: Moreover, “that” refers to the object such as blue.

original: / de'i tshe rnam pa med pa de nyid thams cad mthong ba yin mod /
analyzed: / de'i tshe rnam pa med pa de nyid thams cad mthong ba yin mod /
translated: At that time, it is indeed the case that the cognition without aspects sees everything,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig brtags pas dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig brtags pas dgos pa ci yod /
translated: but what is the point of investigating whether it has some aspects or not?

original: de nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni mthong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni mthong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of “the aspect of ascertaining that” is the meaning of “the aspect of seeing that.”

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽des na mngon pa thams @290a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // des na mngon pa thams @290a * //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the aspect of blue, etc.

original: cad ni rnam pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: cad ni rnam pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is established that all cognitions are indeed without aspects.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is “At that time . . . ”

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang don to //
translated: “Both” refers to the object and the cognition.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is “In that case . . . ”

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shes bas don 'dzin pa de bzhin du don gyis kyang shes pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shes bas don 'dzin pa de bzhin du don gyis kyang shes pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Mutually” means that just as the cognition apprehends the object, the object would also apprehend the cognition.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the aspect of blue, etc.

original: blo med par zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa bas 'dod pa'i blo med par ro //
analyzed: blo med par zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa bas 'dod pa'i blo med par ro //
translated: “Without a cognition” means without the cognition that is accepted by the Analyst.

original: des na ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas sngon po la sogs pa pha rol du khas len pa de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas mdo sde pas blo yang khas blang bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas sngon po la sogs pa pha rol du khas len pa de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas mdo sde pas blo yang khas blang bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the opponent accepts the existence of external objects such as blue, etc., because it is not tenable that they are otherwise, in the same way, the Sautrāntika should accept the existence of cognition, because it is not tenable that it is otherwise.

original: 'on te blo med bar lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te blo med bar lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the external object is not imperceptible without a cognition,

original: de lta yin na phyi rol gzhan rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na phyi rol gzhan rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then external objects are not to be cognized,

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol med par de'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol med par de'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang mthong ba yin te /
translated: because a cognition having the aspect of an external object is seen even when the external object does not exist.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa ni khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa ni khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: You must accept that it is not tenable that it is otherwise.

original: des na don gzhan ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na don gzhan ci zhig bya /
translated: So what is the use of another object?

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di snang ba las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid de sngon po rnams snang ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di snang ba las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid de sngon po rnams snang ba med do //
translated: The statement “It is not another” is external to the appearance, because blue, etc., do not appear.

original: sngon po snang ba las tha dad par rnam par gnas pa la ni tshad ma ci yang med de /
analyzed: sngon po snang ba las tha dad par rnam par gnas pa la ni tshad ma ci yang med de /
translated: There is no valid cognition at all that establishes that it exists separately from the appearance of blue.

original: des na zhes bya ba tshad ma med pas na snang ba las tha dad pa'i sngon po khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba tshad ma med pas na snang ba las tha dad pa'i sngon po khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no valid cognition, one should not accept that blue exists separately from the appearance of blue.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: “ However” means “if.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to blue, etc.

original: 'di la brjod pa shes pa tha dad pa yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa shes pa tha dad pa yod pa yin /
translated: “ This” refers to the cognition.🔽“ There would be no separate cognition” means that there would be no cognition of blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “ That” means that blue, etc. would not appear.

original: shes pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di ga las she na /
analyzed: shes pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di ga las she na /
translated: “ That” means that the cognition of blue, etc. would not be clear.🔽Why is this?

original: des ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Because” means “for that reason.”

original: gal te shes pa tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If there were a separate cognition,

original: ldon po lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldon po lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the possessor would not be hidden.

original: rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pa gang yin pa de las lkog tu ma gyur ba nyid gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pa gang yin pa de las lkog tu ma gyur ba nyid gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not hidden by its own nature is not hidden by anything else.

original: rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin no zhes shes pa tha dad pa lkog tu ma gyur par ni ldon po'i rang bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin no zhes shes pa tha dad pa lkog tu ma gyur par ni ldon po'i rang bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-concealment of the nature of the object is the non-concealment of the object itself. The non-concealment of the cognition is not the non-concealment of the nature of the subject.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i sngon dang phyis kyang don yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i sngon dang phyis kyang don yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t the object present before and after the eye, etc.?

original: des na ji ltar mig la sogs pas skyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mig la sogs pas skyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: So how can it be produced by the eye, etc.?

original: don gyi zhes gsungs so //🔽'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //🔽'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni /🔽@290b blo dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi zhes gsungs so // 'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o // 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni / @290b blo dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object is said to be the cause of the cognition.🔽But if the object is not present before and after the eye, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa'i sngon rol du yod par ci'i phyir mi rtag ces 'brel to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i sngon rol du yod par ci'i phyir mi rtag ces 'brel to //
translated: how can it be the cause of the cognition?🔽The reply to this is:🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i sngar yang 'dzin pa'i rnam ba yod pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽'gal ba nyid ston pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i sngar yang 'dzin pa'i rnam ba yod pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽'gal ba nyid ston pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause of the cognition.🔽The eye, etc. are not the cause

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa la yang de bzhin du 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa la yang de bzhin du 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: The same contradiction would apply to the aspect of the object.

original: tha dad pa'i don no zhes so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don no zhes so //
translated: The meaning of “different” is as stated.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni tha dad do zhes tshad ma gang gis rtogs /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni tha dad do zhes tshad ma gang gis rtogs /
translated: Here, it is said: By what valid cognition is “different” conceived?

original: gal te lkog tu ma gyur pa las phyi rol du 'gyur ba'i don grub na /
analyzed: gal te lkog tu ma gyur pa las phyi rol du 'gyur ba'i don grub na /
translated: If an external object were established from what is not hidden,

original: de'i tshe mig la sogs pa las don sngar yod par yang 'gyur ba zhig 'on kyang phyi rol du gyur pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig la sogs pa las don sngar yod par yang 'gyur ba zhig 'on kyang phyi rol du gyur pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then at that time, the object would also exist prior to the eye, etc. However, the meaning is that external existence itself is not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dngos po nges pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dngos po nges pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because external things are not definite.

original: 'dir pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Here, anticipating the objection of the opponent, the Buddhist position,

original: gsal ba'i ming can lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba sngar yod par the tshom mi za zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ming can lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba sngar yod par the tshom mi za zhes bya ba'o //
translated: says, “Why is the so-called manifest not also definitely existent prior to that?”

original: 'di la nyes pa de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, stating that same fault,

original: lkog tu ma gyur par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Not hidden” means not concealed.

original: gal te sngar ngal lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yod na de'i tshe yang dngos po lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: gal te sngar ngal lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yod na de'i tshe yang dngos po lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du thal lo //
translated: If it were the case that the thing is not hidden prior to the eye, then it follows that the thing would not be hidden.

original: mig la sogs pa'i snga rol du dngos po lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i snga rol du dngos po lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible for the thing to be not hidden prior to the eye, etc.

original: des na lkog tu ma gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na lkog tu ma gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the thing is not hidden.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation, he says.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa sngar med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa sngar med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'brel te /
translated: What was said, namely, that the thing is not not hidden prior to the eye, etc., is not connected.

original: skyes bu gzhan la don de lkog tu ma gyur par 'gyur gyi nga la ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la don de lkog tu ma gyur par 'gyur gyi nga la ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For it is understood that the thing is not hidden for another person, but it is hidden for me.

original: rnam pa thams cad du lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid med par ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid med par ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to understand that the thing is not hidden in every way.

original: dpe nyid 'chad par ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe nyid 'chad par ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the example, he says, “If it were the case that the thing is not hidden for the person who is speaking, etc.”

original: de dang tha dad phyir zhes bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa las don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha dad phyir zhes bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa las don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is different from that, i.e., because the object is not non-different from the manifest.

original: de med pas ni lkog tu gyur pa med pas don de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pas ni lkog tu gyur pa med pas don de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because that is not, i.e., because the manifest is not, the object is not.

original: don dang lkog tu ma gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid du ma nges so zhe na'o //
analyzed: don dang lkog tu ma gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid du ma nges so zhe na'o //
translated: But the object is not ascertained to be non-different from the manifest.

original: de las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba ni me'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba ni me'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'o //
translated: Different from that, i.e., different from the nature of fire.

original: de las zhes bya ba dang rang bzhin las tha dad par mi mthong ba'i phyir tha dad par ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba dang rang bzhin las tha dad par mi mthong ba'i phyir tha dad par ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: But because it is not seen to be different from that, i.e., from the nature of fire, it is not established as different.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad ces bya ba ste /🔽lkog tu gyur pa las tha dad par yang @291a * //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad ces bya ba ste / lkog tu gyur pa las tha dad par yang @291a * //
translated: The reply to that is: Everything, etc.

original: don ma mthong ba'i phyir tha dad pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don ma mthong ba'i phyir tha dad pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the object is not seen to be different from the manifest, it is not established as different.

original: de ltar na re zhig mngon sum gyis lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes bstan nas rjes su dpag pas mi rtogs so gsungs pa ni rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mngon sum gyis lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes bstan nas rjes su dpag pas mi rtogs so gsungs pa ni rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, having shown that direct perception cannot cognize what is different from what is not hidden, he says that inference does not cognize it.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: Here, in inference.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Such, i.e., the nature of what is not hidden.

original: de dang zhes bya ba lkog tu ma gyur pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba lkog tu ma gyur pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of that, i.e., because of the non-difference from what is not hidden.

original: sngar rtogs pa las lhag par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rtogs pa las lhag par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition in excess of the prior cognition.

original: gal te lhag par ma brtags pa ni /
analyzed: gal te lhag par ma brtags pa ni /
translated: If it is not examined in excess,🔽how is it apprehended? Because it apprehends what is already apprehended.

original: ji ltar tshang ma yin te gzung ba zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshang ma yin te gzung ba zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, it is like this.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul du'o //
translated: In the manner to be explained.

original: de'i zhes bya ba sngar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba sngar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: That, i.e., the nature of the prior cognition.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi mthong ba'o //
translated: That also, i.e., the prior seeing.

original: lhag par brtags pa ni du ba 'di ni thams cad du me med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: lhag par brtags pa ni du ba 'di ni thams cad du me med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The specific examination is of the form: “This smoke does not occur without fire.”

original: mthong ba don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu la 'di ni me yod do zhes ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu la 'di ni me yod do zhes ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The person who is seeking to see fire will not be told, “There is fire here.”

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba nyid du ma rtogs par ni don gnyer ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba nyid du ma rtogs par ni don gnyer ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, that is, if he were not told, he would not seek the object.

original: sngar mthong ba'i chu smig rgyu'i yul la sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i chu smig rgyu'i yul la sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the mirage of water, where one superimposes the water that was seen before.

original: gang la sngar gyi me sgro 'dogs par bya ba la gnas pa'i me de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la sngar gyi me sgro 'dogs par bya ba la gnas pa'i me de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not that the fire that is the basis of the superimposition of fire is being denied as being hidden.

original: ri la yod pa'i me de ma rtogs pa'i phyir de yod ces ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: ri la yod pa'i me de ma rtogs pa'i phyir de yod ces ci ltar rtogs /
translated: How can one know that fire exists there, since one does not perceive the fire on the mountain?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sgro btags par bya ba'i me rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sgro btags par bya ba'i me rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: “That itself” is the nature of the fire that is the basis of the superimposition.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa go lkog tu gyur pa ji ltar 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa go lkog tu gyur pa ji ltar 'thad snyam na /
translated: How can it be tenable that the perception of it by nature is hidden?

original: gzhan gyis zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes smras so //
translated: “By another” is said.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi rtogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi rtogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is cognized by another,

original: des rang gi ngo bo kho na rtogs te /
analyzed: des rang gi ngo bo kho na rtogs te /
translated: then it is cognized only in its own nature.

original: des na me 'di na skyes bu gzhan la lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na me 'di na skyes bu gzhan la lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this fire is not hidden from another person.

original: des rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not cognized in its own nature,

original: ma rtogs te ji ltar yod pa yin na zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma 'brel te ;
analyzed: ma rtogs te ji ltar yod pa yin na zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma 'brel te ;
translated: it is not cognized. What was said, “How could it exist?” is not related,

original: gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the cognition of another’s own nature exists.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Here it is said: “That itself.”

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis rtogs pa de'i tshe me lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na yin la de tsam gyis de'i lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid la 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis rtogs pa de'i tshe me lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na yin la de tsam gyis de'i lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid la 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it is cognized by another, then fire is not hidden at all. The meaning is: by that much, there is no error in its being not hidden.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs @291b pa ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs @291b pa ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
translated: “By another” and so on is another refutation.

original: log pa nyid ston pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba ste bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa nyid ston pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba ste bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of the contrary is “Therefore, a pot, etc.”

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan yod par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan yod par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “How?” means that one does not understand that an object different from consciousness exists.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “If” means “doubt.”

original: lan ni mig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni mig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “The eye.”

original: skra la sogs par snang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don med kyang mig tsam las 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams la skra la sogs par snang ba de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs par snang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don med kyang mig tsam las 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams la skra la sogs par snang ba de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: “Just as there is an appearance of hair, etc.” means that just as one admits that there is an illusion from the eye alone, although there is no object, so also there is an appearance of a pillar, etc.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pas nyams so zhes bya ba ga las zhes dris pa na pha rol gyi sgra zhes smras so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pas nyams so zhes bya ba ga las zhes dris pa na pha rol gyi sgra zhes smras so //
translated: The master of the doctrine says “You are mistaken,” and asks “Why?” and the opponent replies “Because of the sound of the other.”

original: 'di la lan du sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma 'khrul bar 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams yang mig la sogs pa nyams pa brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan du sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma 'khrul bar 'dod pa'i shes pa rnams yang mig la sogs pa nyams pa brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to this is “The consciousnesses that are admitted to be nonerroneous with respect to the appearance of blue, etc. should be investigated with respect to the eye, etc.”

original: sngon po la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig tu'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig tu'o //
translated: blue, etc. are of one nature.

original: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the point being made by the phrase “just as.

original: ji ltar mig bsgyur na skra la sogs pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs par 'gyur ram ci gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa las phyi rol du 'dod na sngon po la sogs pa ci ste mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ji ltar mig bsgyur na skra la sogs pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs par 'gyur ram ci gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa las phyi rol du 'dod na sngon po la sogs pa ci ste mi 'dod do //
translated: ” If the eye is transformed into blue, etc., then just as the hair, etc. are, so too will be the blue, etc. If you assert that the blue, etc. are external objects, why not assert that the hair, etc. are?

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang mig la phyi rol gyi khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang mig la phyi rol gyi khyad par ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between the blue, etc. and the eye in terms of being external?

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the point being made by the phrase “just as.

original: mig de las gzhan sngon po la sogs pa rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mig de las gzhan sngon po la sogs pa rgyu yin no //
translated: ” The eye is the cause of the blue, etc.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba myong ba nges pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba myong ba nges pa ste /
translated: “Consciousness” is the experience of the object.

original: yul nges pa dang rnam pa nges te /
analyzed: yul nges pa dang rnam pa nges te /
translated: It is the ascertainment of the object and the ascertainment of the aspect.

original: myong ba des pa de'i phyir phyi'i don 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba des pa de'i phyir phyi'i don 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Because of the ascertainment of the experience, external objects are established.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa ste /
translated: The consequence of the cessation of the effect.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa de'i tshe grub pa'i don du mig nyid brtag pa bla'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa de'i tshe grub pa'i don du mig nyid brtag pa bla'o //
translated: When the effect ceases, it is better to imagine that the eye itself is the established object.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa yang rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa yang rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the eye, etc. are not accepted by the Vijñānavādins,

original: des na de yang ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: des na de yang ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
translated: then how is it that they are understood?

original: de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word “also” is stated.

original: 'o na rnam par shes par smra ba rnams ci zhig 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes par smra ba rnams ci zhig 'dod snyam na /
translated: What do the Vijñānavādins accept?

original: de ma thag pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word “immediately” is stated.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lus bems po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lus bems po'o //
translated: The word “that” refers to the body, which is matter.

original: der zhes bya ba lus su snang ba yod na sngon po la sogs par snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba lus su snang ba yod na sngon po la sogs par snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the appearance of the body exists, then the appearance of blue, etc. exists.

original: da lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “now” is stated.

original: lus su snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: lus su snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The word “appearance” is stated, etc. This is another refutation.

original: gal te phyi'i don med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par tsam las ji ltar yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par tsam las ji ltar yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If external objects do not exist, how is the ascertainment of objects, etc. due to the mere difference of the immediately preceding condition?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //🔽sad @292a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so // sad @292a * //
translated: The word “thus” is stated.🔽The word “awakening” is stated.

original: byed nges pa yin pa'i phyir gyi dmigs pa nges pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed nges pa yin pa'i phyir gyi dmigs pa nges pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the object is due to the ascertainment of the awakener, not due to the ascertainment of the object.

original: yang sad par byed pa de yod pa ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa rnams nges par mthong ba de bzhin du dmigs pa'am sad par byed pa med pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs par snang ba nges pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang sad par byed pa de yod pa ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa rnams nges par mthong ba de bzhin du dmigs pa'am sad par byed pa med pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs par snang ba nges pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as the existence of the awakener is not seen, but the conceptual thoughts are definitely seen, so too, the appearance as blue, etc., is definitely seen, even though the objective referent does not exist.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “In them” refers to attachment, etc.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of delusion” means because they occur even though the objective referent does not exist.

original: gal te dmigs pa med pa de ltar na yang re zhig sad par byed pa ni khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa med pa de ltar na yang re zhig sad par byed pa ni khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: “Even though the objective referent does not exist in that way, the awakener must be accepted.

original: de yang phyi rol nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol na nges par snang ba skye bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang phyi rol nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol na nges par snang ba skye bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And since that is external, how can the appearance of the external be produced?”

original: phyi rol nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The external itself” is stated.

original: 'di'i dpe ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dpe ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is stated in the passage beginning with “For example.”

original: thams cad mthong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan du thams cad mthong ba'i phyir thams cad rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mthong ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan du thams cad mthong ba'i phyir thams cad rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all is seen means that because all is seen in another life, all will appear in the state of dreaming.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dus su ni skye ba gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dus su ni skye ba gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time means at the time of dreaming, because what is seen in another life does not exist.

original: der ram zhes bya ba yul lo //
analyzed: der ram zhes bya ba yul lo //
translated: There means in the object.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of the dream.

original: sngon gyi don nyid las nges pa yin par rtog na /
analyzed: sngon gyi don nyid las nges pa yin par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that ascertainment is due to the object itself,

original: da ni re zhig snang ba don gyis stong par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: da ni re zhig snang ba don gyis stong par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then, first, the appearance would be empty of object.

original: des na gang gis sngar gyi snang ba nyid las nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba snang bas ci zhig bya der ni yul du'o //
analyzed: des na gang gis sngar gyi snang ba nyid las nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba snang bas ci zhig bya der ni yul du'o //
translated: Therefore, what would be the point of the appearance, since ascertainment would not occur here due to the previous appearance?

original: 'on te sngar snang ba nyid da ltar 'dir yang snang ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar snang ba nyid da ltar 'dir yang snang ba yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the appearance itself in the past is the appearance here now,

original: snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the appearance is the same.🔽But if you think that the object is the same,

original: ci ste der zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don du smra ba la'o //
analyzed: ci ste der zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don du smra ba la'o //
translated: then the object is the same.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas der ldan no zhes bya ba ga las zhes dris pa la /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas der ldan no zhes bya ba ga las zhes dris pa la /
translated: The proponent of tenets asks, “How is that?”

original: gzhan lan 'debs pa ni mi slu ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan lan 'debs pa ni mi slu ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “non-deceptive.”

original: mi slu ba yang zhes bya ba ni lan ni mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyi snang ba gang yin pa de nyid brgyud par rigs kyi don ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: mi slu ba yang zhes bya ba ni lan ni mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyi snang ba gang yin pa de nyid brgyud par rigs kyi don ni mi 'grub po //
translated: “ Non-deceptive” is the reply. The appearance that has the characteristic of non-deceptiveness is itself the continuum. The meaning of the term is not established.

original: yang ci'i phyir rjes su mi 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rjes su mi 'jug snyam na /
translated: Again, why is it not engaged?

original: de'i gnas skabs de 'dra bas so //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs de 'dra bas so //
translated: It is because its state is like that.

original: 'on te don bya ba sad pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa med na /
analyzed: 'on te don bya ba sad pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa med na /
translated: But if the object of activity is not observed in the state of the arising of the object of activity,

original: ji ltar don med snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar don med snyam na /
translated: how is it that there is no object?

original: don byed pa la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don byed pa la zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “In the activity of the object.”

original: des na sngon po dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis las gzhan don rig pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na sngon po dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis las gzhan don rig pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is nothing other than the two aspects of blue and the cognition, there is no cognition of the object.

original: 'o na gang 'bras bu yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang 'bras bu yin snyam na /
translated: Well then, what is the effect?

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “The two aspects.”

original: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa de'i dngos por ma grub pa gang @292b yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa de'i dngos por ma grub pa gang @292b yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which is not established as the entity of that which is desired or not desired is called that.

original: rnam par rig pa de ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa de ltar myong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa de ltar myong ba yin no //
translated: That cognition experiences that which is desired and not desired in that way.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang don rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang don rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Now, in the case of the proponent of consciousness, the result is the cognition of the object,

original: rang rig pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: but not the reflexive awareness.

original: don rig pa 'bras bu smras pa na /
analyzed: don rig pa 'bras bu smras pa na /
translated: When the result, the cognition of the object, is stated,

original: rang rig pa'i kho na brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i kho na brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: it is said that only reflexive awareness is expressed.

original: de'i tshe bzung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bzung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, it is called the apprehended.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzung ba'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzung ba'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: That itself means the aspect of the apprehended.

original: mi 'dod pa can gyi shes pas kyang 'dod pa'i don gyi rig pa la 'dod pa'i rnam pa tsam gyi shes pas kyang mi 'dod pa ni don rig na /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa can gyi shes pas kyang 'dod pa'i don gyi rig pa la 'dod pa'i rnam pa tsam gyi shes pas kyang mi 'dod pa ni don rig na /
translated: Even by a cognition that does not desire, when the desired object is cognized, by a cognition that is merely the aspect of the desired, the undesired is cognized.

original: de'i tshe dngos kyi 'jug pas don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos kyi 'jug pas don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: At that time, by the engagement of the entity, the object is cognized.

original: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i rnam par rig pa las mi 'dod pa'i don rnam par 'jog pa las bzlog pa yin pa de'i tshe ni nye bar btags nas rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i rnam par rig pa las mi 'dod pa'i don rnam par 'jog pa las bzlog pa yin pa de'i tshe ni nye bar btags nas rig pa yin no //
translated: If it were not so, that is, if the non-desire of the object were not the opposite of the desire of the object, then the cognition would be imputed.

original: gal te don rang gi ngo bos rig pa yin na de'i tshe shes pa'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa la mi snang na ltos pa kho nar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te don rang gi ngo bos rig pa yin na de'i tshe shes pa'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa la mi snang na ltos pa kho nar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the object were cognized by its own nature, then, when the desired and undesired aspects of the cognition do not appear, it would be desired and undesired only in dependence.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That itself means by its own nature.

original: rten par rang gi rig pa khas lan na ni /
analyzed: rten par rang gi rig pa khas lan na ni /
translated: If you accept that it is cognized in dependence,

original: phyi'i don nyid rten med par ci ste khas mi len gal te phyi rol med na gang zhig rig ces dris pa na /
analyzed: phyi'i don nyid rten med par ci ste khas mi len gal te phyi rol med na gang zhig rig ces dris pa na /
translated: why do you not accept that the external object itself is without dependence? If there is no external object, what is cognized?

original: gal te rten pas rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin no zhes bya ba lan ma yin de'i tshe pha rol gyis kyang ji ltar med pa'i rang rig ba khas len pa de bzhin du med pa'i phyi rol rig pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o zhes brjod par🔽nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te rten pas rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin no zhes bya ba lan ma yin de'i tshe pha rol gyis kyang ji ltar med pa'i rang rig ba khas len pa de bzhin du med pa'i phyi rol rig pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o zhes brjod par nus pa kho na'o //
translated: If you say that it is the nature of consciousness to be self-aware, then you cannot reply that it is impossible to accept external objects that do not exist, just as it is impossible to accept self-awareness that does not exist.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid do //
translated: “That itself” is self-awareness.

original: ma rig pa nyid brjod pa ni rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid brjod pa ni rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Non-awareness” is the opposite of awareness.

original: 'on te don gcig mang pos rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don gcig mang pos rig pa ma yin na /
translated: If you say that many consciousnesses do not cognize one object,

original: de ji ltar rnam pa du mar thal snyam na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam pa du mar thal snyam na /
translated: then how do you explain the consequence that there are many aspects?

original: rtogs par byed pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas gsungs so //
translated: This is explained by the word “realize.”

original: phyi rol du lta ba rig pa can dang mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du lta ba rig pa can dang mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The view of external objects is asserted by the Vātsīputrīya, Sautrāntika, and so on.

original: rang bzhin du ma zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs par med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ma zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs par med pa'o //
translated: “Many natures” means that there are no natures such as pleasure and pain.

original: don tha dad par khas blangs kyang gcig la gnyis kyis nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don tha dad par khas blangs kyang gcig la gnyis kyis nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you accept that objects are different, two people do not experience one object.

original: 'o na ji ltar skyes bu gnyis kyis don gcig la myong bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skyes bu gnyis kyis don gcig la myong bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can two people experience the same object?

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the form of one is the form of the other,

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni /🔽skyes bu gcig la snang ba'i bde ba'i rnam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam @293a * //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni / skyes bu gcig la snang ba'i bde ba'i rnam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam @293a * //
translated: then the form of pleasure would be the form of pain.

original: pa yang zhugs par snang ba yin na ni /
analyzed: pa yang zhugs par snang ba yin na ni /
translated: If the form of pleasure that appears to one person also appears as the form of pain to another person,

original: de'i tshe don gcig la gnyis kyang myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe don gcig la gnyis kyang myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then at that time two people would experience the same object.🔽But when the form of pleasure of one person does not appear to another, how can it be established that two people experience the same object?

original: gang gi tshe gcig gi bde ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de gzhan las snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe ni ji ltar don gcig la gnyis kyis myong bar 'grub par 'gyur na yang don tha dad par khas len na /
