analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig gi bde ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de gzhan las snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe ni ji ltar don gcig la gnyis kyis myong bar 'grub par 'gyur na yang don tha dad par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the objects are different,

original: rang dang gzhan la snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis po dag skyes bu gcig nyid kyis nyams su mi myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis po dag skyes bu gcig nyid kyis nyams su mi myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the two forms that appear to oneself and to another would not fail to be experienced by a single person.

original: 'on kyang myong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang myong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But they are not experienced.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not experienced.

original: gcig gi rnam pa gcig kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa gcig kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood as only one aspect of one.

original: yang ji ltar na re re'i mtha' thug par myong bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na re re'i mtha' thug par myong bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can one not experience the limit of each?

original: thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: He says “all,”

original: rnam pa gcig mthong ba ni zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig mthong ba ni zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i 'dod pa yin te /
translated: and seeing one aspect is the desire to see two moons.

original: dper na zla ba gcig kho na la rab rib kyis bslad pas zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du dngos po gnyis ka'i rnam pa can la mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gcig kho na la rab rib kyis bslad pas zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du dngos po gnyis ka'i rnam pa can la mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa yin no //
translated: For example, because of the defect of blurred vision, one conceives of two moons in only one moon. In the same way, because of the power of seeing, one conceives of one aspect in that which has the aspect of two things.

original: des na rab rib kyi 'dod pa ni mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: des na rab rib kyi 'dod pa ni mthong ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the desire of blurred vision is seeing.

original: zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i 'dod pa rnam pa gcig tu mthong ba yin /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i 'dod pa rnam pa gcig tu mthong ba yin /
translated: The desire to see two moons is seeing one aspect.

original: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba don la rag las pa las rtogs pa ma yin te zla ba gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba don la rag las pa las rtogs pa ma yin te zla ba gnyis bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of “due to the power of the object” is not understanding in dependence on the object, like two moons.

original: de 'dra ba khas len gyi 'di ltar ci ste khas mi len zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de 'dra ba khas len gyi 'di ltar ci ste khas mi len zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that such is accepted, but why is this not accepted?

original: ma mthong ba gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two non-perceptions.

original: btud pa'i yul na gnas pa'i don rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba rtogs pas sgrib par ji ltar nus par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: btud pa'i yul na gnas pa'i don rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba rtogs pas sgrib par ji ltar nus par brjod dgos so //
translated: How can it be said that it is able to obscure the object that is the basis of the appearance, since it is the cause of the understanding of the many aspects of the object?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni goms pa'i dbang nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni goms pa'i dbang nyid do //
translated: That itself means that it is the power of habit.

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: The master means Dignāga.

original: des zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa snang bas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa snang bas so //
translated: By it means by the appearance of the aspect of the object.

original: sdu gu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs par ro zhes bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di'i mtha' thug pa ni slob dpon gyis gzhung yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: sdu gu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs par ro zhes bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di'i mtha' thug pa ni slob dpon gyis gzhung yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
translated: Attractive and so on means up to pleasant. This up to shows that the limit of this is the treatise of the master.

original: / de dang rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba ni 'dzin ba'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: / de dang rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba ni 'dzin ba'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: In accordance with that means in accordance with the aspect of the apprehender.

original: gal te snang ba ma yin mod de lta na yang mngon sum gyis rig pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba ma yin mod de lta na yang mngon sum gyis rig pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: Even though it is not an appearance, it is still only known by direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that means because of that.

original: re zhig rjes su dpag pas ni lkog tu gyur par rig pa yin la /
analyzed: re zhig rjes su dpag pas ni lkog tu gyur par rig pa yin la /
translated: First, inference is known to be hidden.

original: de'i don rig pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i don rig pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that the knowledge of its object is the result,

original: mngon sum gyi 'bras bu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'bras bu zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “the result of perception.”

original: de'i zhes bya ba rig pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba rig pa'i'o //
translated: “ Its” refers to knowledge.

original: @293b blo la gnas don zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: @293b blo la gnas don zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: “ The object that exists in the mind” is the aspect.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i'o //
translated: “ Its” refers to the aspect.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the opponent’s doubt that the other person is a buddha, he says, “Because it is similar to that.”

original: de 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: de 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the other person.

original: don rig pas bag chags khyad par can ston pa ni bag chags ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don rig pas bag chags khyad par can ston pa ni bag chags ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of a special latent predisposition by the knowledge of the object is “The latent predisposition . . .”

original: don gyi nus pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The potency of the object is the aspect.

original: yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the opponent’s doubt that the other person is a buddha, he replies, “If you see the other person . . .”

original: dus gang gi tshe yul gzhan na dngos po yod pa der snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe yul gzhan na dngos po yod pa der snang ba yin gyi /
translated: The opponent thinks: “The object exists at some other time and place, and it is perceived there.

original: don dang bral ba'i dus su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //🔽'di la brtsad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dang bral ba'i dus su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o // 'di la brtsad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is not perceived when it is devoid of meaning.”🔽The debate is as follows: If the object exists at some other time and place, how is it perceived?

original: snang ba'i thabs ci yod gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig na yod do zhes snang ba las kyang ji ltar rtogs snyam na /🔽don med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i thabs ci yod gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig na yod do zhes snang ba las kyang ji ltar rtogs snyam na / don med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the means of perception?

original: de lta na 'o na nam yang ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ji ltar snang /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na nam yang ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ji ltar snang /
translated: Undoubtedly, it exists somewhere. How is it perceived?🔽If it is perceived by the mere existence of the object, then it follows that everything that exists would be perceived.

original: yod pa tsam gyis snang na ni yod pa thams cad snang bar thal ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba nyid snang bar khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyis snang na ni yod pa thams cad snang bar thal ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba nyid snang bar khas blangs dgos te /
translated: Undoubtedly, one must accept that only that object is perceived at a certain time and place which has been seen at another time and place.

original: des ma thob ba ni snang bar 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ma thob ba ni snang bar 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable that what has not been obtained is perceived.

original: rab rib de nyid yul dang dus gzhan du gnas pa'i don mthong ba'i rgyu ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rab rib de nyid yul dang dus gzhan du gnas pa'i don mthong ba'i rgyu ji ltar yin /
translated: How can that very eye disease be the cause of seeing an object that exists at another time and place?

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba smig rgyu la chur mthong ba nyid kyis yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i don gzhan du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba smig rgyu la chur mthong ba nyid kyis yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i don gzhan du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: This very thing, i.e., the seeing of a mirage as water, does not see another object existing in another place and time. The meaning of the statement is erroneous.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: don dam par mthong ba ni snang ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa nyid kyis 'khrul te /
analyzed: don dam par mthong ba ni snang ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa nyid kyis 'khrul te /
translated: “In reality, there is no seeing of an object,” this is erroneous, because it is the very cognition of a mirage as water.

original: des na de skad brjod pa ni nga la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: des na de skad brjod pa ni nga la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, the statement is the same for me.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa de la snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa de la snang ba'o //
translated: “That very thing” is the appearance in the cognition of a mirage as water.

original: don med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni dngos po don byed pa yin na /
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni dngos po don byed pa yin na /
translated: Because it is meaningless. If an entity performs a function,

original: de la ni don bya ba 'ga' yang dmigs pa ma yin pas ji ltar don yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni don bya ba 'ga' yang dmigs pa ma yin pas ji ltar don yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not observed to perform any function at all. So how can it be meaningful?

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: “Everything” includes pillars, etc.

original: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa la ni don bya ba thob kyi smig rgyu la chur shes pa la sogs par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa la ni don bya ba thob kyi smig rgyu la chur shes pa la sogs par ni ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of a pillar, etc., the function is obtained, not in the case of the cognition of water in a mirage, etc.

original: des na khyad yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na khyad yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, there is a difference.

original: de'i phyir gcig 'jig rten pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig 'jig rten pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if one is not worldly,

original: thams cad 'jig rten pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: thams cad 'jig rten pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how can all be worldly?

original: @294a * // mthong ba las zhes smos so //
analyzed: @294a * // mthong ba las zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “from seeing.”

original: don bya ba yang snang ba'i rang bzhin kho na yang yin gyi /
analyzed: don bya ba yang snang ba'i rang bzhin kho na yang yin gyi /
translated: The function is also of the nature of appearance,

original: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa yin na ka ba la sogs pa yang de'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gnas /🔽thob pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa yin na ka ba la sogs pa yang de'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gnas / thob pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and if that is not worldly, how can a pillar, etc. be established as worldly by its power?

original: ka ba la sogs pa la thob pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa la thob pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is a difference in the obtaining of a pillar, etc.,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reply to this is “that also.”

original: thob pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: thob pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
translated: The nature of obtaining is also.

original: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni ma yin pa des na khyad par yod pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni ma yin pa des na khyad par yod pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But a pillar and so on is seen by another, but not a double moon and so on. Therefore, there is a difference.

original: gzhan gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “by another.”

original: ka ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba ma yin te rang gi ngo bo kho na mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba ma yin te rang gi ngo bo kho na mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: A pillar and so on is not seen by another, because only its own nature is seen. This has been explained previously.

original: thob pa'i sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another refutation of obtainment is stated: “How could it be that . . .”

original: dad pa'i dus na dang po'i shes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dus na dang po'i shes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: At the time of faith, the first cognition is the cognition of a pillar and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ka ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ka ba'o //
translated: “ That” is the pillar.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa thob pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa thob pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “ Some” is the cognition that obtains the pillar and so on.

original: de lta'i dngos yin la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la'o //
analyzed: de lta'i dngos yin la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la'o //
translated: “ In that way” is in the nature of obtainment.🔽“ All are the same” is

original: thams cad mtshungs pa la nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs pa la nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All are the same.🔽

original: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rang nyid ko na thob pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa dang zla ba gnyis ka yang mi bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rang nyid ko na thob pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du ka ba la sogs pa dang zla ba gnyis ka yang mi bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the cognition of a pillar, etc. is of the nature of the attainment of itself alone, so also the pillar, etc. and the two moons are not true.

original: shes te zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes te zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The word knows refers to the cognition of a pillar, etc.

original: de'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dag par 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dag par 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang ngo //
translated: The word its cognition refers to the cognition that apprehends the cause as pure.

original: rgyu des na ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag kyang de ltar zhes bya ba bag chags las byung ba zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag kyang de ltar zhes bya ba bag chags las byung ba zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: By that cause, those cognitions of a pillar, etc. should also be considered as arisen from latent impressions, as stated.

original: khyod la yang nyes pa 'di yod do zhe na /
analyzed: khyod la yang nyes pa 'di yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say this fault exists for you as well,

original: thog ma med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said without beginning.

original: de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba rnam par gnas pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba rnam par gnas pa na /
translated: Thus, when the proponents of consciousness are established,

original: de la nye ba lta bur gang ci snang ba de bsams pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la nye ba lta bur gang ci snang ba de bsams pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: whatever appears there as if near, that is the intended object of consideration. The opponent's position is stated: If it is said...

original: tha dad pa yin na gang gis 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na gang gis 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are different, what is it that apprehends? Because there is no awareness that is different from its own nature.

original: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: If that is so,🔽it is because of the power of attachment to that,

original: de'i zhen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni 'brel par 'dzin pa mdo sde zhes bya ba 'di bdag cag 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i zhen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni 'brel par 'dzin pa mdo sde zhes bya ba 'di bdag cag 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: we agree that the ultimate is the sūtra collection that is apprehended as connected.

original: tha snyad du ni sngon nyams su myong ba yang dran pa 'di skyes so zhes lhag par zhen pa las rgyu dang @294b 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni sngon nyams su myong ba yang dran pa 'di skyes so zhes lhag par zhen pa las rgyu dang @294b 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But conventionally, memory arises from the latent propensities of prior experience, and the relation between cause and effect is posited from the perspective of that attachment. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir bdag gis ma sngon mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bdag gis ma sngon mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, I have not seen the self before.🔽I remember it now.

original: 'di nyid ni dran no zhes bya ba'i don rtogs par yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni dran no zhes bya ba'i don rtogs par yod pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is understood to exist,

original: de la gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and there is no evidence to the contrary.

original: phyi rol gang la rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gang la rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which is external and has the effect of consciousness is called that.

original: rnam bar shes pa ni sngar mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can du 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam bar shes pa ni sngar mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can du 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Consciousness is tenable as the effect of consciousness because it is seen previously.

original: de 'bras zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba phyi rol med par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'bras zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba phyi rol med par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “it is an effect” means that it is accepted as an external effect, because it arises without an external object.

original: sbrang bu'i tshogs la du ba'i blo dang smig rgyu la ni chu'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i tshogs la du ba'i blo dang smig rgyu la ni chu'i blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of smoke in a swarm of bees and the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: phyi rol gyi 'bras bu'i phyogs la ni du ba dang chu med par yang du ba dang chu'i blor 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'bras bu'i phyogs la ni du ba dang chu med par yang du ba dang chu'i blor 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the position of an external effect, the cognition of smoke and the cognition of water would occur even without smoke and water, and so there would be error.

original: phyi rol zhes ming tsam byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes ming tsam byas par 'gyur te /
translated: The external would be a mere name.

original: phyi rol ni bag chags kyi stobs las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ni bag chags kyi stobs las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The external is not a transformation due to the power of predispositions.

original: ming tsam de yang 'jig rten pa nyid kyis byas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ming tsam de yang 'jig rten pa nyid kyis byas pa yin pas so //
translated: That mere name is also made by worldly people.

original: ji ltar rmi lam mthong ba rnams yul phyogs gcig nyid la snang ba sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam mthong ba rnams yul phyogs gcig nyid la snang ba sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as in a dream, various appearances occur in a single place.

original: der phan tshun gcig la mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der phan tshun gcig la mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no mutual seeing of one by the other.

original: rang rang gi snang ba tsam rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi snang ba tsam rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each is aware of its own appearance alone.

original: de lta na yang bdag cag gis mthong ba'i rmi lam de ni 'dis kyang yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag cag gis mthong ba'i rmi lam de ni 'dis kyang yin no //
translated: Even so, we see that dream, and he sees that dream.

original: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: There is a single, excessive attachment.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is just the same in the waking state.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i rmongs pa'i sems kyis g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i rmongs pa'i sems kyis g-yo ba ste /
translated: The mind, deluded by the connection with the latent impressions, is moved.

original: rnam par gyur pa yin gyi gtso bo la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa yin gyi gtso bo la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is transformed, but not just the primal substance, etc.

original: de ltar min na ste /
analyzed: de ltar min na ste /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gal te bag chags byed pa po ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags byed pa po ma yin na /
translated: if the latent impressions were not the agent,

original: de'i tshe 'di lta bu'i 'gro ba'i byed pa po gang yin pa de ji ltar rtogs pa mngon du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di lta bu'i 'gro ba'i byed pa po gang yin pa de ji ltar rtogs pa mngon du byed pa yin te /
translated: then how could the agent of such a world manifest its awareness?

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa dang mi ldan pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa dang mi ldan pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be completely devoid of awareness.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ji ltar 'di 'dra ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ji ltar 'di 'dra ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could one who has such an understanding act in this way?

original: 'on te dbang phyug 'di ni nye bar bstan pa nyid byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug 'di ni nye bar bstan pa nyid byed pa yin gyi /
translated: But perhaps you think that God is the one who creates the teaching,

original: ci thod thod byed pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci thod thod byed pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: but not the one who creates the confusion.

original: 'di ni rang don skye ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang don skye ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of “in the creation of his own purpose.

original: gang la sogs pa'i don skye ba de la nye bar bstan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la sogs pa'i don skye ba de la nye bar bstan par byed pa'o //
translated: ” He creates the teaching in the creation of some purpose.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ji srid cig rung rung ma byas pa de srid du logs par bya ba mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ji srid cig rung rung ma byas pa de srid du logs par bya ba mi nus so //
translated: “Otherwise” means that as long as he does not create whatever he wants, he is not able to create anything else.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is what we say” means that this is our response.

original: phyi'i don du smra ba de'i bsam pa mthar thug par bskyal ba'i don du 'di brtsams pa @295a * //
analyzed: phyi'i don du smra ba de'i bsam pa mthar thug par bskyal ba'i don du 'di brtsams pa @295a * //
translated: This is written in order to bring the opponent’s position to its logical conclusion.🔽But why is it not possible to establish this?

original: yin no // yang ci'i phyir 'di bsgrub par mi nus snyam na shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yin no // yang ci'i phyir 'di bsgrub par mi nus snyam na shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is not possible” means that it is not possible.

original: rnam par dbyer med kyang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par ra //
analyzed: rnam par dbyer med kyang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par ra //
translated: “Even though they are not different” means that they are not different in terms of the nature of subject and object, or in terms of the aspects of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni shes pa la sngo sogs sna tshogs zhes bya ba dir  ro ;
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni shes pa la sngo sogs sna tshogs zhes bya ba dir  ro ;
translated: “Already explained” refers to the passage “consciousness is diverse like blue, yellow, and so on.”

original: /'on kyang rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba lhag par zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: /'on kyang rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba lhag par zhen pa nyid do //
translated: “However, it is just a conception” means that it is just an attachment.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa bsal ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni lhag par zhen pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa bsal ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni lhag par zhen pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not that the object and so on are eliminated, but rather that it is just an attachment to them.

original: de'i tha snyad la rgyu mtshan ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de'i tha snyad la rgyu mtshan ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is the reason for that convention?

original: da med kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da med kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Even though it does not exist” is stated.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni 'di de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni 'di de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the form of superimposition is “it is like this.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: “However” refers to an entity.

original: de yang ste gzhan de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ste gzhan de yang ngo //
translated: “That” is also that other.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de 'gog pa'o //
translated: “It is not” is the negation of that.

original: gal te 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If it is understood through seeing the effect,

original: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan dag gis mthong ba'i ka ba la sogs pa dag kyang gcig nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan dag gis mthong ba'i ka ba la sogs pa dag kyang gcig nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the pillar, etc. seen by oneself and by others would not be understood as one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: du ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of smoke, etc.

original: 'on te rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba dag nyid spu ldang ba la sogs pa la gcig tu rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba dag nyid spu ldang ba la sogs pa la gcig tu rtogs pa yin na /
translated: But if the seeing by oneself and by others are understood as one in the case of horripilation, etc.,

original: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan dag gis mthong ba'i ka ba la sogs pa dang / ka ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum yin gyi gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan dag gis mthong ba'i ka ba la sogs pa dang / ka ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum yin gyi gzhan gyis mthong bar bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: then the pillar, etc. seen by oneself and by others and the essence of the pillar, etc. are direct perception, but what is to be seen by another is not direct perception.

original: gzhan gyis mthong bzhin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong bzhin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: “What is seen by another is doubted.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “For that very reason” means because of the absence of a valid cognition.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba la the tshom za'o //
translated: One doubts what is seen by another.

original: khyad par can sngon po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba la ser po'i rang bzhin du yang the tshom za bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: khyad par can sngon po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba la ser po'i rang bzhin du yang the tshom za bar 'gyur na /
translated: If one sees the nature of blue as distinct, one would also doubt the nature of yellow.

original: the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But one does not doubt,

original: des na ji ltar ser po'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba sngon po'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa na ser po'i rang bzhin nyid sel bar byed pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba dang 'gal ba rang gis dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa na gzhan
analyzed: des na ji ltar ser po'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba sngon po'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa na ser po'i rang bzhin nyid sel bar byed pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba dang 'gal ba rang gis dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa na gzhan
translated: Therefore, just as when one observes the nature of blue, which is incompatible with the nature of yellow, the nature of yellow is eliminated, so too, when one observes the object of self-apprehension, which is incompatible with the object of other-apprehension, the object of other-apprehension is eliminated.

original: gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid sel bar byed kyi /
analyzed: gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid sel bar byed kyi /
translated: The object of other-apprehension is eliminated,🔽but one does not doubt.

original: the tshom za ba ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni dogs ba bsu ba'o //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni dogs ba bsu ba'o //
translated: Later means anticipating an objection.

original: rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can ni rnam pa thams cad du srid pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can ni rnam pa thams cad du srid pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not taught that the subject of the hidden consciousness is never possible.

original: mi rigs pa nyid ston pa ni gal @295b te shes pa der lkog tu gyur par 'dod pa'i dam pa'i don snang na /
analyzed: mi rigs pa nyid ston pa ni gal @295b te shes pa der lkog tu gyur par 'dod pa'i dam pa'i don snang na /
translated: The demonstration of the irrationality: If the object is the ultimate, which is asserted to be hidden from consciousness,

original: de'i tshe 'dir lkog tu gyur ba ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir lkog tu gyur ba ci zhig yin te /
translated: then at that time, what is hidden here?

original: 'on kyang mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a direct perception.

original: 'on te yang snang ba med par lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes brjod pa de'i tshe shes pa des mi snang ba'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag gi tshul brgyang ba tsam yin no zhes dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang snang ba med par lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes brjod pa de'i tshe shes pa des mi snang ba'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag gi tshul brgyang ba tsam yin no zhes dpyad pa'o //
translated: But if it is said that the object is hidden without appearance, then it is merely a boast to say that the object that does not appear to that consciousness is realized.

original: mi snang na ni ma rtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang na ni ma rtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If it does not appear, it is not realized at all.

original: sngar go zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i dus na /
analyzed: sngar go zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i dus na /
translated: “ Previously understood” means that at the time of the arising of inference,

original: de las rnga ma nyid ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de las rnga ma nyid ji ltar rtogs /
translated: how is it that noneternality is realized from that?

original: pha rol pos brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa nyid don gyi dngos yod min par ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol pos brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa nyid don gyi dngos yod min par ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The opponent says, “How is it that the thing that is to arise is not the object of inference, which is called ‘that itself’?”

original: de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de med pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de med pa'i dus na /
translated: At that time, how can there be an inference of an entity that will come into existence?

original: 'byung ba'i dngos po ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dngos po ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can one understand an entity that will come into existence when it does not yet exist?

original: de'i tshe ni 'byung ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'byung ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the entity that will come into existence does not yet exist.

original: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba la rjes su dpag pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba la rjes su dpag pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: But if it is not an inference of what will come into existence,

original: thams cad du ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: thams cad du ni zhes smos so //
translated: then the word “always” is meaningless.

original: 'di rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'di rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du'o //
translated: The word “only” means that it is one.

original: 'dir pha rol gyi lkog tu gyur zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'dir pha rol gyi lkog tu gyur zhes smras so //
translated: Here, the opponent says, “It is hidden from view.”

original: 'di la lan ni de lta nyid du zhes bya ba'o //🔽mthong phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni de lta nyid du zhes bya ba'o // mthong phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: The reply is, “It is just like that.”🔽In response to the question, “Why?”

original: de ltar zhes lan 'debs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes lan 'debs te /
translated: the reply is, “Because it is seen.”

original: sngar gyi dus su yod pa nyid do /
analyzed: sngar gyi dus su yod pa nyid do /
translated: It exists in the past.

original: 'o na ji ltar de rjes su dpog snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de rjes su dpog snyam na /
translated: But how can it be inferred?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is, “In the same way.”

original: blta bar bya ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba nyid du'o //
translated: It is as an object of sight.

original: yod ces ji ltar shes zhes dris pa 'di la gzhan gyis zhes lan brjod pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod ces ji ltar shes zhes dris pa 'di la gzhan gyis zhes lan brjod pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: The response that it is known by another is also not correct.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “ That” refers to another.

original: phan tshun bsten pa nyid ston pa ni gzhan dang thun mong ba'i yod pa nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa nyid ston pa ni gzhan dang thun mong ba'i yod pa nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The mutual dependence is shown by the apprehension of existence that is common to both.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'di rnam par shes par smra ba la yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'di rnam par shes par smra ba la yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that this fault exists for the Vijñānavādin,

original: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ in another” refers to the Vijñānavādin.

original: rtogs pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi rang bzhin rig pa can zhig yod kyi gzhan dang thun mong bar zhen pa ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi rang bzhin rig pa can zhig yod kyi gzhan dang thun mong bar zhen pa ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ This understanding” refers to the awareness of one’s own nature. The adherence to the commonality of others is mistaken.

original: de kho na bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rig par byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rig par byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: “ Just as” refers to being known by another.

original: bzlog pa la yang zhes bye ba ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: bzlog pa la yang zhes bye ba ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang ngo //
translated: “ In the opposite case” refers to the case where it is not known by another.

original: phyogs gnyis zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin par ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin par ro //
translated: The two sides are the object of seeing and the non-object of seeing.

original: gzhan gyis de ltar zhes bya ba glang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzim dum la @296a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar zhes bya ba glang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzim dum la @296a * //
translated: Even though the other does not understand the nature of the elephant, etc.,

original: sogs pa ma rtogs pa de lta na yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa ma rtogs pa de lta na yang ngo //
translated: in the way that it is, still,

original: pha rol nyid dogs pa bsu bar byed pa ni rjes su dpag pas so zhes bya ba ste /🔽gzhan gyis ma rtogs so zhes rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol nyid dogs pa bsu bar byed pa ni rjes su dpag pas so zhes bya ba ste / gzhan gyis ma rtogs so zhes rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the suspicion of the other is removed by inference.🔽The other does not understand, but it is not that he does not understand by inference.

original: bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di la yang ngo //
translated: The opposite of that is also the case.

original: yang sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Now, the suspicion of the Buddhist is removed.

original: bzlog pa la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is also the case.

original: bdag gis mthong ba gang yang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ba gang yang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: Whatever is seen by me is also the nature of the other.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i'o //
translated: How is that?

original: da ni grub pa'i mtha' 'cha' ba ni gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni grub pa'i mtha' 'cha' ba ni gcig nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the conclusion is stated: the one, etc.

original: gal te rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba cig ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba cig ma yin na /
translated: If it is not seen by both oneself and others,

original: ji ltar gzhan yang spu ldang ba la sogs pa de 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yang spu ldang ba la sogs pa de 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how can it be the same as the bristling of the hairs, etc. seen by others?

original: 'dra ba rjes su dpag pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dra ba rjes su dpag pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is: “Even though it is inferred to be similar.”

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni glang po la sogs pa ma mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa bde blag tu gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni glang po la sogs pa ma mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa bde blag tu gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not seen” means that the elephant, etc. is not seen, but that the state of ease, etc. is similar to it.

original: gal te 'di zhes bya ba glang po la sogs pa don yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di zhes bya ba glang po la sogs pa don yin la /
translated: If “this” means the elephant, etc.,

original: de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is seen by others.

original: gzhan pa phyi'i don du smra bas khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa phyi'i don du smra bas khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: This is accepted by the proponents of external objects,

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba yang med de des na 'di ni don ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba yang med de des na 'di ni don ma yin no //
translated: but it is not seen by others, so this is not the meaning.

original: de don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba ni chen po don du gnyer ba nyid kyis nye ba dang rgyang ring po na gnas pa dag nye bar 'gro ba thun mong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de don du ma yin no //
analyzed: de don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba ni chen po don du gnyer ba nyid kyis nye ba dang rgyang ring po na gnas pa dag nye bar 'gro ba thun mong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de don du ma yin no //
translated: Because of seeking that means that it would follow that the near and the distant would be equally near because of seeking the great, but it is not for that purpose.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma mthong ba nyid ces rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma mthong ba nyid ces rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: Otherwise means that it is inferred that it is not seen by another.

original: lta ba de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang mthong ba yin na zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: lta ba de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang mthong ba yin na zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: That view means that it has the characteristic of it is seen by another.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid 'gog pa'o //
translated: Or means that it is to be understood in another way, which is the refutation.

original: ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it appears means just as it is conceived.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being like that means because of being clear.

original: rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is reasonable means the result.

original: thob pa ni 'dzin pa la yang yod pa yin no zhes bsams nas bshad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: thob pa ni 'dzin pa la yang yod pa yin no zhes bsams nas bshad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: But it is also possible to hold that the obtainment exists.

original: / lhag ma ni zhes bya ba don gzhan ni lha dbang blo la sogs pa gzhan dag gis bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni zhes bya ba don gzhan ni lha dbang blo la sogs pa gzhan dag gis bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The rest, i.e., the other meanings, are explained by the other masters, such as Devendrabuddhi.

original: gal te gzung ba la sogs pa med pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba la sogs pa med pa ma yin na /
translated: If the apprehended object, etc., do not not exist,

original: 'o na de dag ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: then what are they like?🔽If, as stated, they are not nonexistent,

original: gal te zhes bya bas te 'on kyang ngo //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya bas te 'on kyang ngo //
translated: then they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.

original: de ni bdag po de nyid las zhes bya ba rang bzhin las zhes nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag po de nyid las zhes bya ba rang bzhin las zhes nyams pa'o //
translated: That is, they are not nonexistent.

original: de dag @296b ni gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag @296b ni gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.

original: sna tshogs su zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar snang /🔽gzung ba la sogs par gsal ba yang pha rol gyis khas blangs pas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs su zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar snang / gzung ba la sogs par gsal ba yang pha rol gyis khas blangs pas brjod pa yin no //
translated: That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.🔽That is, they are not nonexistent.

original: gal te tha dad pa snang yang bdag gcig yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa snang yang bdag gcig yin na /
translated: That

original: de'i tshe gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa la yang dag pas tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa la yang dag pas tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is no real difference in the desire for something else.

original: de zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to non-difference.

original: mi snang yang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni tha dad pa kho nar snang bar ji ltar de dag tha mi dad ces bsam ba'o //
analyzed: mi snang yang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni tha dad pa kho nar snang bar ji ltar de dag tha mi dad ces bsam ba'o //
translated: “ Even though they do not appear” means that the aspects of the apprehended object and so on appear to be different. How can they be non-different?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod ba'o //
translated: “ If” expresses another objection.

original: tha dad pa de dag ces bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag ces bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “ Those different” refers to the aspects of the apprehended object and so on.

original: gsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: “ Clearly” means that they are not different from the self.

original: brjod zin pa'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa ni /
translated: The meaning that has already been explained is restated.

original: ji ltar bdag gsal ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad kyang gsal bar khas len na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gsal ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad kyang gsal bar khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that just as the self is clearly manifest, so all aspects are clearly manifest,

original: bdag bzhin du yod yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag bzhin du yod yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would exist just as the self does.

original: rnam pa rnams kyang ma yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams kyang ma yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: “ But the aspects do not exist” is the objection.

original: bshad pa des na mtha' dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa des na mtha' dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: “ Because of that explanation” refers to the previous explanation.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin du gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin du gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If the aspects exist in the nature of manifestation, then they would be the self.

original: rnam pa rnams kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin na de dag kyang bdag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa rnams kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin na de dag kyang bdag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If the aspects exist in the nature of manifestation, then they would be the self.🔽Another refutation is stated:

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'khrul ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'khrul ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If error is not error, then what is error?

original: 'on te bdag nyid la zhes brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid la zhes brjod do snyam na /
translated: If you think that error is itself error,🔽then if error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?

original: 'khrul pa bas bya ba gzhan gyis 'khrul pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bas bya ba gzhan gyis 'khrul pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod la /
translated: If error is not error, then what is error?

original: gas pa ni bzlog bya nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa 'di ni ji srid du ma grub pa nyid de srid du bzlog bya nyid du mi 'grub la /
analyzed: gas pa ni bzlog bya nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa 'di ni ji srid du ma grub pa nyid de srid du bzlog bya nyid du mi 'grub la /
translated: If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?

original: bzlog bya nyid du grub na yang 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'grub pas na phan tshun bsten pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du ji srid du bzlog par bya ba nyid du ma grub pa de srid 'khrul par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: bzlog bya nyid du grub na yang 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'grub pas na phan tshun bsten pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du ji srid du bzlog par bya ba nyid du ma grub pa de srid 'khrul par mi 'grub la /
translated: If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?🔽If error is error, then it is not error.🔽If error is not error, then what is error?

original: bzlog par bya ba nyid kyang ji srid du 'khrul pa nyid du des na bzlog pa la gal te bzlog pa'i don du mi 'jug pa de srid mi 'grub la zhugs pa na yang bzlog par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba nyid kyang ji srid du 'khrul pa nyid du des na bzlog pa la gal te bzlog pa'i don du mi 'jug pa de srid mi 'grub la zhugs pa na yang bzlog par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
translated: And the object of reversal itself is not established as long as one does not engage in the reversal for the sake of the reversal. And when one engages in it, it is the object of reversal, so it is a wheel.

original: 'o na du mar snang ba nyid don dam pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na du mar snang ba nyid don dam pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the appearance of multiplicity itself is ultimate,

original: myong ba ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: myong ba ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, “It is not experienced.”🔽“ That” refers to multiplicity.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni du ma ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni du ma ni'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the one.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gcig gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir tha dad pa yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gcig gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir tha dad pa yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is thought that they are different because they are included in the one,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i nang du @297a * //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i nang du @297a * //
translated: then the response to that is “within that.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the one.

original: gang gi phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig ces bya ba nyid kyis ngag yongs su rdzogs pa yin na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig ces bya ba nyid kyis ngag yongs su rdzogs pa yin na //
translated: Since the statement “the aspect of multiplicity in the one” is a complete sentence,

original: du ma ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid dgag pa dang 'brel gyis nga ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid dgag pa dang 'brel gyis nga ma ni ma yin no //
translated: “ multiplicity does not exist” is connected to the negation, not to “that.”

original: 'di na ni mtha' dag gnyis med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di na ni mtha' dag gnyis med pa kho na ste /
translated: But here, it is only the totality that is non-different.

original: tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that the difference is not apparent.

original: de la ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In this regard, “not” means not different in nature.

original: 'dis ni tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: This shows that it is not different,

original: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but neither is it non-different.

original: gsal ba tsam mi bden pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gsal ba tsam mi bden pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the mere appearance is not true.

original: 'on te goms pa 'di ni bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir bden pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te goms pa 'di ni bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir bden pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if this habit is incapable of being reversed, then it is only true.

original: goms par byed pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms par byed pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that “one should cultivate” this.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la 'dod pa ni nang gi rgyu tsam zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la 'dod pa ni nang gi rgyu tsam zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the dispute beginning with “if”, the assertion is that there is only an internal cause.

original: shes pa thams cad khyab pas so //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad khyab pas so //
translated: Because it pervades all cognitions.

original: rmi lam la sogs par ni bag chags las ma gtogs pa nang gi rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs par ni bag chags las ma gtogs pa nang gi rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In dreams, etc., there is no internal cause other than traces.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Whose” refers to another.

original: de dang zhes bya ba dang po mthong ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba dang po mthong ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the initial perception.

original: de lta ma yin par mthong na zhes bya ba ni dang po mthong ba med par 'khrul pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par mthong na zhes bya ba ni dang po mthong ba med par 'khrul pa na'o //
translated: If it were not so, then the error would occur that there would be no seeing.

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa thams cad mthun pa mthong ba las ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa thams cad mthun pa mthong ba las ji ltar yin te /
translated: At that time, how could all errors be in agreement, since there would be no seeing of the similar?

original: chos mthun pa mthong ba med kyang srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa mthong ba med kyang srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is possible that there would be no seeing of the similar,

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not being refuted.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni bzhin gcig la'o //🔽tha dad pa ma yin du chug mod ces bya ba ni tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rtogs pa po rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni bzhin gcig la'o // tha dad pa ma yin du chug mod ces bya ba ni tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rtogs pa po rnams so //
translated: In regard to itself, in regard to one face.🔽Even if it were not different,

original: yang ji ltar sngon po la sogs rigs pa yang bde ba la sogs pa ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sngon po la sogs rigs pa yang bde ba la sogs pa ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: how could the cognition of blue, etc. be established as pleasure, etc.?

original: sngon po'i rnam pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of blue, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That, i.e., pleasure, etc.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
translated: Here the Siddhantin states:

original: bde ba la sogs pa la ji ltar 'dzin pa rnams bdag nyid du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la ji ltar 'dzin pa rnams bdag nyid du gyur pa yin /
translated: How could the cognitions of pleasure, etc. be the self?

original: 'di la gzhan gyi lan ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi lan ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s response is “itself.”

original: grub pa'i mtha' pas 'dri ba ni gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pas 'dri ba ni gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who asserts the tenets asks, “the manifest . . .”

original: gzhan lan 'debs pa ni lkog tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan lan 'debs pa ni lkog tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent responds, “in secret.”

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “If that is so . . .”

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi stobs kho nas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin rang gi ngo bos ni de dag lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi stobs kho nas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin rang gi ngo bos ni de dag lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If blue and so on are not hidden by the power of others, but by their own nature they are not hidden, this is taught by “If that is so . . .”

original: mig 'jug kyang sngon po lkog tu ma gyur par mi byed la mig @297b ma zhugs kyang sngon po lkog tu ma gyur pa srid pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig 'jug kyang sngon po lkog tu ma gyur par mi byed la mig @297b ma zhugs kyang sngon po lkog tu ma gyur pa srid pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if the eye engages, it does not make blue unhidden, and even if the eye does not engage, it is possible that blue is not hidden. This is taught by “It is like this . . .”

original: gal te yul de mi snang na de'i tshe lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yul de mi snang na de'i tshe lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If the object does not appear, at that time it is not hidden. This is stated by “If it is not seen . . .”

original: gal te yul de mi snang na de lta na yang lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na'o snyam na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yul de mi snang na de lta na yang lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na'o snyam na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that if the object does not appear, then it is not hidden, then the response is “If it is not hidden, then it is not a hidden object.”

original: mig la sogs pa las byung bar mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i'o //🔽gzhan du snang ba bag chags kyi rgyu can yin na de'i tshe gzhan du snang bar 'dod pa'i snang ba la ltos te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las byung bar mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i'o // gzhan du snang ba bag chags kyi rgyu can yin na de'i tshe gzhan du snang bar 'dod pa'i snang ba la ltos te /
translated: It is the object that is held to arise from the eye and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bor snang ba gzhan du gyur pa yin te yang bag chags kyi rgyu can du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang ba gzhan du gyur pa yin te yang bag chags kyi rgyu can du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the appearance of something else is due to the cause of latent potentialities, then at that time, in dependence on the appearance of the object that is held to be the appearance of something else, the appearance of its own nature is transformed into something else.🔽The meaning is that it is due to the cause of latent potentialities.

original: snang ba nyid las shes so snyam na snang ba tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba nyid las shes so snyam na snang ba tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is known from the appearance itself, then the response is “The appearance is valid.”

original: gal te snang bar 'khrul pa yin te dngos po gzhan du gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snang bar 'khrul pa yin te dngos po gzhan du gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur na /
translated: If the appearance is mistaken, and the object exists in one way but appears in another,

original: de'i tshe brten pa gang las yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe brten pa gang las yin te /
translated: then at that time, from what basis does it arise?

original: 'ga' las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' las kyang ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from anything at all.

original: rang gi ngo bos snang bar 'dod pa las gzhan pa'i snang ba mig la sogs pa nyes pa'i rgyus skyed par 'dod pa ste de bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang bar 'dod pa las gzhan pa'i snang ba mig la sogs pa nyes pa'i rgyus skyed par 'dod pa ste de bzhin no //
translated: It is not the case that the eye, etc. are the cause of the appearance of something other than the appearance that is asserted to be the entity of consciousness.

original: gal te shes pa me long ltar shin tu gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa me long ltar shin tu gsal ba yin na /
translated: If consciousness is very clear, like a mirror,

original: de'i nye bar gzhag pa nye bar gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'jog pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa snang bar thal na de ni snang bar mthong ba yang med de des na me long ltar snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nye bar gzhag pa nye bar gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'jog pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa snang bar thal na de ni snang bar mthong ba yang med de des na me long ltar snang ba ma yin no //
translated: then it follows that the eye, etc. would be the appearance of the reflection that is placed before it. But it is not seen to be the appearance of that, so it is not like a mirror.

original: thal ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni me long la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni me long la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To demonstrate the absurdity of that, it says, “The mirror does not think, ‘I will make an appearance.’”

original: ci me long snang ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang yin no zhes brgya lam sangs rgyas khas len pa de la smras pa ni me long la sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci me long snang ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang yin no zhes brgya lam sangs rgyas khas len pa de la smras pa ni me long la sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one were to say, “Just as the mirror is the cause of the appearance, so too are the eye, etc.,” then in response to that, it says, “Like a mirror, etc.”

original: der bshad pa'i rnam pa chen po ma yin par mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der bshad pa'i rnam pa chen po ma yin par mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The great aspect that is explained there is not seen.

original: chen po ma yin pa nyid du snang mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: chen po ma yin pa nyid du snang mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with the appearance of a small object as large?

original: des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise says,

original: re zhig kha dog ni nges par 'gyur ro snyam na ling tog ces smos so //
analyzed: re zhig kha dog ni nges par 'gyur ro snyam na ling tog ces smos so //
translated: If you think that color is ascertained, he says, cataracts.

original: gang gi tshe ling tog dang rab rib la sogs pas mig rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de'i tshe der shar ba'i mdog kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ling tog dang rab rib la sogs pas mig rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de'i tshe der shar ba'i mdog kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When the eye is transformed by cataracts, floaters, and so on, the color that appears to it is also transformed.

original: des na de'i sgo nas yul de'i mdog can du ji ltar nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na de'i sgo nas yul de'i mdog can du ji ltar nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, how can it be ascertained that the object has that color?

original: gal te mig gi 'od zer mig 'bras nas 'thon nas chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs la zhugs pa ni chen po la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mig gi 'od zer mig 'bras nas 'thon nas chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs la zhugs pa ni chen po la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: If you think that light rays from the eye emerge from the eyeball and enter the form of a large object and so on, and that they apprehend the nature of the large object and so on,

original: @298a * // gsal bar byed pas na sgron ma ste mig gi snang ba'o //
analyzed: @298a * // gsal bar byed pas na sgron ma ste mig gi snang ba'o //
translated: the light of the eye is a lamp because it illuminates.

original: de dang 'brel pa las gal te ngo bo khyad par can skye na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa las gal te ngo bo khyad par can skye na /
translated: If a special nature arises from contact with that,

original: de'i tshe sgron ma dang 'brel pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgron ma dang 'brel pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the nature of form connected with the lamp would not be cognized.

original: 'on te sgron ma dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan 'dod na de'ang thug pa med de /
analyzed: 'on te sgron ma dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan 'dod na de'ang thug pa med de /
translated: But if you assert that there is another apprehender of form and so on connected with the lamp, that is also infinite,

original: de yang bshad zin pa'i nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bshad zin pa'i nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously explained faults would apply.

original: 'on te gzugs kyi rang bzhin rig pa yod pa na de'i tshe 'od zer de dag 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyi rang bzhin rig pa yod pa na de'i tshe 'od zer de dag 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: But if the nature of form is cognized, at that time those light rays are the apprehender.

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: That is not so.

original: des na skyes pa tsam las zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na skyes pa tsam las zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it should be said that it arises merely from birth.

original: de lta na yang shes pa thams cad kyi rnam pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu nyid kyi yul yin na nyes snyam na rgyu nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang shes pa thams cad kyi rnam pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro // rgyu nyid kyi yul yin na nyes snyam na rgyu nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: Even so, it follows that all consciousnesses would have aspects.🔽If you think that there is a fault in being an object of the cause, the cause itself is stated.

original: de'i rnam pa tsam gyis yul yin na yang nyes pa brjod pa ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa tsam gyis yul yin na yang nyes pa brjod pa ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is an object of the mere aspect of that, the statement of the fault is “by the aspect of that.”

original: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni de'i skyed byed dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni de'i skyed byed dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa la'o //
translated: Both means both the producer and the determiner.

original: myong ba nyid dam zhes bya bar rang rig pa dang / de lta ma yin par rang rig pa ma yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: myong ba nyid dam zhes bya bar rang rig pa dang / de lta ma yin par rang rig pa ma yin na yang ngo //
translated: Either as experience itself or not, means either as self-awareness or not.

original: rtogs pa dang gzhan pa'i gnas skabs mi rung ba nyid brjod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang gzhan pa'i gnas skabs mi rung ba nyid brjod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “the impossibility of the state of being understood and the state of being other” is as follows.

original: grangs can gyi lta ba la ni rnam pa dang ldan pa blo yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi lta ba la ni rnam pa dang ldan pa blo yin no //
translated: In the Sāṃkhya view, cognition is endowed with aspects.

original: des na gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs na de'i tshe sems yod pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: des na gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs na de'i tshe sems yod pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: Therefore, if the nature of cognition is understood, then what is the use of another mind that exists?

original: don med pa'i phyi rol zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid las de na gnas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyi rol zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid las de na gnas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The external is meaningless means that the establishment of the existence of the external is meaningless because the nature of cognition is understood.

original: 'on te blo'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na /
analyzed: 'on te blo'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na /
translated: But if the nature of cognition is not understood,

original: de'i tshe yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis yul rnam par 'jog par mi nus te rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis yul rnam par 'jog par mi nus te rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then at that time, the nature of the object cannot be determined by the cognition because it is devoid of aspects.

original: 'on te ma rtogs pa'i blo nyid kyis yul rnam par 'jog par byed ce na ma rtogs ba ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs pa'i blo nyid kyis yul rnam par 'jog par byed ce na ma rtogs ba ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “That which does not understand” is stated.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa'i yul zhes bya ba rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa'i yul zhes bya ba rgyu ma yin no //
translated: “That which understands” is not the cause of the object’s positing.

original: blo ni shes par byed pa yin na rang nyid ma shes par ji ltar yul shes par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo ni shes par byed pa yin na rang nyid ma shes par ji ltar yul shes par byed par 'gyur /
translated: If cognition is what makes known, how can it make the object known without itself being known?

original: gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs so zhe na ni de nyid de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs so zhe na ni de nyid de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the nature of cognition is known, then that very nature of cognition is known.

original: sems pa yod pa gzhan gyis ci bya ba snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa yod pa gzhan gyis ci bya ba snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: What is the use of another existent, thought?

original: de lta na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag gcig tu ji ltar 'thad snyam na bya ba gzhan dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag gcig tu ji ltar 'thad snyam na bya ba gzhan dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is thought that in that case how can valid cognition and its result be tenable as one, [the answer is that] “another action” is stated.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “That very” is the form of cognition.

original: da ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad par bya ba @298b slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: da ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad par bya ba @298b slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: Now, “furthermore” and so on explain the treatise of master Dignāga.

original: de dang khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni yul gyi shes pa dang khyad par med par ro //
analyzed: de dang khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni yul gyi shes pa dang khyad par med par ro //
translated: “Without distinction” means without distinction from the cognition of the object.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni yul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni yul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
