translated: This is what is being explained: “The cognition of the object.”

original: 'on te dran pas yul du byas pa'i snang ba 'di ni don nyid yin no snyam na don dang snang ba gcig pa nyid yin na'o ;
analyzed: 'on te dran pas yul du byas pa'i snang ba 'di ni don nyid yin no snyam na don dang snang ba gcig pa nyid yin na'o ;
translated: But if you think that the appearance that is the object of memory is the object itself, then the object and the appearance would be identical.

original: / de nyid la de ni 'di lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi nges pa dang / de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: / de nyid la de ni 'di lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi nges pa dang / de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ma nges pa'o //
translated: And in that case, there would be the certainty that it is an appearance that is like that, and there would be the uncertainty that it is not like that.

original: cha gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni phra mo dang phra mo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: cha gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni phra mo dang phra mo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Two parts” means the subtle and the not subtle.

original: 'di'i lam ni 'di ni phyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lam ni 'di ni phyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is its path” means “this is its path later.”

original: 'o na shes pa yod par ji ltar 'grub snyam na de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na shes pa yod par ji ltar 'grub snyam na de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: But how is the existence of cognition established? “In that case,” he says.

original: ji ltar don shes pa ste gsal ba'i mchog tu gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar don shes pa ste gsal ba'i mchog tu gyur na /
translated: How is it that the object is known, that is, is the best illumination?

original: don gyis go bas shes pa yongs su rtogs pa de bzhin du dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad par te /
analyzed: don gyis go bas shes pa yongs su rtogs pa de bzhin du dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad par te /
translated: Just as consciousness is fully understood by the understanding of the object, so memory is understood by the non-establishment of memory elsewhere.

original: dran par don gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang dran pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dran par don gsal ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang dran pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Memory is understood by the non-establishment of the clarity of the object elsewhere.

original: shes pa rig pa ma yin la /🔽shes pa de la tshul gnyis kyang yod na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rig pa ma yin la / shes pa de la tshul gnyis kyang yod na ni ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not self-awareness.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness had two modes, then it would not be self-awareness, because both modes would be without experience.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas bsgrub bo snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas bsgrub bo snyam na /
translated: If you think it is established by inference, then:

original: gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the reason is stated in doubt.🔽Another refutation is stated:

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gtan tshigs dpe la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gtan tshigs dpe la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example of the reason is stated.

original: bram ze dag ces bya ba brjod pa de ni mi rigs so zhes 'brel to //🔽skra shad la sogs pa ni shes pa la'o //
analyzed: bram ze dag ces bya ba brjod pa de ni mi rigs so zhes 'brel to // skra shad la sogs pa ni shes pa la'o //
translated: The statement “Brahmins” is not correct.🔽The example of the hair and so on is in regard to consciousness.

original: dung dkar po la ser por shes pa'o //
analyzed: dung dkar po la ser por shes pa'o //
translated: The example of the white conch as yellow is in regard to consciousness.

original: de la yang khyed kyis dam bcas pa nyid mngon sum gyi gnod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang khyed kyis dam bcas pa nyid mngon sum gyi gnod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, “In that case, your very thesis is undermined by direct perception.”

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
translated: “Certainty” refers to memory.

original: nges pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The nature of that certainty is stated in the phrase,

original: de de lta bur sdang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de de lta bur sdang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “it is remembered as being of that nature.”

original: 'on te yul shes pa'i shes pa rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig snyam na yul shes pa la zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'on te yul shes pa'i shes pa rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig snyam na yul shes pa la zhes smras so //
translated: If you are wondering what the nature of the consciousness that perceives an object is, the root text states, “The consciousness that perceives an object.”

original: rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yul shes pa'i shes pa rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yul shes pa'i shes pa rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The phrase “by the very fact that it is the cause” means that the consciousness that perceives an object is the cause.

original: nyams myong ba yang de lta bur zhes bya ba don gyi rnam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams myong ba yang de lta bur zhes bya ba don gyi rnam par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “the experience is of that nature” means that the object is of that nature.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni don shes pa'i shes pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid la snang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni don shes pa'i shes pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid la snang ba'o //
translated: The phrase “that consciousness” refers to the consciousness that perceives the object and appears in the form of memory.

original: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
translated: The phrase “in that very way” means that it is clearly.

original: de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar ro //
translated: The phrase “it appears in that way” means that it is not clearly.

original: gal te dran pa la snang ba 'di don yin na de'i tshe skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dran pa la snang ba 'di don yin na de'i tshe skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this appearance in memory were the object, then it would be understood by another person.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni @299a * //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni @299a * //
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: bdag la rtag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la rtag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If it were always mine”

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni bdag la 'brel ba nyid na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni bdag la 'brel ba nyid na'o //
translated: “If it were so” means if it were connected to the self.

original: bdag la 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa ni brjod kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa ni brjod kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The pleasure, etc., connected to the self are not understood by others even if they are described.

original: de ltar ma yin par yang zhes bya ba ni ma brjod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par yang zhes bya ba ni ma brjod kyang ngo //
translated: “Even if it were not so” means even if it were not described.

original: gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dran pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dran pa las gzhan no //
translated: “It would be different” means it would be different from my memory.

original: 'di ni gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'dis rtogs la gang yin pa nyid ngas rtogs so zhes rnam pa de ltar rtogs pa ni skyes bu de gnyis la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'dis rtogs la gang yin pa nyid ngas rtogs so zhes rnam pa de ltar rtogs pa ni skyes bu de gnyis la mi 'gyur te /
translated: “This is one” means that the two people would not understand in this way: “This one understands it” and “I understand it.”

original: don de ni so sor bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de ni so sor bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is different for each of them.

original: ci'i phyir mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Why would they not be connected?

original: sems de gnyis ni zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: sems de gnyis ni zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The two minds are as stated.

original: /'dir zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i sems dag la'o //
analyzed: /'dir zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i sems dag la'o //
translated: Here refers to the minds of the expounder and the listener.

original: gzhan la gnas pa yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma brjod kyang 'dra ba dang dngos por gyur pa yod pas na /
analyzed: gzhan la gnas pa yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma brjod kyang 'dra ba dang dngos por gyur pa yod pas na /
translated: Also, in another refers to the fact that even though it is not stated by another, it exists in a similar way and in reality,

original: rang gi rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rgyun gzhan la yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rgyun gzhan la yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: so that one can understand it in another continuum, following one’s own understanding.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained: If I also, etc.

original: mi bden pa brjod pa'i dus na nyan pa'i blo don dang bral ba yin mod /
analyzed: mi bden pa brjod pa'i dus na nyan pa'i blo don dang bral ba yin mod /
translated: When an unreal object is stated, the listener’s mind is divorced from the object.

original: de las cir 'gyur snyam na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur snyam na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: mi bden pa brjod pa'i dus na ni smra ba po'i sems la de 'dra ba'i don snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bden pa brjod pa'i dus na ni smra ba po'i sems la de 'dra ba'i don snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When an unreal object is stated, there is no such appearance of the object in the mind of the expounder.

original: de lta na yang nyan pa pos smra ba po la de 'dra ba'i snang ba yod do zhes par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na yang nyan pa pos smra ba po la de 'dra ba'i snang ba yod do zhes par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, the listener thinks that the expounder has such an appearance.

original: rnam pa gang gis shes pa gnyis sngon po nyams su myong ba'i cha gnyis la dmigs snyam na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis shes pa gnyis sngon po nyams su myong ba'i cha gnyis la dmigs snyam na /
translated: If you think that the two cognitions focus on the two parts that experience blue,

original: sngon por snang ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa 'chad de cha gcig go //
analyzed: sngon por snang ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa 'chad de cha gcig go //
translated: the appearance of blue explains the aspect of the object, which is one part.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de cha gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de cha gnyis pa'o //
translated: Cognition explains the nature of the realization, which is the second part.

original: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pas so //
translated: Others explains the brahmans and so on.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'o //
translated: How explains the cognition of blue.

original: 'ba' zhig par zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa dang bal bar ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig par zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa dang bal bar ro //
translated: Alone explains without the aspect of the object.

original: don gyis go bas brtags pa de ltar ni rjes su 'brang ba su yang med do //🔽de ltar rjes su 'brang ba lta re zhig gzhag ste /
analyzed: don gyis go bas brtags pa de ltar ni rjes su 'brang ba su yang med do // de ltar rjes su 'brang ba lta re zhig gzhag ste /
translated: Since this is understood by implication, no one follows this.

original: don gyis go bas yang mi srid do zhes gsungs pa ni don gyis go ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis go bas yang mi srid do zhes gsungs pa ni don gyis go ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since this is understood by implication, it is impossible.

original: 'on te don gyis go bas blo tha dad par rjes su dpog pa de'i nyes pa ci yod snyam na don gyis go bas zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas blo tha dad par rjes su dpog pa de'i nyes pa ci yod snyam na don gyis go bas zhes smras so //
translated: But if you think that the fault of the difference of cognition is not incurred because of the understanding of the meaning, [we reply that] it is said that [the fault is incurred] because of the understanding of the meaning.

original: yang ji ltar de nges par bya ba ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de nges par bya ba ma yin snyam na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that [the meaning] is not ascertained?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs par byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs par byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to understand [the meaning].

original: de nyid brjod pa ni gzugs la @299b sogs par zhes bya ba'o //🔽rkyen tha dad pas zhes bya ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni gzugs la @299b sogs par zhes bya ba'o // rkyen tha dad pas zhes bya ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la ni /
translated: This is stated by the words “form, etc.”

original: gha nya'i rkyen yin la blo zhes bya ba la ni kti na'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gha nya'i rkyen yin la blo zhes bya ba la ni kti na'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The words “by the difference of conditions” in the statement “the cognition is different because of the difference of conditions” are in the genitive case.🔽But the word “cognition” is in the ablative case.

original: 'di nyid sdud pa ni kti dang ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽don tha dad pa yin na ni gha nya'i rkyen gyi mtha' can rtogs pa des /
analyzed: 'di nyid sdud pa ni kti dang ni zhes bya ba'o // don tha dad pa yin na ni gha nya'i rkyen gyi mtha' can rtogs pa des /
translated: This is summarized in the words “the ablative and the genitive.”🔽If the meaning is different, then the cognition that has the genitive ending, “of the cognition,”

original: kti na'i rkyen gyi mtha' can gyi blo 'chad pa ste blo ni rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: kti na'i rkyen gyi mtha' can gyi blo 'chad pa ste blo ni rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it explain the cognition that has the ablative ending, “from the cognition”?

original: 'o na sngon po'i blo zhes tha dad par ji ltar ston snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sngon po'i blo zhes tha dad par ji ltar ston snyam na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the expression “cognition of blue” is used?

original: sngon po la sogs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is that very blue, etc.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid rjes su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid rjes su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: The expression “having the aspect of that” means that it has the aspect of blue, etc.

original: phyi ma'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu byung ba 'di ni sngon po'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu byung ba 'di ni sngon po'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: The expression “the subsequent cognition” means the conceptual cognition that arises immediately after the cognition of blue, and thinks “this is the aspect of blue.”

original: tha dad par zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bzos sprus pas so //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i bzos sprus pas so //
translated: The expression “as distinct” means that it is distinct through the fabrication of conceptualization.

original: de ltar na tshad mas grub par gyur pa gang yin pa de la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad mas grub par gyur pa gang yin pa de la brten nas /
translated: Thus, on the basis of what is established by a valid cognition,

original: gzhan tshad mas ma grub ba 'gog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan tshad mas ma grub ba 'gog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: one can refute what is not established by a valid cognition.

original: 'di nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the argument:

original: 'on te de ni tshad mas grub ba la brten nas blo nyid dgag par bya'o snyam na de la re zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de ni tshad mas grub ba la brten nas blo nyid dgag par bya'o snyam na de la re zhig ces bya'o //
translated: If you think that on the basis of what is established by a valid cognition, you can refute cognition itself, then we reply as follows.

original: ci ste blor smra bas kyang don khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste blor smra bas kyang don khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: But if you say that the object must be accepted because the mind is asserted,

original: de lta ma yin na blo nyid rab tu mi 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /🔽blo dang ldan pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na blo nyid rab tu mi 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na / blo dang ldan pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is not correct that the mind itself is not established.🔽The response to that is “The wise one . . .

original: rnam par shes par smra bas ni'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra bas ni'o //
translated: ” The one who asserts consciousness.

original: gal te ji ltar blo rang rig pas grub par khas blangs nas don yongs su 'dor ba de bzhin du don yang rang rig par khas blangs nas blo dor bar bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar blo rang rig pas grub par khas blangs nas don yongs su 'dor ba de bzhin du don yang rang rig par khas blangs nas blo dor bar bya'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that just as the mind is accepted as established by reflexive awareness, the object is rejected, in the same way, the object is accepted as reflexive awareness and the mind is rejected,🔽then if there is no mind that is different from the aspect of blue and so on, how could it exist?

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i blo med do zhe na ni de yod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni ji ltar skad cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i blo med do zhe na ni de yod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni ji ltar skad cig ces gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is “Just as . . .🔽” The mind that remembers is like that.

original: blo gzhan dran pa de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan dran pa de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: The aspect of blue and so on is like that.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan gyis so //
translated: “ Therefore . . . ” means by another mind.

original: sngon po'i rnam par shes pa snga ma de nyid dran pa la gnas par tshad mar gang las nges par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par shes pa snga ma de nyid dran pa la gnas par tshad mar gang las nges par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the valid cognition that ascertains that the previous consciousness that has the aspect of blue is remembered?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The response to this is “in that way.”

original: de ltar rtogs kyang gal te de ltar tha snyad mi byed na ni de'i tshe thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyang gal te de ltar tha snyad mi byed na ni de'i tshe thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though it is realized in that way, if one does not make that convention, then everything would be destroyed.

original: 'o na 'di ltar de la don gyi rnam pa yang snang ba ji ltar yin snyam na de la shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar de la don gyi rnam pa yang snang ba ji ltar yin snyam na de la shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks, “In that case, how is it that the aspect of the object appears?” the response is “consciousness of that.”

original: de dang 'brel ba ni don dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba ni don dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: “ Related to that” means related to the object.

original: @300a * // rgyu des na zhes bya ba shes pa'i yul de'o //
analyzed: @300a * // rgyu des na zhes bya ba shes pa'i yul de'o //
translated: “ Because of that” means the object of consciousness.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don med pa'o //
translated: “ Otherwise” means without an object.

original: de ltar ni don dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni don dang bcas par ro //
translated: “ In that way” means with an object.

original: gal te de ltar na yang don tha dad pa nyid dran par 'gyur mod shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du gyur par go dran snyam na de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang don tha dad pa nyid dran par 'gyur mod shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du gyur par go dran snyam na de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one thinks, “Even if that is so, the object would be remembered as different,” the response is “that.”

original: don la rgyu des na de'i rnam pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid la stobs zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: don la rgyu des na de'i rnam pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid la stobs zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: In fact, that very understanding of the form of the object is called “power.”

original: de yang 'khrul nas 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul nas 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that is due to error.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba don gyi rnam pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba don gyi rnam pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Thus” means that the form of the object is understood.

original: gnyis la yang zhes bya ba snang ba dang yid la byed pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis la yang zhes bya ba snang ba dang yid la byed pa la yang ngo //
translated: “In both” means in the appearance and in the mental activity.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa des na de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa des na de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: “For that reason” means that because such an error exists, that is not correct.

original: 'on te gzugs med par snang ba gzung bar mi nus pas na snang ba gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs med par snang ba gzung bar mi nus pas na snang ba gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you think that since the formless appearance cannot be apprehended, the appearance is form,

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzhan du yang 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzhan du yang 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
translated: and consciousness apprehends something else,

original: ji ltar gzugs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs zhes gsungs so //
translated: then how can it be called “form”?🔽If you understand it in that way because of the result,

original: 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar rtogs na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dran na rgyu gzugs kyang dran pa yin no zhes khas len na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar rtogs na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dran na rgyu gzugs kyang dran pa yin no zhes khas len na'o //
translated: then if consciousness is the result, you accept that when it is remembered, the cause, form, is also remembered.

original: yang ji ltar na nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur snyam na don de nang du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur snyam na don de nang du zhes gsungs so //
translated: How then is this ascertainment not to be reversed? The meaning is: internally.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The first is the apprehension of the object.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the nature of both, i.e., it is not the nature of both the object and the apprehension of the object. This is clarified by the words: the aspect of the apprehension alone.

original: gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes pa la 'dzin par byed pa la yang ngo //🔽nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnyis pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes pa la 'dzin par byed pa la yang ngo // nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnyis pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The second is the ascertainment of the object.

original: shes pa gnyis pa la nges par 'dzin pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems de des so //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis pa la nges par 'dzin pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems de des so //
translated: By the mind of ascertainment, i.e., by the mind that has the characteristic of memory, which ascertains the second, i.e., the cognition of the object.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yang ngo //
translated: That also, i.e., the second, is the ascertainment of the cognition of the object.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis don brjod pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis don brjod pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the case of identity of nature, i.e., in the case of the identity of the nature of the object and the apprehension of the object. This is clarified by the words: the aspect of the apprehension of the object.

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni don shes pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni don shes pa dran pa'o //
translated: The second is the memory of the cognition of the object.

original: blo snga ma zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: blo snga ma zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The so-called prior cognition is the apprehension of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma don gyi rnam pa can du sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma don gyi rnam pa can du sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The prior consciousness is applied to the form of the object. This is the meaning.🔽This very [point] is stated by way of negation: “If the cognition of the object were not in the form of the object, then the prior cognition alone would be observed.”

original: gal te don gyis shes pa don rnam pa can du ma gyur na de'i tshe blo snga ma 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don gyis shes pa don rnam pa can du ma gyur na de'i tshe blo snga ma 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognition of the object were not in the form of the object, then at that time the prior cognition alone would be observed.

original: 'dzin pa la yang the tshom za ba yin te gzung ba ma dran na ni 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la yang the tshom za ba yin te gzung ba ma dran na ni 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: There would also be doubt regarding the apprehender, because if the apprehended is not remembered, it is not the apprehender.

original: phyed phyi @300b ma 'chad pa ni 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi @300b ma 'chad pa ni 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter half of the verse is explained: “Because of apprehending.”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
translated: That very [cognition] is the nature of the apprehender, which is free from the activity of apprehending.

original: gzung ba nye ba na gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba gzung ba'i byed pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du ni gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba nye ba na gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba gzung ba'i byed pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du ni gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: When the apprehended is present, it does not become the nature possessing the activity of apprehending, which is different [from the apprehended].

original: rgyu des na 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du dran par gyur pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid ces bya ba 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du dran par bya ba de ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa yin
analyzed: rgyu des na 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du dran par gyur pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid ces bya ba 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du dran par bya ba de ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa yin
translated: How can it be a grasper?

original: / de snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: / de snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba snang ba nyid do //
translated: “Its appearance” means the appearance of the object.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: “This” means the grasper.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang 'dzin par byed pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang 'dzin par byed pa gcig nyid do //
translated: The identity of form, etc., and the grasper are one.

original: de skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: de skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: This is what Master Dignaga says.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma snga ma'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma snga ma'o //
translated: “That” refers to the previous cognition.

original: yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an object means because it is devoid of the aspect of an object.

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the text. Because means

original: de las te shes pa dang po las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las te shes pa dang po las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from that, from the first cognition.

original: de'i zhes bya ba shes pa snga ma'i don gyi rnam pa dang rig pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba shes pa snga ma'i don gyi rnam pa dang rig pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the aspect of the object and the aspect of awareness of the prior cognition.

original: shes pa'i shes pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid can skyes par gyur pa na /
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid can skyes par gyur pa na /
translated: When the cognition of that cognition arises, which has the characteristic of memory,

original: de'i zhes bya ba shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: “that” refers to the aspect of the prior cognition.

original: dper na thag ring po'i shing las skyes pa'i shes pa shing gi rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na thag ring po'i shing las skyes pa'i shes pa shing gi rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: For example, the cognition that arises from a distant tree has the aspect of the tree.

original: de gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni don gnas pa nyid shes pa de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni don gnas pa nyid shes pa de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Its existence” refers to the existence of the object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes pa nges par rtog pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes pa nges par rtog pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the cognition of pleasure and so on is conceptual,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: he says, “The cognition of pleasure and so on . . .”

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “The cognition of pleasure and so on” is explained below.

original: khyed la zhes bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: khyed la zhes bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “You” refers to the Naiyāyikas and so on.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa yul yin yang rnam par shes pa ni de dag las tha dad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa yul yin yang rnam par shes pa ni de dag las tha dad ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you think that even though pleasure, etc. are objects, consciousness is not different from them,

original: 'on kyang de dag nyid yin no snyam na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag nyid yin no snyam na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather they are just that, then how?

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Both means both pleasure, etc. and blue, etc.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa kho na sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa kho na sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. alone apprehend blue, etc.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par shes pa rtog pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par shes pa rtog pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: and therefore consciousness is only imagined to be different from blue, etc.,

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then pleasure, etc.

original: de med kyang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhes bya ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med kyang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhes bya ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa nyid do //
translated: Even without that means even without pleasure, etc., the difference in its own nature, which is the nature of manifestation, is made.
That means

original: med par te gsal ba'i rang bzhin med par 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par te gsal ba'i rang bzhin med par 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: without manifestation, without the nature of manifestation, there is no apprehension.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni zhe lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin med par sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa dmigs pa med kyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin kho na yin
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni zhe lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin med par sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa dmigs pa med kyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin kho na yin
translated: However, the activity of apprehending blue and so on is only a clear nature.

original: no // de yang bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //🔽phyi rol gyi zla ba nyid la zla ba bdag gnyis su mthong ba nyid kyis tha dad par mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa bdag nyid la yang yul gyi rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis su rnam par shes pa rang bzhin
analyzed: no // de yang bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // phyi rol gyi zla ba nyid la zla ba bdag gnyis su mthong ba nyid kyis tha dad par mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa bdag nyid la yang yul gyi rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis su rnam par shes pa rang bzhin
translated: And that is not the self. This is what is said by “therefore.”

original: gcig nyid la mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gcig nyid la mthong ba yin la /
translated: Just as the external moon itself is seen as two moons due to the appearance of two, in the same way, consciousness itself is seen as two, the aspect of the object and the aspect of the cognizer, in a single consciousness.

original: yul gyi rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang tha dad kho nar snang ba yin no zhes 'ga' zhig 'chad pa sun dbyung ba'i don du phyogs snga ma brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang tha dad kho nar snang ba yin no zhes 'ga' zhig 'chad pa sun dbyung ba'i don du phyogs snga ma brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Some explain that the aspect of the object and the nature of the cognition appear as completely different. To refute this, the opponent’s position is stated: “If it is said . . .”

original: de'i zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni ji ltar tha dad par mthong rang bzhin de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni ji ltar tha dad par mthong rang bzhin de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: “In the nature of consciousness” means that the object and cognition appear as different, but their nature is not different.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the line “How could . . .”

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
translated: “By that” means by consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad par ro //
translated: “In the nature of another” means in a different nature.

original: de zhes bya ba rang bzhin la ma rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rang bzhin la ma rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the nature.

original: yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong bar rigs te zhes pha rol gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de re zhig sun 'byin pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong bar rigs te zhes pha rol gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de re zhig sun 'byin pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s position is stated in the line “It is reasonable that a single object is seen as different.” The refutation of this is stated in the line “That is not so.”

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang nyid kyis rang bzhin ci 'dra ba des kyang gzhan rtogs par mi nus na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang nyid kyis rang bzhin ci 'dra ba des kyang gzhan rtogs par mi nus na /
translated: Thus, if one cannot understand another by means of one’s own nature,

original: gzhan gyis lta ba gzhan rtogs par nus re skad na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis lta ba gzhan rtogs par nus re skad na /
translated: how could one understand another by means of the nature of another?

original: des na yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: des na yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba gcig yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Even with regard to a single object, one sees a difference.”

original: lhag ma ni khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni khas len pa nyid do //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: 'o na rnam 'grel 'di'i don ci snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam 'grel 'di'i don ci snyam na /
translated: What then is the meaning of this commentary?

original: des na don 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: gal te tha dad pa mi rtogs na ci zhig rtogs she na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa mi rtogs na ci zhig rtogs she na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not understand a difference, what does one understand?

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba gcig mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba gcig mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Concomitance” means that one sees a single moon.

original: zla ba gnyis pa ni de lta kho na mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa ni de lta kho na mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: “The second moon is seen just as it is” is the exclusion.

original: des na 'di gnyis tha dad do zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis tha dad do zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yin no //
translated: “Therefore, these two are different” is the understanding.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas grub pa'i mtha' byed pa ni de ni de bzhin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas grub pa'i mtha' byed pa ni de ni de bzhin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the response to the qualm Well then... is That is so...

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu zhes bya @301b pa ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu zhes bya @301b pa ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of difference means the cause of the convention of difference.

original: sngon po dang ser po dag ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dag ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs pa tsam yin no //
translated: Blue and yellow are not one because of the difference in their establishment and pleasure. This is merely an assertion.

original: gang gis 'gal ba chos gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'gal ba chos gnas par 'gyur /
translated: By what is the contradiction established?

original: 'di la 'gal ba gang zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba gang zhig yod snyam na /
translated: What contradiction is there here?

original: 'di la 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the contradiction is also.

original: rnam pa gzhan brjod pa ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan brjod pa ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The expression of another aspect is difference... and so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: If... is connected with difference.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
translated: Other... is with the Buddhist.

original: yang ji ltar na 'di ming tsam yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'di ming tsam yin snyam na /
translated: Again, how is this mere name?

original: gal te de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If... is with that.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya'o //
translated: The response to the qualm Well then, how? is At that time.

original: ser po dang mi 'bral ba'i sngon po gang yin pa de nyid khyer la shog ces brjod pa ni sngon po tsam zhig khyer nas 'ongs par mthong gi ser po ni ma yin no zhes brtsad pa la /
analyzed: ser po dang mi 'bral ba'i sngon po gang yin pa de nyid khyer la shog ces brjod pa ni sngon po tsam zhig khyer nas 'ongs par mthong gi ser po ni ma yin no zhes brtsad pa la /
translated: When someone says, Bring me the blue that is not separate from yellow, if one sees that someone has come with just blue, not yellow, one disputes this, saying, You have not brought the yellow.

original: lan ldog pa ni bral ba med pa'i sngon po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ldog pa ni bral ba med pa'i sngon po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is the blue that is not separate from yellow.

original: gal te de ltar yang sngon po dang ser po tha dad pa'i tha snyad mthong ba ji ltar bsgrub snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang sngon po dang ser po tha dad pa'i tha snyad mthong ba ji ltar bsgrub snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, Even so, how can one establish the convention of difference between blue and yellow?

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is The convention of difference.

original: 'on te zhes shes pa gzhan gyis don mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te zhes shes pa gzhan gyis don mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, The object is seen by another consciousness,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de zhes smos te don de'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de zhes smos te don de'o //
translated: the response is that. That is the object.

original: der sngon po'i rnam pa kho na don yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: der sngon po'i rnam pa kho na don yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, In that case, the aspect of blue alone would be the object,

original: de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de zhes gsungs so //
translated: the response is that.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa yang ngo //
translated: The aspect of blue is also that.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ka ba dang bcas par 'dod par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ka ba dang bcas par 'dod par ro //
translated: Otherwise, i.e., if it is supposed to be together with the pillar,

original: rgyur gyur pa phyi'i dngos po 'ga' zhig ma tshang bas gzhan ka bas stong par ka ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa phyi'i dngos po 'ga' zhig ma tshang bas gzhan ka bas stong par ka ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: the cognition in the aspect of the pillar does not arise because of the absence of some external cause, which is empty of the pillar.

original: gal te de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bral ba mthong ba'i shes pa dang gcig nyid yin pas ji ltar don bsgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bral ba mthong ba'i shes pa dang gcig nyid yin pas ji ltar don bsgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if it is so, i.e., if it is the same as the cognition that sees the thing without distinction, how can the object be established?

original: phyi rol gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyis zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “by the external.”

original: de lta bur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Such is the object to be inferred.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: Another, i.e., different from the preceding one.

original: 'o na ji ltar sngar gtan mthong ba med pa'i don rtogs par byed snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sngar gtan mthong ba med pa'i don rtogs par byed snyam na /
translated: But how can the object that was not seen before be cognized?

original: rten gzhan med par zhes smos so //
analyzed: rten gzhan med par zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “without another basis.”

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad sngon ma mthong ba'i don yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad sngon ma mthong ba'i don yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, i.e., if the object is not cognized in all aspects, the object that was not seen before is not cognized.

original: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni gong bu'i rnam par snang ba'i shes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i shes pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni gong bu'i rnam par snang ba'i shes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i shes pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: “By that alone” means that consciousness appearing in the aspect of a collection is not seeing the consciousness that generates it.

original: gong bu'i rnam pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyi rol mthong ba yin te /🔽skyes bu @302a * //
analyzed: gong bu'i rnam pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyi rol mthong ba yin te / skyes bu @302a * //
translated: How can that aspect of a collection be external, since it is the aspect of consciousness?

original: gzhan gyis gong bu'i rnam par snang ba'i shing gi rnam pa skyed par byed pa'i shing mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gong bu'i rnam par snang ba'i shing gi rnam pa skyed par byed pa'i shing mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If another person sees the tree that generates the aspect of a collection,

original: 'di la dpyad zin te /
analyzed: 'di la dpyad zin te /
translated: then this has already been analyzed.

original: des kyang ci ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: des kyang ci ltar mthong ste /
translated: How does he see it?

original: de yang rang gi rnam pa tsam rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rnam pa tsam rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: Because he cognizes only its aspect.

original: gal te yang de tsam gyis rtogs pa yin mod kyi de ltar na yang nyes pa gzhan brjod pa'i don du pha rol nye bar 'god pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yang de tsam gyis rtogs pa yin mod kyi de ltar na yang nyes pa gzhan brjod pa'i don du pha rol nye bar 'god pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though it is understood that it is just that, another objection is raised to state another fault: “By that alone” means by the aspect of the collection.

original: gang la gong bu'i rnam pa can gyi shing du snang ba bskyed pa de nyid kyis phyis shing mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gang la gong bu'i rnam pa can gyi shing du snang ba bskyed pa de nyid kyis phyis shing mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance of the tree as a whole produces the perception of the tree, and later on it produces the perception of the parts,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //🔽phyis mthong ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chug kyang gi sgra'i don to ;
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // phyis mthong ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chug kyang gi sgra'i don to ;
translated: we reply:🔽It is not reasonable that the perception of the parts should occur later,

original: / phyis nyid 'gyur mod sngar gong bu'i rnam pa can gyi shing mthong ba'i dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / phyis nyid 'gyur mod sngar gong bu'i rnam pa can gyi shing mthong ba'i dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: because the perception of the parts does not occur later, even though the perception of the whole does occur later.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why? Because the object is not different.

original: gzhan yang dus phyis 'byung ba'i shing du rtogs pa de yang shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dus phyis 'byung ba'i shing du rtogs pa de yang shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the tree that occurs later is a form of cognition, not an object.

original: des na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag can gyi shing rtogs pa der yang ngo //
analyzed: des na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag can gyi shing rtogs pa der yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the tree that has distinct parts is also a form of cognition.

original: nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the ascertainment is the cause of the form of the cognition as blue or yellow.

original: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol gyi gzhal bya yang rjes su dpag par nus she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol gyi gzhal bya yang rjes su dpag par nus she na /
translated: But how can an external object of knowledge be inferred?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” means:

original: rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi gzhal bya khas len pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi gzhal bya khas len pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that there is no acceptance of external objects in a conceptual cognition.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par gyur na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par gyur na /
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni shes pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni shes pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cause and effect would be cognition.

original: shes pa de dag la yang rigs pa 'di ni sngar 'gyur dgos la /
analyzed: shes pa de dag la yang rigs pa 'di ni sngar 'gyur dgos la /
translated: And in those cognitions, this principle would have to be prior,

original: 'di ni phyis kho na'o zhes bya ba rnam pa nyid yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyis kho na'o zhes bya ba rnam pa nyid yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: and that one would be subsequent, but it is not in terms of the object.

original: des na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag can gyi shing rtogs pa der yang ngo //
analyzed: des na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag can gyi shing rtogs pa der yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, even in the cognition of a chariot with unmixed parts,

original: nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of ascertainment is the cause of the aspects of blue and yellow.

original: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol gyi gzhal bya yang rjes su dpag par nus she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol gyi gzhal bya yang rjes su dpag par nus she na /
translated: Well then, how can an external object be inferred?

original: rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi gzhal bya khas len pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi gzhal bya khas len pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that there is no acceptance of external objects in a conceptual cognition.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par 'gyur na /
translated: If external objects do not exist,🔽then the cause and effect would be cognition.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Cause and effect would not be known.

original: shes pa de dag la yang rigs pa 'di ni sngar 'gyur dgos la /
analyzed: shes pa de dag la yang rigs pa 'di ni sngar 'gyur dgos la /
translated: And in regard to those cognitions, this principle must have operated previously,

original: 'di ni phyis kho na'i zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi nges pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni phyis kho na'i zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi nges pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir /
translated: and this one only later. Since there is no such certainty,

original: 'bras bu med cing rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med cing rgyu yang med do //
translated: there is no effect and no cause.

original: nges pa med pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa med pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate the absence of certainty,

original: 'di ltar zhes @302b bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes @302b bya ba'o //
translated: he says, “in this way.”

original: de las ni so sor snang ba las so //
analyzed: de las ni so sor snang ba las so //
translated: From that, from the individual appearances.

original: ser por snang ba las ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ser por snang ba las ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the appearance as yellow,

original: sngon por snang ba ni rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i sngon por snang ba nyid ser por shes pa de'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon por snang ba ni rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i sngon por snang ba nyid ser por shes pa de'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the appearance as blue, which is blue without being associated with consciousness, would be the cause of the cognition of yellow.

original: yang ji ltar de ser por snang ba dang bral snyam na ser po med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar de ser por snang ba dang bral snyam na ser po med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And how could that be without the appearance of yellow? He says, “because there is no yellow.”

original: gal te de'i tshe ser po yod pa yin na ni de dang lhan cig pa'i sngon po'i shes pa nyid ser po'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe ser po yod pa yin na ni de dang lhan cig pa'i sngon po'i shes pa nyid ser po'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If yellow exists at that time, then the consciousness of blue, which is simultaneous with it, would be the cause of the consciousness of yellow.

original: 'o na tshul 'dis sngon por snang ba nyid ser por shes pa'i rgyur gyur la rag go snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na tshul 'dis sngon por snang ba nyid ser por shes pa'i rgyur gyur la rag go snyam na /
translated: But in this way, the appearance as blue itself would be the cause of the consciousness of yellow.

original: de la yang nges pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang nges pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, “It is not ascertained.”

original: ci'i phyir nges pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges pa med snyam na /
translated: Why is it not ascertained?

original: gang gi phyir ser por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa de las kyang sngon por snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ser por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa de las kyang sngon por snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousness that appears as yellow also appears as blue.

original: phyi'i don gyi phyogs la yang nyes pa 'dir ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi phyogs la yang nyes pa 'dir ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: In the case of external objects, why would this fault not also arise?

original: der zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, “There, too.”

original: ser po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa sngon po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa la'o //
analyzed: ser po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa sngon po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa la'o //
translated: There means in the case of the consciousness of blue, which is the antecedent of the consciousness of yellow.

original: gal te de lta na yang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig kho na las sngon po dang ser po'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig kho na las sngon po dang ser po'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how could a consciousness of blue and a consciousness of yellow arise from a single similar immediately preceding condition, such as yellow?

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: The root text states, “because of the expression ‘similar immediately preceding condition.’”

original: mya ngan gyi yul la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i dum bu la sogs pa chung du las kyang ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi yul la gnas pa'i rdo rje'i dum bu la sogs pa chung du las kyang ngo //
translated: Even from a small cause, such as a piece of diamond that is the object of grief,

original: bzlog par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa skye ba ni'o //
analyzed: bzlog par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa skye ba ni'o //
translated: the effect does not arise in reverse.

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni myu gur snang ba la'o //🔽gang la du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi mer snang ba yod pa ni ma yin no nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni myu gur snang ba la'o // gang la du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi mer snang ba yod pa ni ma yin no nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The root text states, “from that,” that is, from the appearance of a sprout.🔽The root text states, “where there is smoke, there is not necessarily the appearance of fire elsewhere,” because there is no certainty.

original: gang na du bar snang ba yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur rang gi mer snang ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang na du bar snang ba yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur rang gi mer snang ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no certainty that where the appearance of smoke exists, the appearance of fire necessarily exists.

original: 'brel pa la sogs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation, etc., are impossible.

original: ci'i phyir blo nyid la brten nas de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir blo nyid la brten nas de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one posits it in that way in dependence on cognition itself and not otherwise?

original: gang gi zhen snang ba nyid dgos kyi mi snang ba'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi zhen snang ba nyid dgos kyi mi snang ba'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: The appearance itself is the purpose, not the object that does not appear.

original: des na snang ba nyid la brten nas rnam par 'jog pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na snang ba nyid la brten nas rnam par 'jog pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to posit it in dependence on appearance itself.

original: 'on te gal te don med na de'i tshe snang ba nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gal te don med na de'i tshe snang ba nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the object does not exist, then at that time appearance itself will not exist.

original: des na snang ba khas blang pa'i don du yang gdon mi za bar don khas blangs bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na snang ba khas blang pa'i don du yang gdon mi za bar don khas blangs bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to accept appearance, one must undoubtedly accept the object.

original: 'di ltar zhes @303a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes @303a * //
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gsungs so // snang ba med par yang don 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsungs so // snang ba med par yang don 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: “Even if the object does not exist, appearance itself would exist.”

original: des na snang ba dang bral ba'i don nyid khas blang bar bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: des na snang ba dang bral ba'i don nyid khas blang bar bya'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, one should accept the object that is devoid of appearance.

original: snang ba med na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba med na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If there is no appearance,🔽it is said: “If there is no appearance, the object would not exist.”

original: snang ba dang bral ba'i phyi rol ni khas blang bar mi nus pa kho na'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba dang bral ba'i phyi rol ni khas blang bar mi nus pa kho na'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to accept an external that is devoid of appearance.

original: sa bon du snang ba dang bral ba'i myu gu 'ba' zhig snang bar 'gyur na myu gur snang ba rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon du snang ba dang bral ba'i myu gu 'ba' zhig snang bar 'gyur na myu gur snang ba rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sprout were to appear devoid of the appearance of the seed, the appearance of the sprout would be causeless.

original: myu gur snang ba'i rgyu med pa ga bon du snang ba med kyang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gur snang ba'i rgyu med pa ga bon du snang ba med kyang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of the appearance of the sprout would not exist, even though the appearance of the seed would not exist.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the doubt that the opponent himself is a Buddhist is “If you say that. . . .”

original: myu gur snang ba de na skyes bu gzhan gyi sa bon du snang ba yod pas na'o //
analyzed: myu gur snang ba de na skyes bu gzhan gyi sa bon du snang ba yod pas na'o //
translated: Because the appearance of the sprout would exist due to the existence of the appearance of the seed of another person.

original: 'di phyi rol po 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di phyi rol po 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation of the opponent.

original: de gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi snang ba yod do zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi snang ba yod do zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no certainty that the appearance of the seed of another person exists.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas de yang mtshungs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas de yang mtshungs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, “That is also the same.”

original: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni phyis nyid yod mod /
analyzed: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni phyis nyid yod mod /
translated: The response has already been given, namely, that the seed exists later.

original: sngar go yod par ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba der ro //
analyzed: sngar go yod par ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba der ro //
translated: How is it established that it was perceived earlier?

original: 'bras bu grub pa myu gu las mi snang ba yang sa bon yod par shes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa myu gu las mi snang ba yang sa bon yod par shes so //
translated: The result of the seed, i.e., the sprout, is not perceived, but the seed is known to exist.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni snang ba sa bon la sogs pa yang khyad par 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na 'di 'gog pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni snang ba sa bon la sogs pa yang khyad par 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na 'di 'gog pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is argued that the appearance of the seed, etc. is also seen at the time of apprehending the difference, this is refuted by the statement, “But then, etc.

original: gal te phyi rol ni don dam pa kho na yod pa yin gyi sgro btags pa tsam du ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol ni don dam pa kho na yod pa yin gyi sgro btags pa tsam du ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that the external object alone exists ultimately, but not as a mere superimposition,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su smos so //
translated: it is said that at the time of inference,

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa las so //
translated: “another” means that which produces smoke.

original: don yang gzhan nyid de skad cig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yang gzhan nyid de skad cig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is also different, because it is momentary.

original: gang gis du ba bskyed pa nyid ni de tshe yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis du ba bskyed pa nyid ni de tshe yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which produces smoke does not exist at that time.

original: de yang ni phyi la yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni phyi la yang ngo //
translated: And that is also external.

original: ji ltar ngas mthong ba'i zla ba gnyis po gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang yin no zhes don dam par tha dad par yang tha snyad du 'gyur ba de bzhin du bdag gis du ba las dpag pa'i mer snang ba gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang
analyzed: ji ltar ngas mthong ba'i zla ba gnyis po gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang yin no zhes don dam par tha dad par yang tha snyad du 'gyur ba de bzhin du bdag gis du ba las dpag pa'i mer snang ba gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang
translated: Just as the two moons that I see are the very same ones that he sees, and they are also different in the ultimate sense, in the same way, the fire that is inferred from the smoke that I see is the very same one that he sees,🔽and he sees the very same one that I see.

original: rtogs so zhes gzhan la yang zhes bya ba snang ba gcig nyid la yang tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs so zhes gzhan la yang zhes bya ba snang ba gcig nyid la yang tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the conventional expression “I see” and “he sees” are used for the very same appearance.

original: phyi nas nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i nyid du'o //
analyzed: phyi nas nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i nyid du'o //
translated: “Later” means after the inference.

original: rtogs par zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tshe rtogs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tshe rtogs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: “Is understood” means is understood at all times.

original: de lta na yang rjes dpag dus su sngar ma rtogs pa na don thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes dpag dus su sngar ma rtogs pa na don thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, when the inference is made, all objects are understood in all their aspects, even though they were not understood previously.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa @303b las 'ga' zhig 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa @303b las 'ga' zhig 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How then could there be any engagement on the basis of inference?

original: ma rtogs par rang bzhin 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs par rang bzhin 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object that is not understood.

original: sngar nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus nyid du'o //
analyzed: sngar nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus nyid du'o //
translated: “Previously” means at the time of inference.

original: 'on te me nyid gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa des na yod pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te me nyid gzhan gyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa des na yod pa yin snyam na /
translated: But if you think that fire exists because it is understood to be the essence of something else,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says “by the essence of something else.”

original: des zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi sems so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi sems so //
translated: “That” refers to the mind of another.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis smras pa ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis smras pa ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the opponent says, “That is not so.”

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus na don med kyi 'on kyang 'jug pa'i de ma thag yod na de'i tshe phyis 'jug pa'i dus su don dam par 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus na don med kyi 'on kyang 'jug pa'i de ma thag yod na de'i tshe phyis 'jug pa'i dus su don dam par 'chad pa ste /
translated: If it is meaningless at the time of inference, but if it exists immediately before engagement, then at the time of engagement it is explained to be ultimately existent.

original: sngar gyi dus su gnas pa'i skad cig gzhan gyis ma bskyed par ji ltar min zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gyi dus su gnas pa'i skad cig gzhan gyis ma bskyed par ji ltar min zhe na /
translated: But how could it not be produced by another moment that exists previously?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de med par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de med par zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the response is “Without it.”

original: gang gi tshe med par gyur pa de'i tshe sngar med pa'i me de med pa nyid rnam par chad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe med par gyur pa de'i tshe sngar med pa'i me de med pa nyid rnam par chad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: When it does not exist, how could the previous nonexistence of fire, which is nonexistent, be interrupted?

original: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa rnam par chad pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po yang 'gyur bas skyon ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa rnam par chad pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po yang 'gyur bas skyon ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, just as a non-thing would be a thing, so a thing would be a non-thing. What is the error?

original: gang gi tshe rnam par chad par ji ltar yod ces 'don pa de'i tshe ni 'di rtsod pa smra ba'i tshig nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par chad par ji ltar yod ces 'don pa de'i tshe ni 'di rtsod pa smra ba'i tshig nyid de /
translated: When the text reads “how could it exist as a thing that is discontinuous?,” then this is the very statement of the opponent’s argument.

original: sngar yod pa'i me de med par rnam par chad pa'i me de yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar yod pa'i me de med par rnam par chad pa'i me de yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning? It is this: How could the fire that exists earlier exist as the fire that is discontinuous and nonexistent?

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the one who holds the philosophical position says, “If . . .”

original: sngar gyi med snang ba de kho nas mer snang ba de bskyed la /
analyzed: sngar gyi med snang ba de kho nas mer snang ba de bskyed la /
translated: The fire that existed earlier is the cause of the appearance of fire that appears later.

original: bar du mi chad pa'i rgyu bag chags yod pa yin no //🔽'di la pha rol gyis de lta yin yang zhes smras so //
analyzed: bar du mi chad pa'i rgyu bag chags yod pa yin no // 'di la pha rol gyis de lta yin yang zhes smras so //
translated: The cause that is the latent predisposition exists without interruption in between.🔽Here, the opponent says, “Even if that is so . . .”

original: lan ni don la yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan ni don la yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is “In fact . . .”

original: zhugs pa'i de ma thag pa'i mthong ba'i me ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i ma mthong ba dang gcig yin par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i de ma thag pa'i mthong ba'i me ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i ma mthong ba dang gcig yin par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The fire that is seen immediately after the fire that is inferred cannot be understood to be the same as the fire that is not seen at the time of inference.

original: der gnas pa zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba der gnas pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: der gnas pa zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba der gnas pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “Just as it is in the case of the appearance of something else” means just as it is in the case of the appearance of something else that is not fire.

original: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dang rnam par shes par smra ba dag la'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dang rnam par shes par smra ba dag la'o //
translated: “In these two cases” means in the case of the external object and consciousness.

original: mer snang ba la me'i bag chags rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod nas du bar snang ba la yang brjod pa ni du bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mer snang ba la me'i bag chags rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod nas du bar snang ba la yang brjod pa ni du bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the case of the appearance of smoke” means that the appearance of smoke is the cause of the cognition of the latent potentiality of smoke.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ji ltar phyi rol rgyu nyid du mi 'thad de de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ji ltar phyi rol rgyu nyid du mi 'thad de de ni bstan zin to //
translated: “This has been explained” means that it has been explained that the external object is not tenable as a cause.

original: de nyid ces bya ba du bar snang ba nyid du ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba du bar snang ba nyid du ba yin no //
translated: “That itself” means that the appearance of smoke is smoke.

original: de lta yin dang de nyid ces bya bar sngar bshad pa nyid ces rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de nyid ces bya bar sngar bshad pa nyid ces rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no //
translated: “In that case” means that the cause and effect are as previously explained.

original: de'i bya ba du ba'i bag chags sad pa'i rjes su @304a * //
analyzed: de'i bya ba du ba'i bag chags sad pa'i rjes su @304a * //
translated: “The activity of that” means the activity of the appearance of smoke.

original: mthun pa nyid ces so //
analyzed: mthun pa nyid ces so //
translated: “In accordance with” means in accordance with the latent impressions of the appearance of fire.

original: du ba yang zhes bya ba ni du ba yang mer snang ba'i bag chags sad pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba yang zhes bya ba ni du ba yang mer snang ba'i bag chags sad pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Smoke” means that smoke also is in accordance with the activation of the latent impressions of the appearance of fire.

original: du ba rgyu nyid yin na yang du ba de las 'bras bu me nges par rtogs pa ga la yod ce na /
analyzed: du ba rgyu nyid yin na yang du ba de las 'bras bu me nges par rtogs pa ga la yod ce na /
translated: Even if smoke is the cause, how can the effect, fire, be ascertained from that smoke?

original: bag chags de yang zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags de yang zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: “That latent impression” means that which generates the appearance of fire.

original: tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni du bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni du bar snang ba'o //
translated: “Is valid knowledge” means the appearance of smoke.
